text: Seems like the menu has been overhauled since I last dined here a couple of years ago. But NBD. We skipped the appetizers, knowing that our entrees would be plenty filling. The tasty appetizer selection is worth considering, though, if you're at Flo's with a fairly big party. We liked all of our dishes -- the spicy bean curd, the shrimp and pan-fried noodles and the chicken vindaloo, with the latter being maybe the weakest of the bunch. With it being early and uncrowded on a hot and humid evening, the wait staff was friendly and very attentive. Try out this location before the snowbirds return.

I love this place! Great flavor in all the dishes I've tried, my all time fave is the Chinese Lettuce Wraps! Lunch is definitely the best time to go, excellent portions and affordable prices. I plan on working my way down the entire lunch menu! Walking in, the lighting is beautiful and natural because of the big windows, it's super open space, high ceilings, cute decor, this place is modern and lovely. All the servers have been genuine and kind also!   Highly recommend for a quick bite, or even a nice family friends dinner :)

The happy hour menu is a real bargain. I went alone tonight. I was seated right by the kitchen even though there were other small tables in better locations. I know I could (should) have asked to be moved but I figured maybe there would be a crowd later on and when I'm alone I don't get very picky. I was apparently assigned to a busy waiter who was annoyed at having to serve me. He took my order after about ten minutes making it clear that he was in a rush.   I didn't see him again except once when he refilled my soft drink. Others bring the items when they're ready. They brought out two of the three appetizers I had ordered in reasonable time. I knew the third one - the chicken wings - take 20 minutes to prepare so I waited. And waited. Didn't see my waiter. After 40 minutes the bus boy asked me if I wanted any boxes for my leftovers. I told him I still didn't have all my order. He went to check it out. Only then did my waiter come (actually about another five minutes later) to tell me it would be just a few more minutes. I told him to just forget them and bring me the check.   He seemed reluctant to do that maybe because it would reflect on his service. But he did. So, I got a pretty good albeit a pretty small meal for about ten bucks. Because I feel sorry for people who have to make a living as servers I still have him a five dollar tip.   The other problem with Flo's is that, other than a few appetizers, the rest of their dishes aren't even mediocre.   The two appetizers you should try are the shiu Mai and the chicken wings. The calamari is tasty but often too chewy.
One of the best chinese spots I've been to anywhere. The prices can be a little high for takeout chinese but other than that the food is absolutely delicious.  I recommend it all the time to friends.

We arrived shortly after 3:30, got sat on a tiny table and were ignored for almost 20 minutes. Plenty of staff running around, it must have been shift change as nobody wanted to serve us. The noise level was terrible, like sitting in an echo chamber. We left and had a great meal at Tokyo Joes across the street.

My husband and I just moved to the area so we went to Flo's for the first time. The reviews were spot on. Great food, service, and atmosphere. I love that there is a lot of tables, but the way they have them arranged I didn't feel like I was sitting right on top of someone else. Mitch our server was great. Very attentive, but not annoying. The only complaints I have is no WiFi, and the yoga pants the hostess was wearing. Not appropriate for such a classy place. Other than that we had a great time, and a great meal.
Did carryout and the food was great...glad to see in Tempe!

Food is alright. Ambiance is boring. Service is always great though! Good happy hour menu. I do like that they have a bar area with a couple of tv's. I just wish they had better food options (like sushi) and a better ambiance.
Love this place. Favorite menu item : unbreaded orange chicken! It's amazing! You will not be disappointed.

Soooo tasty! And the service is great, even when the restaurant is super busy. I love the salad before you get your order too (always free, and always included) - there's nothing better than sitting down to instant food rather than having to wait for your order of appetizers to arrive.

Eh...so so.  Service was speedy but...they are running so fast they're doing sort of drive by service so you can't get their attention if you need something, and there were a number of things I would have asked for. Won ton soup made with water not broth.  Won tons weren't wrapped properly so they fell apart and veggies were far too crispy in the soup.  They didn't serve it in a proper little bowl with a Chinese soup spoon.  It was a regular old American soup spoon.  Not fun.  They wrapped the moo shu pork for you, and then gave you sauce to dip it in which takes all the fun out of wrapping it yourself.  The plum sauce was so salty it was not enjoyable.  I needed a gallon of water to drink after a few bites of that, but I couldn't get a server to stop running past my table.  No tea offered to start???    I saw a couple drinking tea out of coffee mugs.  That is just WRONG! at a Chinese restaurant.  I don't recommend Flo's.

I would give this place 3.5 stars if it were an option, because the food is good but they fall behind in other areas. For starters, their prices are a little too high compared to other similar restaurants. Second, although their food is very good, it is inconsistent. I haven't really had issues with their service, although we usually get take-out with them. I definitely suggest they lower their prices a bit, but overall a good place to get lunch.

So I have decided to make a yelp account after my most recent unfortunate experience at flos. My family loves the food so it Is a popular choice when deciding on dinner! So we decided to go just the other night everything was great until the middle aged busser starts dropping f-bombs loud enough for the whole restaurant to hear... followed by him rambling on in Spanish.... Definitely not a child friendly place anymore... Yikes!!

I have been  coming here regularly for many years and this is one of my favorite restaurants and definitely my favorite Asian restaurant. I rarely stray from the cashew chicken because I love it so much but have had many other dishes that are also very good. The appetizers including lettuce wraps and spring rolls are great. The chocolate won tons for desert are great. I love the atmosphere. The service is usually excellent.

Recipes are generally good and meats usually tender but the best bet is to dine in rather than take-out as over the past six months preparation consistency has slipped and errors on the order are fairly frequent (1 out of 3).  When last I called to report something left out of the take-out order, I received a rude response. I'll avoid the Thompson Peak location and try their Promenade location.

Manager has a lack of knowledge on their food items. I ordered a dish that I've ordered before in the past. This time I told them to go easy on the sauce. Apparently that means serve it plain, no sauce. She told me the dish doesn't have a lot of sauce. When I ordered it the past 3 times, it is drenched in sauce. The dish is good but just needs a little less sauce. I also ordered a gluten free item for my 2 year old like I have been for the past 10 visits. This time I got different noodles. I asked the manager if it was gluten free and she had no idea. She didn't even know they had 2 different type of rice noodles. If a restaurant has specifically noted some items as gluten free, as a manager she should have some knowledge of those items. There was no apology, they offered me a credit. I told them I will only use it at their other location where service is great and I can depend on my food being prepared correctly.

Great place! Happy hour is awesome! It is pretty busy, but we never had to wait for our food or drinks. Great place to bring the little ones as well. They're very accepting of loud noise and some messes:)

Flo's has a great happy hour - $2 beer, half price cocktails and wine, and half price appies which are large and really tasty! The lettuce wraps are substantial and great for sharing. I wasn't a fan of the dumplings, but the chicken satay was great. Some nice noodle dishes on the main menu. Incredibly affordable for what you get. Staff were wonderful!
Service was not good, young teenagers running the place.  Food was ok but there are way better choices than Flos.
Love the Happy Hour! All staff so pleasant and helpful! Flo is a wonderful hostess. Thank you for birthday drinks! :)

Disappointing dinner ~  I can't understand why there was such a long wait to get into this place.  My friend and I likely would have had a better meal over at AJ's.  The acoustics are horrendous - I had to scream at my friend the entire evening.  When we were finally seated, before we could even hang our purses on the back of our chairs, a server was there asking for our order.  Apparently, we were supposed to study the menu during our 40 minute wait.  Clearly wanting to get us in and out, our food arrived a little too quickly.  I had the Curry Vegetables - horrible - some of the veges were way under ripe (broccoli was more white than green) and undercooked (yes, I know they should be crunchy).  The sauce was bland.  Even the rice wasn't good - how does an Asian place screw up rice?  There were no seasonings/condiments on the table other than the obligatory Kikkoman's.  We were ignored until it was check time.  I know it was a busy Friday evening, but that doesn't mean service and food quality should go by the wayside.  Kudos to the owner for actually being there, although it's not really a shock she would like to show her face considering there's two large pictures of her right when you walk in the door.

Major issue with child safety and service. They provided us with two high chairs with broken safety belts. Upon request for replacement, they said that all their chairs have the same problem! Very strange that at some point when they were probably left with a couple good chairs, no one in the management every thought of replacing or fixing the broken chairs. Made the experience so bad since the kids wouldn't stay in the chair and could possible hurt themselves. We left without eating and had to take to-go. No courtesy shown by the manager at the store, except for a couple apologies. Paid a premium on the food to eat at the restaurant with expectations of good CS and ended up eating it at home. Could have just gotten food from a drive through instead.   Only plus was that the food had decent flavor, but have eaten better for the price. Bad management decisions make for bad customer experiences. Hope the restaurant owner understands this. Not going there with kids again for sure. Back to PF Changs!
I love almost all dishes at Flos.  When I crave for Chinese food, I always go to Flos.
I really like this restaurant. The food is delicious and the prices are very reasonable. My favorite dish is the cinnamon shrimp!

Really good food! The calamari was outstanding (it's white meat only served in fillets, not rings...seasoned perfectly). Their happy hour is the best time to go...cheap appetizers that are delicious. Drinks were strong. The service was a little slow. But the food is just amazing. I've been three times now, ordered something different each time, and loved it!

I ate there on a friend's recommendation; I won't be asking for any for anymore recommendations.  The two dishes I tried were both overly salty, I'm guessing to mask the flavor.  The quality of food just wasn't that good.  If you looking for food of this nature (un-authentic Chinese), give Pei-Wei or PF Changs a try instead.  They're much, much better.
My fave of all of the Flos restaurants. Best lunch deal in town and so yummy!

Let me start by saying I love the food at Flo's. I don't think I have ever been disappointed in anything I have ever eaten there. The curries are a standout for me; particularly the Malaysia Cashew Beef and the Green Chicken Curry. Yum. Well, the hubby hated the atmosphere...too noisy due to concrete and scraping of chairs on said concrete...so if we want Flo's for dinner it is carryout only. One of my gal pals is always up for going out to lunch and loves the food at Flo's, too. We go there fairly frequently. Or should I say, we used to go there fairly frequently. Monday was the last straw. We sit down, with menus to the side and start yakking. A minute or two goes by and before our server has even come by, the food runner plunks down our salads and fried won tons. Now mind you, we have not ordered food yet, let alone DRINKS. Are you kidding me? Who serves the salad course before drinks are even ordered? Tacky. Super tacky. We looked at each other incredulously. Now here comes our "charming" server. Who waited on me last time I was there, by the way,  and was every bit as "charming". She opens with: "Are you ready to order" no "Hello", no "May I get you something to drink"...girlfriend is cutting right to the chase. I look up and simply say I would like an iced tea. Gal pal Sue replies, "Yes the same for me". Then Ms Personality asks if we are ready to order. I say "No" as coldly as she asks us. Yuk. What a buzz kill. Okay. Things went fairly fine after that. She came by two more times (with a little less 'tude) and on the third we did order. Of course it came out with lightening speed, and of course it was delicious. It is also such a good deal for lunch with most entrees served with salad coming in at around 7-8 bucks a pop. So, I have a couple of questions: Is the management so bad that they make everybody miserable who work there? And why the rush rush rush? It is a large restaurant, we were there at the tail end of lunch, and clearly not in a hurry. The joint was half empty. I have waited tables and I know that working the lunch shift kind of sucks because you don't turn your tables. But I tip accordingly if I overstay my welcome. Good look doing that at Flo's. We were still in and out of there in less than an hour even with our delay tactics.

Food is generally pretty good but the snotty little brat that answers the phone to take our pick-up order couldn't be more rude and almost ruined our appetite once again. It's a shame how one person can negatively affect a dining experience. The owners should hire someone new before losing more business.
I rated this restaurant so low because we had to wait over an hour for our food, food wasn't bad but the service so bad, not sure I will be going there again.

The food was very delicious and service was excellent. We were a party of ten people and everyone commented on the extensive menu and how pleased they were with the food and drinks. We'll be coming back often. Flo's is very busy around the six o'clock hour, recommend making reservations.

Service is awesome, we loved our server. Gotta say that right away. Food, usually good. Tonight we started with the coconut curry soup which is usually delicious. We get it every time we come in. Tonight it was Very weirdly bland. We mentioned it and sent it back, very nicely. She came back and asked us what was specifically wrong with it (after we'd already specifically told her)  I'm pretty sure the folks in the kitchen made her do that. So, waited forever for it to come back out. It was handed to us by a young man who made a point of saying "coconut curry soup, extra spicy" just to let us know what assholes we are. Anyway, they had remade it and thrown in a handful of jalapenos (not an ingredient of this soup)  we like the server so we said nothing but you know what?  Totally classless and rude.

Meh, not super impressed with this place.  Had the Kung Pao chicken.  Was just OK.  Wasn't spicy at ALL and I wanted at least a little kick!  Chicken was a weird texture.  I wasn't a fan.    I also ordered the Thai Coconut soup and that was OK.... again, not the spice I wanted.  Portions are really decent size though, and service was good.    Probably won't go back cause I just wasn't terribly impressed....

One of the cool perks of being a teacher is that I have really awesome, nice parents who take pity on me because I am pretty much stranded at school with my 35 minute lunch hour, and treat me to fabulous lunches on occasion. Because Flo's is close by I often have parents who treat me to Flo's. They have a really great lunch portion menu and their lunches come with a side salad and the crispy wonton chips. My (new) favorite dish is the Pine Nut Shrimp-absolutely delicious-one of my student's parents brought me this dish last week to celebrate the end of AIMS testing. I don't even mind that  the mere thought of salt makes me blow up like a puffer fish (let's face it-you can't really get away from sodium when it comes to Chinese food). The pine-nut shrimp and Flo's food in general is totally worth it!

Were it possible to give 1/2 star I would! We use to eat at this location frequently up until about 2010. My daughter & I thought we'd go back today. First thing I noticed was menu... limited, but thought we'd try our all time favorite chicken & basil & house fried rice. I decided to try the spicy coconut soup.... wish I hadn't. Not only was the food bland, boring, but I couldn't even eat the soup. It made me sick to my stomach for the rest of the day. Service was horrible & had to wave down "manager" to get the check. One positive was the salad as the dressing was good.  We will not be going back! No one bothered to ask why we left a table full of food & didnt want to take it home.

Yum! A little noisy but I didn't mind. They did forget the tofu on our rice and only brought out one of the two orders of spring roles we ordered.. They were quick to fix their mistake though. It was very good food with very good service!

Used to love this place! Ordered take out a few days ago and was so disappointed. Nothing was great. One of the dishes we ordered had no sauce in it. Pretty much dried noodles and vegetables. To top off the horrible food, it was definitely way too overpriced. 3 meals and a couple appetizers for almost $80. Not worth it.
Best hot and sour soup we've ever had!  It's $5 and easily serves 2 big eaters.  We were there for lunch. Great service too!

Ever since I've been in Phx, I've been looking for good chinese food... Flos is ok, but that's about it. There wasn't anything about the food that wowed me or makes me want to drive up to North Scottsdale again. I will say that the wonton chips are yummy, but that's not enough to keep me going back.
Ate lunch there today . Food is always good. Great hot n sour soup

Last night was my first dining experience at Flo's. The ambience was nice, and our server Emmi, did a great job explaining the menu as well as providing us with great service. We ordered honey beef, Sichuan orange chicken, chicken fried rice and chicken lo mein, and we're pleasantly dazzled with each one.  We'll definitely be back...

Have to knock Flo's down a few notches.  Flo's used to be my go to for take out.   They had really good food for the prices and they had a great kids menu that my boys loved.   I was put off when I called in for take out and was told that prices had gone up, because of new ingredients, and kids items were no longer available for takeout.   They were more than happy to make a kids dish in a regular size and price.    So my normal $35 order went to $60.  The funny thing was that my Pine Nut Shrimp did not taste any better at the higher price and with the new ingredients.  Kids also thought the food was worse without the kids plate.  I know Flo's was always booming, but I am not sure the snowbirds are going to like it when they come back to find they are paying gourmet prices.  I wish Flo's luck, but I have too many other choices at this price point.

What makes Flo's worth the trip is the Happy hour.  You can fill up on appetizer goodies and have a beer or two for a reasonable amount.  The food is average and some of the appetizers are mislabeled if you have Chinese family and are accustomed to the food.  This is not really suprising or even important for a restaurant in the states since not many people would notice and if it's good then so what?  It does make it trickier if there are expectations to be met.  Flo's is by no means authentic but some of the dishes are good for what they are and the ambiance is nice when it's not too loud.

Let me start off by saying I am in the food and beverage industry myself, so I am extremely patient and understanding when it comes to dealing with a busy/ bad server.   However, I only stopped by flo's to order some take-out on a rainy night. When I arrrived, the place was packed and so loud that I coudn't not hear anyone talking to me! I walked up to the bar and waited for about 10 mins (like I said, I get it, there are busy! I can wait my turn) Then the bartneder finally turned to me and asked what i wanted. I said a to-go order and she told me that I would have to go to the hostess station....would have been nice to know 15 mins ago. So after wating in line again, i placed my order, veggie spring rolls and lettcue wraps. They told me it would be ready in 15 mins. I waited in starbucks right next door.   After about 20 mins, I went back to check on my food. I asked a girl up front if it was ready, she said "she didnt do to-go orders" ok??? so i asked another girl up front and she said it wasnt ready yet. After another 15 min wait, I finally asked again if it was ready and they girl turned around and grabbed a bag off the counter and said here it is! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!! IT WAS THERE THE ENTIRE TIME!  I told her my food was now cold and soggy.... but she conviently didn't hear me say it.   I threw it away in the garbage can outside... There goes 15 dollars down the drain.  No wonder the hostess insisted that I paid prior to recieving my food. I'm sure too many unhappy customers would walk out without taking their food home. I would have!!!  I will never go back to Flo's and do not suggust anyone else goes their either. The service is horrible and the food is not worth the $. No wonder they have to give away 5$ lunches. Even if I had complained, I'm not sure anyone would have cared.   Trust me, save your $. You're better off going to Panda Express.

While I don't know if everything here is worthy of 5 stars, the Cashew Chicken that I ordered on Mother's Day was delicious and I would have given it 5 stars by itself! I had plenty leftover for lunch the following afternoon and it was just as good then. While I didn't enjoy the dish that my sister ordered as much (some kind of fried beef covered in sauce), it's one of her favorite dishes here. We had really good service despite it being a busy holiday and got free wontons in chocolate sauce at the end of our meal. The only negative aspect was that we were apparently seated right under an air conditioning vent because it was FREEZING! I overheard the table that was later seated beside us complain to the server that it was too cold, but there wasn't really anything they could or would do about it. All in all, it was one of the better Chinese/Asian restaurants I've tried since moving to Arizona.

Food is still good.  Take out simple order.  Irene gets indignant about my tip.  I get that she is flo top employee  but there is no reason to be indignant toward a customer.  I will limit my visits or take ours from flos accordingly. ... Bad service gets bad results. The food is what earns my review.   Anywhere but vina this is the best chinese food I can get...

Not only is this the best Flo's location, it's the best Chinese restaurant I've found in the city. In fact, it's the best Chinese restaurant I've found outside of San Francisco. The BEST hot and sour soup - the perfect balance of the spicy and sour elements. Everything is extremely fresh and they use high quality ingredients. The service is prompt and friendly, too, so Flo's is a great overall experience.

After a lukewarm initial view of this mini-chain, I've become a believer.  The lunch menu and value can't be beat and the addition  of the happy hour (3-7/7 days a week; 1/2 of alcohol & apps) enters this place into the apres work happy hour rotation. Staff always meets expectations and the food quality is consistent.    The only possible knock (and this is REALLY nit-picking) is that the food is consistent in it's simplicity as well as quality.  Sometimes I wish they'd roll the dice and innovate the menu a little and introduce a few specials (I don't believe they offer any off the menu fare) or seasonal dishes. Strongly suggest trying this place if you haven't, and sit at the bar if you've only experienced the dining room.

Pretty good Chinese food! We've been here a couple of times, and both times the food was good. They give you wontons and a salad right after you order, and the food we had as leftovers heated up very nicely! It tasted almost as good as the food did when it first came out.  Great lunch prices!
You cant beat the price of their food. Good portions and hot/sour soup is always nice on a cold and gloomy day...  My favorite is the Spicy Ginger Onion Beef...
One of the more pleasant happy hour experiences in both food and drinks thus far. Pleased with the service, great atmosphere, and the Sweet and Sour Soup is amazing, any time of year!

My family and I are somewhat "newbies" at Flo's and we love the happy hour. The food is great and service is fantastic. Last Friday we had Katie, she is very knowledgeable and attentive. She seemed as if she has worked there forever! We asked her how long she has worked there, and told us 10 years. She is very genuine which is hard to find in people these days. We told her to not stop smiling because her smile is contagious. Katie's recommendations were spot on! I can see Flo's being a weekly dinner night for our family! Btw Hot and Spicy soup is to die for!

omg...hands down the worst chinese food I've ever had anywhere.  Stopped by for lunch with my wife.  I ordered their cashew chicken dish and my wife ordered the pad thai noodles with shrimp.  Barely edible.  Makes Panda Express look like gourmet chinese food.  Prior to Flo's, the distinction of the worst chinese food went to a chinese restaurant in Nebraska...but that's Nebraska.  I'm chinese and live in San Francisco so know a thing or two about good chinese food.

We have been eating at Flo's regularly since the tempe location opened. We are big fans of the other ones in Scottsdale.  The food at this location is soooo delicious!!!!  The waiters are  friendly and the manager usually comes around to see if the customer is being taken care of.  Best appetizers and great happy hour! (strong drinks)  Con: It is a bit loud in there.

Not a fan of the new menu. The calamari is gone and so is Chef Danny's lemon pepper chicken. Chef Danny is completely off the menu. The new 1 sheet menu must cost less to print. But prices are higher to compensate!

We moved here from Hong Kong a few years ago and were introduced to Flo's by our long time resident friends.  Mind you, we lived in one of the culinary capitals of the world, where the best of any food can be found.  Also, I am American and my wife is Chinese.  Flo has a fun and varied menu.  We are sure that the Western palate leans toward Orange Chicken and General Tsao's Chicken, along with Spring Rolls and Fortune Cookies.  However, the menu has a variety of well-prepared and tasty dishes with noodles and the spicier items being quite appetizing.  So, for those of you who have written less than positive reviews, you have certainly limited yourselves to a narrow sampling of Flo's.  The iconic Saturday Lunch, yes, has increased in cost and the portions may be smaller but, come on, what more could you ask for at $6? Flo has given us a unique place to savor Asian dishes at, realistically, economic costs.  We, for one (and our feelings are shared by our group of friends) enjoy a periodic Happy Hour at Flo's and stopping by for a nice lunch on a Saturday, while running errands.  Thank you, Flo....................GRW

Great lettuce wraps! I get the Thai ones, although the build your own Chinese ones are good too. The pad thai here is perfect, but the cinnamon shrimp is a must-try if you like cinnamon. They're not kidding, either, it is spicy, which isn't usually what you associate with cinnamon. The chile orange chicken is really good too. I get take-out from here and it's always good, although once or twice they've forgotten an extra order of sauce I asked for. In-restaurant service is very good.

This place drives me crazy. Its not cheap and the kids working in there are so rude. We order for take out a lot and more Times than not the food is just thrown in there and the sauces leak everywhere.  They never give extra sauce or more than 1 fortune cookie.
Went here once.  Fresh summer rolls were poorly made, way too big to eat, not very good.  Egg drop soup was pretty good, but too salty.  My credit card was overcharged $3.  I won't be back.

I'm giving one star because the TAKE OUT SERVICE sucks.  The last two times they have forgotten something in our order.  They tie knots in the bags when you pick it up and even when you verify the order with them verbally there is still something missing. We have had problems in the past but I never posted a review but since it was two times in a row I think it's time they get their act together.  The first time I ordered a side salad and chips to go with our entrees but they were not in the bag when I got home.  Since it was just a salad and chips I opted not to go back and pick it up.  This last time we ordered lettuce wraps but when I got home the chicken filling was not in the bag.  I called to let them know I was coming back to get it.  The first girl I talked to asked me to double check to be sure I didn't have it.  Then she put me on hold and another person came on the line and described what kind of package it would be in and asked me if I was sure it wasn't included.  REALLY?  We didn't order that much food that the container would be sitting in front of me and I didn't see it!  I told them we definitely didn't have it and I wanted to come and get it.  When I got back to the restaurant they had it ready for me but just barely apologized and didn't offer to refund my money for the inconvenience or even offer a coupon or discount on my next visit.  Since my family was at home waiting to eat and the food was getting cold I opted not to talk to the manager.  I just didn't feel like dealing with it.  So unless you insist that the bags are not tied up when you go to pick up or make them untie everything to verify beware you may be missing something in your order when you get back home.  One other thing....their interpretation of SPICY is actually MILD.  Every time I have ever ordered something that says spicy on the menu it has not been even remotely spicy.  I always have to add hot mustard or chili to it.

The hot and sour soup is da bomb!  Seriously the best I've ever had.  It's full of tender shrimp and chopped green onions that give it some great freshness.  The large bowl that serves 4 people is only $5.  It's so good, I could eat the whole thing myself.  We were there with 6 people and all ordered different entrees.  Garlic chicken stir fry, Sweet & Sour Chicken, Lemon Pepper Chicken, General's Chicken (not spicey enough), Kung Pao Chicken (not spicey enough either).  The Garlic chicken stir fry was the best.  If you like spice, ask them to make your entree more spicy, as everything is pretty mild.  There is also a secret menu, so if you have some Chinese favorites that aren't on the menu, ask your server.  The chicken is very high quality and I believe all white meat.  I will go back for the soup and garlic chicken stir fry, and get more recommendations from the servers.  This will definitely be my go-to Chinese restaurant.
Very good food.  Nice menu with many choices.  I have enjoyed every item I have tried.
Typical fusion Asian food.  Nothing special.  Spicy foods are mild at most.  If you're tired of pei wei maybe give this place a shot?

This place is a must!! Excellent happy hour prices, great portions, and nice place. The chicken lettuce cups(wraps) were $3.50 on happy hour and it was delicious!!  Happy hour is everyday from 3-7 pm.

The best Chinese food we have had in the USA..the quality is good, the portions great .the service good.went for dinner with apprehension but came back satisfied.the hot and sour soup had good flavours three of us shared one order.the chicken lomen ..good

I don't know what I would do without Flo's... My husband and I are frequent visitors (almost weekly) simply because it's an easy walk from our home. The food is delicious, the portions are generous, and the staff is always friendly and speedy. Some of the best Asian food I've  had!

This place is fantastic! Don't bother with a menu, just get the Dan Dan Noodles and enjoy your meal, some of the best flavoring I've had! Super generous portions as well, we also had the cashew beef and the side of brown rice was the equivalent of a whole pot of rice!! I'll definitely be back when I'm in Chandler the next time!

Having lived in the near Flo's for over ten years, we frequently (twice per month) have gone there or ordered via telephone since that time.  Most of the time service is good; however, I have had my trepidation since they typically hire 14-16 year old employees working at the counter.  Tonight, I ordered sizzling rice soup via phone and when I got home it was definitely not sizzling rice soup.   When I called letting them know there was a mistake, I was placed on hold and then the gal who took the order got on the line, and said, "I repeated your order twice, and that is what you ordered."  I was taken aback, since that is not what I ordered and it was not repeated.  Again, since I have ordered here, so many times, I expected to politely disagree with her assessment, and then be compensated for what I ordered, however, she was really rude.  At that point, I hung up and agreed with my wife to not order from Flo's again.  I was so frustrated that they would argue over something like $2 or $3 difference in price for a long time customer.  Now,  they lost over $100 per month (small, I know), but my neighbors and customers will also learn about the rudeness and arguing that occurred. Again, I am usually very tolerate, but don't need to be treated like a moron (and basically called a liar) to pay money for food.

4/4/11: I've been enjoying food from Flo's since 1998. I get takeout because it is loud in restaurant. Spring rolls are my favorite appetizers - I get two orders so I can eat one on way home. I like various dishes especially when they are willing to cook off menu (like chicken with snow peas).  Subtracted one star for noisy atmosphere
My husband and I tried Flo's this weekend. We chose takeout and unfortunately there was a minor error on our order. That was addressed but the food was bland

Dear Flo- It's not you, it's me.  I just can't justify spending $14.95 for lo mein, then being charged an additional $2.00 for extra vegetables and all you add is three pieces or broccoli.  Our last dinner came to nearly $50, to-go with only two items.   We ordered the chicken fried rice several times and the chicken was rubbery and definitely not what we've come to expect.  I'm sorry Flo, after nearly eight years I'll miss our weekly date, but the updated menu pricing and lower quality food is forcing me to look elsewhere.

I've always been a big fan of Flo's growing up in the valley. I just visited the Tempe location, visiting from New York, and picked up a to go order for me and my friends (mu shu, katsu chicken, lo mein, pad Thai, and beef noodle soup). We get home to discover there are no pancakes for our mu shu. We call to let the restaurant know only to be asked if we "actually checked for the pancakes"  after being put on hold. After telling the hostess answering the phone we didn't have a car to come get the pancakes (visiting/hotel = no car) she said "there is really nothing I can do for you then." Disappointed in the customer service to say the least.

My family in Arizona recently discovered this place through word-of-mouth, and when I arrived to visit them we went here to eat lunch after they picked me up at the airport. My brother and I split a giant bowl of pho (my mother, the vegetarian, passed because it had a meat broth). The pho was wonderful and came with a plate of add-ins and sauces, plus smaller bowls for us to ladle our individual portion into.  We also ordered entrees which were good, solid versions of Asian food.  My mother, the vegetarian who also wants gluten-free food, was a little disappointed because her entree came with noodles, which she was not expecting and was unwilling to eat. That having been said, she didn't ask the server about gluten-free options before ordering, and there may have been some. If you are averse to eating gluten, you might want to ask before ordering.  Flo's wasn't crowded at 1 pm when we were there, but I'm told it does get crowded at other times.  It was a great place for me to eat and enjoy the sunshine and appreciate being on the ground again, and I hope to go back!

went for dinner on 6-6-15. been eating here since she opened. ordered shrimp & long beans. shrimp was very small and overcooked. very hard. order this all the time, never so bad. also ordered shrimp & eggnoodles. same thing. shrimp was very small & overcooked. very hard. she used to use very large shrimp and were never overcooked. whats the chances both dishes had small shrimp and both overcooked? wow! lettuce cups are the best u can find. moouse is the best 2. but at $6 is a bit pricey. used 2 be $4. wonder what happened to flos? mayb gonna close when they move 2 tempe? have 2 look 4 another good chinese place.

Not fit for human being -- I ended up throw away all take out I've ordered.  Worst Chinese food I've ever seen. Yes I am Chinese.  Yes I've eaten both authentic as well as Americanized Chinese food; of which both can be good.   The food here is growse.... Yuk~

Went to Flo's in Tempe for the first time, it was Halloween evening, so we were served by a very tall hot dog w/mustard, the service was good, thank you Andrew! We started off w/two glasses of wine and the vegetable potstickers, they were about the best I've had and the dipping sauce was delicious. I ordered the Spicy Cinnamon Shrimp, it was beyond  excellent, very rich  and completely different than any dish I have ever eaten, this alone will keep me coming back to Flo's! The fried strips of crepe were a nice added touch to the dish and yummy. i needed a box to take the leftovers home. My dinner companion had the Pine nut Shrimp and said it was a bit bland but the broccoli was cooked to perfection. The portions are nice, not overly 'loaded' w/food, the prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is comfortable and clean. Only one reason I did not give Flo's 5 stars, we were seated on the southwest side of the restaurant, the sun was going down and I had a choice of the sun in my eyes or beating down on my back, my eyes won that decision but our waiter had to wear sunglasses to serve us, there are no blinds to close. I cannot imagine the summer months with the AZ sun interfering with my dining experience, Flo, call your decorator!

My wife and I have been coming to Flo's for 3 years now and I cannot imagine how anyone would write a negative review!  Those that have any negative thing to say, please stay away so that we can actually get a seat!  The food is always perfect and the prices are great! Word has gotten out about this gem and we have to make sure we get there a little earlier than usual.  We love this place and will be coming back on a regular basis.  Keep up the great work and ignore those that don't appreciate a great atmosphere and amazing food!

My wife and I had lunch yesterday and the food was excellent. I know food tastes are all individual but we both thoroughly enjoyed our meals. When I was about 10 years old friends of my parents (both from China) had us over for  dinner. She had made Beef with Black Bean Sauce. It was excellent and for some reason that is my constant go to meal when in Chinese restaurants. I have to say that the Beef with Black Beans at Flo's is as good as what I had as a kid. I grew up in New York and went to China Town quite frequently so I feel that I have a benchmark to compare it to. My wife usually has the Shrimp Lo Mein and that is what she had yesterday as well. Her meal was excellent. I know there have been changes with the menu and with pricing as well.  I know you no longer get the  bowl of chips and the hot dipping sauce for free but you can get a small portion of the chips and hot dipping sauce at no charge if you ask for it. I do feel that $1 is worth the price if you want a larger portion of the Chips.  Our server was Danielle. There was no need to go over the menu as we both knew what we wanted. Danielle was very attentive and  and checked on us a number of times during the meal to make sure everything was tasting good. Even though  the prices have gone up somewhat, what business hasn't raised prices, but it is well worth it. Looking forward to our next trip to the valley and our next enjoyable meal at Flo's Great meal!!
Uninspired. From the food to the staff, just another mediocre Chinese restaurant in the valley. I expected something better.
I eat here on a regular basis. Kung Pao Chicken is the best in Scottsdale. Service is always incredible. Pot Stickers are fantastic. You will not be disappointed.
Super fresh Chinese food. They also did an A+ job with our call in take out order. Super cool customers and a great happy hour with a happy hour food menu

Time to find a another place for Asian food. I loved the previous menu, which separated the dishes by origin, noted which items were gluten free and had reasonable prices. I feel like Flo hired a consultant who demolished all that was great and put into effect a menu that lacks many of my previous favorite items, is MUCH smaller in scope, and MUCH more expensive. This was my go-to place for dine in, take out and happy hour. No more! It's a shame because I frequented all of the locations, dating back to the short-lived place in DC Ranch. What I ordered last night for take out was just okay. Miss the old Flo's!
Flo's is great! I go t this restaurant on a regular basis.   They are always quick and courteous. The food is consistently great! The prices are reasonable as well.

The place to get Chinese food in the McDowell Mountain ranch area. This place is usually pretty busy. We have been happy with every dish we have gotten there. The hot and sour soup is very good and the spring rolls are awesome.

I've always wanted to try this place, and finally did this weekend.  I usually hesitate to go to "Asian" restaurants.  I prefer to eat at more authentic restaurants that focus on a certain food...Indian, Korean, Vietnamese, etc.. you get the picture.  I was pleasantly surprised to realize that we went here during happy hour (Sunday at 4) and got 50% off drinks and apps.  I had the green curry, which was good, gf had shrimp lo mein and others had spicy shrimp chow mein and the pepper chicken.  I think the curry was best.  Food was good, not excellent, and overall a decent experience.

Excellent first impression, and on takeout. She had the Fried Honey Beef and I had the Seafood Sizzling Rice Guo Ba. Normally I don't let my first visit anywhere include a seafood dish, but I sure am glad I did. The food was delicious, prepared entirely on time, and the staff was very friendly when I arrived.  We're looking forward to dining in, and expect the next review to become a 5/5 for us. Nice looking place, in and out!

This was our second time visiting Flo's.  We were not impressed.  We ordered the shrimp & snap peas with sauted vegetable and were completely under whelmed.  If you can describe anything less than bland, that would be it.  On a Wednesday night, the place was packed so I was so surprised when we sat down at our table with our to go order and felt I would have better served with Panda Express, which I hate by the way.  The spring rolls that I ordered (thinkin P.F. Chang's) were worse than I could have gotten at Costco for a total of $8 for 4.  I can't recommend it and we won't be back.

Ended up here for Happy Hour last week and was pleasantly surprised.  The HH is a great value.  The drinks were good and we definitely ordered way too much food, expecting the food portions to be small for HH.  Do not make our mistake, order a couple to start and then order more if you need it - I doubt you will.  Wonderful addition to the neighborhood!
Good dinner. Ordered two dishes for takeout which they got wrong, so frustrating to get home and not have what you ordered. Second time we have gotten wrong takeout order.
We ordered two teriyaki lunch specials & they were great for the price. Plus the staff was friendly & helpful.

Tried to have a nice dinner here on a Saturday night, 7:30-ish. Usually have a good experience here for a weekday lunch and knew my son and his fianc√© would like it. However, tonight we had to walk out. No one came to take our order. Even after we politely asked the busboy to ask someone to take our order. It's not like they were busy - pretty empty actually. Just got tiered of waiting and watching the staff walk around setting tables and ignoring us. And as we left, there were two waitpersons just leaning against the wall chatting behind the hostess station. Plenty of other choices in North Scottsdale where you won't be so rudely ignored.

The atmosphere is nice and modern, and you can smell all of the yummy Chinese food when you walk in. I especially love the Beef Chow Mein. The only thing I haven't liked is the Fried Rice, which just seems like white rice with veggies and meat thrown in. Great place for take-out!
Definitely American-style Chinese...no shame in that though, great food here.  Entrees were on the large side though so order to share.

This is probably the best kinda of, fancier then normal, chain Chinese place I have been to that I can remember.  It is way better then Pei Wai and I guess better then P.F. Chang's.  Although, I can't really say that since it has been a while since i have eaten there...So, i would suggest going to Flo's your self and YOU tell me if it's better the P.F. Chang's.  Also, there lunch is WAY cheap, less then $30 for 3 people!!!  Why I didn't give it 5 Stars.  1st time I have been there.  Parking wasn't very good at all.  We had to drive around the small lot a couple times.  People were parking in the fire zone.

I enjoyed this meal. Having ordered the Beef & Wide Noodles, I was glad to see the healthy-sized bowl presented to me. They bury the noodles way down there, but there are plenty. The food is heavily-oiled, but not overly salted.   Fun and entertaining music played at this location. Bright atmosphere; lovin' the windows and the decor. Stylish, clean, with small tables and lots of dining space.

Flo's is nothing more than fast food Chinese with sit down dinning. Food is greasy and tastes of old burnt cooking oil. Sauces are all sugar based, no real flavor. Meats and vegetables are probably mass cooked, sit in bins soaking up the grease and getting stale, then tossed in the syrup when ordered.  As for the happy hour appetizers - you get what you pay for- these are nothing more than food service frozen items.
Service and Food is always excellent. For a sit down quick chinese restaurant you can't beat Flo's

I picked up takeout on Monday and was very surprised at how delicious it was! I really didn't know of many good Chinese in the area and was recommended by a coworker. My boyfriend and I orders of the chicken lo mein and orange chicken to split. Both were very good. I was surprised yet pleased that the orange chicken came with the sauce on the side because takeout chicken with sauce can get so soggy and groos! Thumbs up!

I tried this place again after bad food experiences in the past, and yet again Flos didn't deliver. The hostesses took our pick up order, but left out our lettuce wraps. When I called to have them charge the order back to my card, the hostess was snippy and told me that they could only take down my phone number so that next time I came in to dine there I could get credit. I won't be going back.
I love Flo's! The one at the Promenade is the best! The food is great and the service is always warm and friendly. I highly recommend!
awesome happy hour great service nice and light food always a great standby for any night or the week now they have asahi on tap

Sorry Flo, however this place has really gone down hill. The food has gone down in quality, the service has gone down a few notches and the ambiance has never changed. I have noticed more and more bad reviews for Flo's. Last week was my last time in.

I love Flo's! Sweet and sour soup is the best I've ever had! I convinced my girlfriend who is extremely picky to try it, and she loved it! I enjoy sitting at the bar. This place has a cool atmosphere and the new remodel is inviting.

The first time we came here we had a great experience. The last 3 times, very disappointing.  Take out order was wrong and 2 times, service painfully slow. We sat Dow and I told server 'we're starving. I'll start with the salad rolls please.' 15 minutes later, asked where they were, and she said 'oh I thought you wanted it all together.' A table that came in about 10 minutes after us was served before us.  So by the time I go to eat my appetizer, my warm food was cold.
Love it!  Great food, prices, and service!!  Would recommend for dinein or takeout.

Been eating at Flo's since 2003. Last two times I was disappointed ordered yellow curry one word to describe "horrible", second time I ordered Kung pao chicken after sitting at the table for 15 minutes, when it finally came there was exactly 3 this pieces of chicken. May be I should stop coming here & look for other Asian food choices. Any suggestions?

+.+.+.+.+.+Two Things Have Changed in the Past 30 Days +.+.+.+.+.+.+  PRICES have been  increasing quite frequently ...... and they just did it again. Enough is enough ...... They now have become very expensive. We'll still continue going here ........ reducing our visits by 50%. There's a wonderful Chinese restaurant at Shea and 92nd Street that gives much  larger portions ..... at about the same price as Flo's.  Secondly the remodel is Beautiful ..... However, why wasn't the Rock Concert noise level remedied ?????

I'm not sure if I really know what good Chinese food is... It seems like all my favorite places growing up were soooo delicious. Now I end up at Flo's with coworkers about every other week and really do like it. Maybe it's the comfort of the food? Who knows.  I ate nothing but kung pao the first few times I came here because I loved it. I decided to experiment with the menu a little and so far the pad Thai and twice cooked pork are also delicious. So, either they make good food or I am easily pleased with salty meaty saucy woked food... Hmmm maybe a little of both.   Flo's EXCELS at getting people in and out and I love that as well. The portions are also perfect for lunch and usually under $10 including tip.

I am happy to update my review based on the very positive response by the owner Dustin regarding my visit.  He seemed truly concerned that we had experienced poor service, and insisted on making it right. The food was good overall, despite one issue.  My experience was that we came in for a late dinner, and it felt as if the staff was put out that we were there. When one dish came out wrong, the kitchen tried to say it was the right dish and the server didn't do anything to compensate for the issue. Toward the end of the evening, the server was not around and a busboy loudly stacked dishes behind us and then kept asking to clear dishes before we were done.   While nothing in  that experience would entice me back to Flo's, previous good dining experiences and Dustin's apology and commitment to making things right definitely makes my experience that night seem different from how he and his wife Flo want the restaurant run.

First off, let me say, that Flo's has been one of our favorite restaurants since she opened in the first location years ago.  The quality and the taste of the food is still excellent. The hot and sour soup is delicious and  the best we have ever had.   But, we went there for lunch on Sunday and to our disappointment, the lunch has changed drastically from what we are used to. The salad was very small, they longer serve the "chips" with sweet and sour sauce-which is great for the kids while they wait for the food, and the lunch portion size has decreased significantly. The dish is no longer enough to share, but more like an individual size with a scoop of rice. From a family who looks forward to eating at Flo's a few times a month for lunch, this is a huge disappointment. You have lost a loyal patron on this one, unfortunately.

Food was good, but nothing compared to the location on Frank Lloyd Wright.  Service is EXTREMELY slow.   We came at lunch, and the restaurant was only a 1/3 full.  We got our food before our lunch salads and drinks even made its way to the table.  We had to ask for the status on our soft drinks.  Will stick to my regular location where service is timely, and staff is friendly.
Really poor service. So bad that I can't see us coming back anytime soon. The food just isn't special enough to overcome my bad experience.

What happened??  You took a beat up McDonald's and fashioned it into a nice place to go and have some amazing food.  I loved the food....and the people were awesome!  Seems like for two years things were pretty good..  Glory days!  Then... the wheels fell off.   Maybe it was sold?  Maybe they could not find decent help?  Maybe it's as simple as nobody there gives a crap?    It sure feels a lot less like a nice restaurant and more like a gathering place for a group of people intent on doing as little as possible.  Perhaps if I had not experienced Flo's during it's better days this would not be so obvious or sad.    Went there for dinner a few weeks back and although the place was half full we were seated at a table that had been cleaned by someone with an art background.   Little tidbits and other morsels where thoughtfully scattered on the table and chairs.  The floor was gross.  No other way to describe.  We ordered.  The food did arrive pretty quickly.  So that's good.  Some of it was not what we ordered so a few points off for that.  We called over the waiter who took it back and after a while did bring the correct order.     I will say the crab puffs were pretty good although I do like em chewy.  The best way to describe the food is to say it was ok...but it used to be great.  So the overarching impression as we walked out was this. The hospitality they used to exhibit has lessened greatly over time.   From entry to exit it was clear that taking care of diners was on the list....but not too close to the top.  Combine that with food that used to be awesome and now is average at best and you have a losing combination.    Cannot see any reason to go back....but would like to find one.

Really enjoyed our quick lunch at Flo's. Very good! My panko chicken was excellent and my hubby's teriyaki bowl was delicious.  The salad was great too! Our water was refilled VERY quickly. Will be back.
This place has the BEST happy hour everyday. The food is awesome and the service very good.  Flo's is a great place.

I have been here twice, have to admit the happy hour time was better and the Saturday lunchtime rush wasn't as good.  Perhaps it had to do with the fact that I was missing those delightful fruity drinks that pack such a wallop?  Sea Breeze?  I can't read my handwriting.  :(  THAT'S the sign of a good drink, ha ha, if you can't read your handwriting after two.  Drapps were great, full sized appetizers.  I liked the pot stickers, lettuce wraps, meat on sticks (there should be more meat on sticks in the world).  Sunday evening was great, Saturday lunchtime not really because it was so crowded and I suppose it is just me but I felt rushed though I didn't "have" to be rushed and no, the wait staff did nothing to rush me, it was just the overall atmosphere of Saturday lunchtime.  Yes, I'll return.  For one thing I'm thinking about those pot stickers and now I have a taste for them.  Wonder how they are on Wed. eve?  ;-)

Few words worth spitting back up for this place, but the food certainly is. The last thing I would want to do is write an instruction manual for the management with my review and see this place survive as a result. Rude twenty something server, bland food, sad, sad vibe. Fresh spring rolls, "summer rolls" here, look like dog turd with worms. Wierd culture. Staff seemed miserable. Don't eat here if you value your time or money.   [Let's see if this gets removed by yelp like my wife's did]
Visiting from our of town. Went to Flo's for dinner with a group of 8. Great food, quick service great ambiance. Definitely would return.

I loved the food . Specially you should definitely try the calamari it's great . One of the best Asian food in Arizona . But the only thing that which is taking short of one star is the service. Once they serve the food they vanish and is difficult to ask them to at least refill water or  drink . But apart from that it's definitely the best place to have Asian food.

Had a great dinner at Flo's tonight. I got the lemongrass beef with noodles and it did not disappoint! Very good flavor and quality. I don't remember what my husband ordered but he was very happy with his choice as well. We also split the house ginger salad which was a nice size to split and the dressing was delicious. Will definitely be back!

Flos is the best food, period!  I have been eating here for over 12 years now and it is my favorite restaurant in the valley. The Kung Pao Chicken is absolutely amazing. Thank you for making such good food.

Food is OK - sometimes good - used to be great.  The service is terrible and a 25 minute wait for lunch on Saturday at 1:00?  Seriously?  It seems the restaurant relies on takeout - hostess ignored folks waiting to get on the wait list (irony intended) to serve carryout customers - could the tips have an influence? We were finally seated - had Shrimp Pad Thai and Red Chicken Curry - the curry was very good, but shrimp was overcooked and the dish tasted substantially different from last visit.  The restaurant is incredibly loud, to the point of distracting.   We used to go here often, but will be eating at other places from now on when Saturday shopping.

I want to like this place. In Tempe. Not a chain. Great remodel of McDonald's. Food is average. Service bad. Tonight ate at the bar. Bartender was too busy hanging out with his friends to wait on me. When I was done it took more than 20 minutes to get his attention to get my food picked up and a check.  Even tried waving my credit card at him. Didn't work. And I was sitting less than 3 feet away. Also found it disconcerting that one employee kneeled at the bar while a co-worker gave him an extended shoulder massage. Eeuw.
Delicious.  Really enjoyed the meal and the service was excellent.  Definitely will return.  Thank you Flo!
Had a great lunch at Flo's!  The spicy shrimp was amazing and the service was spot on.  Definitely will be coming back.

All the food was full of flavor & extremely satisfying!  The best Hot & Sour Soup I have tasted. The staff was polite & helpful. They brought the wrong meal for my son & initially they forgot to bring our soup, but everything was quickly corrected.  Will definitely visit again.
So good. Flo is the best. Staff works hard, but the food is so good, they could throw is at me and I'd still come back.

I usually go to Flo's on Thompson Peak but just realized there is one in the Promenade, which is closer to where I live. I always order the sweet & sour chicken with white rice. It's perfectly cooked (with a touch of crispiness). It's the best Chinese food I've ever had. I will be going again and again.

Was there on a very busy Friday night. We were seated immediately, and received very good and friendly service. We had the Thai chicken lettuce cups , Yellow Curry chicken, and Kung Pao chicken entrees. Food was flavorful, portions generous, and fellow diners were very pleasant. The owner (Flo) was circulating in the dining room, speaking to (classy casually fashionable to well-dressed customers) and graciously asking how their meals were. So nice to see restaurant ownership that sincerely CARES about their product and customers.  Top-notch Friday night stop with a good happy hour and app specials, good for a Friday/Saturday night date, and I would highly recommend.

I just picked up an order from the Scottsdale restaurant and found it uneatable.    The pot stickers were dried out, cold, and torn up; and had clearly been sitting around for sometime. The orange chicken was sooo bad we couldn't eat it and gave it to the dog. It made McDonald's chicken McNuggets look like haute cuisine. The chicken chunks were cold, old, and rubbery. The fried rice wasn't even fried, it was white rice with a bit of egg and oversized veggies in it. I could go on and on.   i recommend if you want Asian food go to Pei Wei or PF Changs not Flo's
The drinks were excellent and the happy hour prices are good. Food is pretty lackluster - bland except for being over salted and fairly Americanized.
not  very pleased 2nd time around won't return.

My boyfriend and I have been here a few times. The first time we were invited for a party get together. We had a great experience and the food was great. So we have been returning to enjoy a great meal. We always get two of the same things on the meal, the crab puffs and the beef lo mien are our favorites! We always choice another different entree to get as well. There menu has a lot to choose from, so we never have a problem finding something that sounds good, more of a problem trying to just pick the one thing. So far everything we have ever ordered has been delicious. The portions are pretty big, we order two entrees to share and always still have leftovers to take home. I highly recommend giving this place a shot if you're looking for a great meal!

Awesome food, excellent quality, great service. Every time we've gone here, it's all been great - every time. The ONLY misgiving I have is that they , well, only give you enough for 1 meal without leftovers. I guess there's been built an expectation when you eat out at Chinese you pretty much get 2 meals.   Price is slightly high, but we don't mind paying for quality.   Oh and ignore the dorks here slamming them for not having wi-fi. Get a life and do your internet at home or starbucks or Barnes and Noble with the other social butterflies.   I hope they don't get wifi so the bar isn't filled up this 'those types' sitting with their laptops open on the bar - jeez. (or geeking out w/their phones)

love this place and they do a great job with take out orders (better than the other location, in my opinion) and we go there at least 1-2 times a week.  pricing is great, food is so fresh and so tasty.  I always go for the soups, so much food I always have enough for leftovers :) love love love!
Kat, at bar is awesome, try her wing sauce! Flo's management seriously add this to the menu.

I took my parents this this restaurant yesterday. We had been there twice before and found it good so we thought we would go back for a third time. That will be the last time. What could go wrong, actually did.  We were later than usual and was surprised how conversations and general noise carried in this place. We could not hear each other without raising our voices, also asking the speaking person to repeat what they had just said. Very uncomfortable. We ordered one of the lettuce wraps for an appetizer and could not eat them because of the high spice content that I did not see on the menu when I ordered them. That was a waste of money.  We ordered brown rice and ended up with white. Of course it was taken care of when we brought it to the server's attention but come on... Another server attempted to deliver an order to our table that was not ours and we had a hard time convincing her that it was not ours. The gentleman that was responsible for re-setting the tables was walking by and we all noticed that he was holding the clean water glasses in place as he walked with his chin inside the open part of the top glass. Ugh! Let's just say, we didn't drink any more water after we saw that! The server could not remember our order from our table to the ordering station and had to keep coming back for clarification. Service was slow and it took us forever to get our bill and then to have the opportunity to pay it. The actual main dishes were not as good as we had before and we had to once again chase with server down for dinner plates. All we had were the serving platters. Needless to say, the leftovers did not come home with us since they were not up to par the first time around. We were not impressed.

We came at a busy time and we're very impressed with our waitress, Katie. She was professional and friendly despite the busy rush. Even during happy hour, they managed to get our food to us in a reasonable amount of time, keep our drinks full, carry a light and polite attitude, and help us with decisions and questions about our meal.   Their curry was worth the trip alone, and with their tofu was delicious. It was an overall enjoyable experience with exceptional service. Keep up the good work!
Disgusting. Subpar food cuisine unknown. Service is fantastic but the food is terrible.

It seems like some people in North Scottsdale have low standards? The place is overly crowded I cannot understand why it's not that great. I ended up getting sick after eating here, not just me but my boyfriend too. Oh well, I gave it a try several times only because the location, I will make the drive to find something else.

The stench of what was once Flo's and is now garbage hangs heavy in the air.   I had the crispy tofu with mixed vegetables. Husband had shrimp pad Thai and BBQ pork slices.   Tofu was not crisp, was a strange shade of dark brown, had a terrible wet/mushy/sponge like texture and the sauce in the dish was completely flavorless. The smell coming off this dish was somewhere between dirty dishwater and abandoned stairwell - funny that something with no flavor would generate such an aroma.   BBQ pork was an experience that we do not wish to repeat, the meat quality was incredibly poor.   Pad Thai had unusually large noodles, eggs had strange color, really didn't have that Thai flavor, shrimp were ok but by the time the dish was halfway done they were soggy.   Even the rice was bad.   Yikes.  I'm off to light a scented candle and see if there is anything in the fridge.
I never dine in here, because it always seems too busy, so I just do take-out. The food is always great. I'm never dissatisfied. Women at the counter are always very helpful and friendly.
Amazing soup with shrimp, chicken,  mushrooms, carrot julienne, and lemon grass.  Fabulous! Only place with better is Thai House.

The best Chinese I have ever had.   I live in the Bay Area of California and have a lot of options when it comes to Chinese. Quite often, we will pop up to Chinatown in "the City" for some Dim Sum, but there are the other kinds of Chinese restaurants closer to us that we have tried. None of these have ever come even close to tasting as good as Flo's. We think of it often and wish we were picking up some. Whenever on vacation we make sure to stop by here a least a few times. I see the mixed reviews below and have to wonder. I don't know if it's their tastebuds, or perhaps there are different chefs on different days (and we've just always got the best one), or if we just happen to order the best stuff on the menu, but we have no complaints at all and we can't wait to go back.   I HIGHLY recommend the Twice-Cooked Pork. MMMMM

Definitely stay away from this flo's. the restaurant is half full and it took 35 min to get just the soup portion of our meal. Currently, we are 55 min into the new and we are still waiting on our food. When we mentioned the long wait time for the food, the waiter said 'we're really busy'. That probably explains he leftover food that was stuck to my water cup from the previous customer and the small piece of foil that was served on top one of the dishes...they are just too busy to care about quality when the restaurant is half full.   Do yourself a favor and only come here when it is 25% full, then it actually might function like a real restaurant. Otherwise, if you get here and it is close to 50% full or more, you'd be better off going to coffee bean across the parking lot for dinner or lunch.   Happy fortune (cookie)!

Everybody in the North end of Scottsdale knows Flo's.  She's often in her restaurants talking to and help her patrons, she seems very dedicated to her menu and her guests dining experience.  There always seems to be something new on the menu, which is a great mix of all the Asian dishes and styles.  Which is what makes her menu so diverse. Whether it's Vietnamese, Thai, Indian, Mandarin, or Szechwan, Japanese or Korean, it all seems to be well represented.  It's hard to recommend any one thing, and I hate to be cliche' but her Lettuce Wraps seem to be the crispest, most flavorful I've had, a Must Have, no matter what else is ordered. I don't know where else you can go where you can sample so much that Asian food has to offer

What a great meal! Very authentic and delicious. Had the shrimp and green beans. Light however full of great flavor. My husband had the crispy honey steak strips and spring rolls. Yummmmmm! Our server Tony rocks!!! All the staff were attentive and food came fast and hot! A wonderful experience!

Excellent service and delicious food.  Best crab puffs anywhere.  Spring rolls, pot stickers, lettuce wraps: all delightfully prepared quickly. Thai Shrimp skewers are amazingly good.   Don't forget the cocktails.  Yum.
We love Flo's! It's a bit pricey but the food is great and the portions are large enough that we always have left overs for lunch the next day.
$5 sat lunch deal on sat, and happy hours are the best deals in town

I live in Los Angeles, when i am in Mesa and Tempe, AZ, i have to eat here everynight . Eveyone here are awsome and food is incredible. Jerry the manager and Stephenie the amazing server is why i come everytime when I am in this part of the country. COME HERE ONE TIME and you know if i am right.

I have been going to Flo's for many years and it is the best Chinese restaurant that I have found in Phoenix in the 18 years that I have lived here.  The atmosphere is nice, the wait staff are very attentive, you get to see and talk to Flo very frequently, which I think is pretty cool, and you get a lot of delicious food for the price.  I would highly recommend Flo's!
Love the dinner here... its fresh, especially on the weekend.  Lunch is a bit more iffy.. I guess depends on the chef.

For the area, this is one of the better places to grab Chinese food from.  The starter salad has a great dressing on it that I always enjoy and the chips and sweet and sour dip are excellent.  Both get you ready for a good lunch.  I generally stick with the orange chicken here because it is quite good.  Unlike other versions of orange chicken, the taste of the orange in the sauce is distinct and there are even chuncks of oranges on your plate.  If I based my review on the food alone, I would give it a five.  However, the service here is, in my experiences, a bit weak.  The staff tend to take a nonchalante attitute and walk you to your seat and visit you occasionally.  I usually have to drag someone over for a refill of water or chips.  However, this has never just been outright awful, just weak.  If you enjoy Chinese food, Flo's is definately worth a try.

Very average.  Very overpriced.  Very disappointing.  We order $90 worth of take-out to try this restaurant and will not return.  Of 5 entrees and 4 appetizers, only the moo shu pork was worth recommending.  The lettuce wraps were bland...almost tasteless...and there were only 4 pot stickers per order (most places its 6 or 8).  The mongolian beef was OK but the garlic chicken & kung pao chicken were average at best.  Don't believe the hype...the recent reviews of Bryan M. and Julie M. are right, Flo's is just plain disappointing.

Came here with a girlfriend for happy hour on Friday, 8/17. The HH menu is half off all the appetizers on the main menu and half off all alcoholic beverages including wine, beer and the umbrella drinks. I really like the Chinese lettuce wraps (serves 2) which is regularly $7 but only $3.50 during HH. It's just as good as PF Chang's. I also liked the chicken wings which are breaded and deep fried. but not greasy I love the banana spring rolls for dessert (even though it was not half off). Only problem with this place is the noise level -- hard to hear other people amid the clanging of dishes and loud chatter. But for HH, can't beat it. And the service is always good.

This was the best Chinese food I have eaten in years!  The Moo-shoo chicken was excellent!  Apps were great also. Our sever was very accommodating to have noddles instead of rice on the kids meal.  Overall 5+ Stars!

Menu tilts more Chinese than anything, but lacks an abundance of flavor.  The popular honey beef was just your basic sweet-soy glaze on some unfortunately soggy breaded beef strips (it would need to be a perfect crispy to work).  Salad at lunch from what appeared to be bagged lettuce mix didn't exactly inspire.  The lunch specials all came with fried wonton strips they called "chips," which was interesting but didn't exactly add any flavor or color.    Service was friendly.

My family doesn't usually go to this location, and I have to say I was extremely disappointed with the service. Katie, with the blonde hair, was our server, and she definitely needs better training. In fact, much of your stuff just needs to be trained on basic teamwork as it relates to customer service.   We sat down 14 minutes prior to happy hour ending.  A busboy promptly filled our water glasses soon after we sat down.  But we never saw our server or even knew who our server was, until exactly 16 minutes later. We watched many other servers and bussers walk by our table, back and forth, MANY times, but no one ever made eye contact.  So frustrating.  We had all of our menus closed, sitting at the end of edge of the table within 5 minutes of being seated. Yet not a single person stopped to ask us if we needed anything, or if we needed our server.  Common sense and the look of disbelief on our faces would clearly have shown that we were not being taken care of.  When the server finally showed up, she was polite.  The lettuce wraps did not show up until the very end of our meal, and that's only because we finally had to ask about it (we would have asked our server earlier, but she would disappear for at least 5-10 minutes at a time, nowhere to be seen in the restaurant). She quickly blamed the kitchen, saying they are very slow on making that particular item. I've ordered that item at your other location dozens of times, and it usually comes out extremely quick.   Everyone at our table doubted the story.  I  think you need to meet with your staff, and teach them about basic teamwork. I was a server for several years in college, and you are taught that just because it may not be "your" table, doesn't mean you completely ignore the table and tune it out every time you walk past it.  A little bit of common courtesy would go a long way.

My better half and I started going to this Flo's on the recommendation of our Realtor, who told us about the ridiculously cheap $5.00 Saturday lunch special.  Our first visit was good.  However, subsequent visits chipped away the other three stars.  Service was always adequate, but never good.  In fairness, that could be just because we always went during the inevitable madhouse that comes with offering a $5.00 lunch special.     I first had the Mongolian Beef, which was excellent. However, every time I strayed from it, I was disappointed.  The rice is never good.  It's always dry, broken grained, and utterly tasteless.  I'm no fan of soggy vegetables, but Flo's swings the pendulum too far in the other direction.  Eating a dish with huge chucks of nearly raw green pepper that merely kissed the wok/saucepan is not enjoyable.  Tender-crisp would be appreciated.  The Shu Mai are the best I've had, but twice I had to send them back because they were trying to pawn off old, dried out, lukewarm ones that should have been tossed, and that's just insulting.  It's been quite a while since we've been to Flo's, and we likely won't return.  I wanted to share with you why.

This is possibly the WORST meal I have ever had.  I don't even know where to start. It was fairly crowded for a Sunday night which I took for a good sign. The wait staff is young but fairly attentive.  Our actual waiter was a bit of a dope and more concerned with the table of 5 chicks in his station.   Appetizers. We ordered the chicken satay. Super sweet and basic. We also ordered the spring rolls. Completely ordinary.    Meals. Eggplant/pork dish. I thought I was going to wear it home. The waiter literally almost sloshed it off The plate and in my lap. I just ended up with a gelatinous spill on the table.  It was so sweet it was almost inedible. Yellow curry was actually edible. Pho was probably the best option but not near as good as my favorite pho joint.   $50 but not my last meal. Bummed. Was hoping it might have promise for my new watering hole.

When she began opening up restaurants to compete with P.F. Chang's (so the rumor goes), it was a real reason to go, especially dinner hour.  Prices were really competative and food was good.  Now a few years later you might as well go to Chang's; you certainly will feel like you are paying for it.  There's no reason for a honey beef dish (deep-fried beef and sauce - that's it!) to be $13.  Yes it tasted good and yes they were quick, but I'll bet if you did some reasearch and took a few chances you'd find something similar in Mesa/Tempe/Chandler for half that or less.  Maybe even S. Scottsdale...  Lunch and happy-hour will be the best options.  It still tastes great, you just feel like you are getting what you pay for.
Had a Great dinner at Flo's tonight, Fried brown rice, non-breaded orange chicken, cashew chicken, lettuce wraps, tofu and vegetables and spring rolls.  Love the contemporary atmosphere.

I used to love Flo's.  We would go there once or twice a month.  Have moved out of the area, haven't been there in a year or so.  Went there for dinner on Friday night. Food tasted great.  All three of us had food poisoning all weekend long.  Needless to say, we won't coming back for a long time if ever.

I love the food & the value is great. Service is good, family friendly, nice ambience. It's my favorite place. We usually head out there on Friday's before 7pm to enjoy the happy hour with half off appetizers and alcoholic beverages.
