Our usual order includes any one of the curry's, cashew chicken, basil chicken, yakisoba. The chicken on skewers are a great appetizer. They're pretty much always full house, but I've never had trouble being seated within about 5 mins.   Yaaay to Flo's!
Flo and her team does it again! Great service and amazing lunch special! Love this place!
Order the Duck, takes 24 hours! Worth it... Everything else and I have had all the apps and a large portion of the menu is alright. Also the layout is kinda wonky and awkward.

Odd menu, poor choices, poorly presented. The way the food is served is strange, they give you the cooked meat, with the flavor (sauce) on the side. Good rice. I was disappointed with the menu it is very limited as far as Asian restaurants go. They have no side dishes... I mean really? What is a Chinese dinner without a few side dishes? Comfortable dining room and a nice bar. The service was marginal, the  waiters seemed confused and not familiar with the menu, even as small as it is. They scrambled and wanted to charge me for a 13 dollar dinner, just because I wanted a side of noodles. I will not go back. Disappointing if you are used to really good Chinese food. To sum it up... find another place!

Don't order take out from here! At least!! Though the quality of the food can't possibly be much better when you're eating in either. Ordered sweet and sour chicken and they didn't give any sauce. Who does that? It was just little crumbly looks like bacon but it isn't fried chicken bits and canned pineapple! And $13!! Don't do it! Flee! The pork shumai tasted like food poisoning so I only ate one of them. $6! Fleeee!

Flo's was always a favorite during our many trips to Scottsdale years back. It's been about 10 years since our last experience so we were very excited to return.  This location, set in an interior strip in The Promenade shopping area is brightly decorated and spacious.    Our efficient server presented us with the regular and lunch menus and all our favorites were still listed. The lunch prices are reasonable but I'm not sure how they compare in size to the dinner portions....they appeared a bit skimpy from the Flo's we remembered.   We started with soup and pot stickers.  Their sizzling rice soup is the signature dish that brought us back to Flo's over and over again.  It's a humongous bowl fit for two that I used to eat all by myself as a main course.  It was flavorful with two patties of sizzling rice. The veggies and chicken were ample, the shrimp not so much. The chicken actually had a really weird, spongy consistency.  The taste was ok but I couldn't get over the texture.  For our main dish we got the shrimp and pan fried noodle and combination fried rice.  Both were good but they can keep the fried wontons they put on the side of their dishes...to me, they seem like filler to make the portions appear larger than they actually are.  Lunch at Flo's was not bad but I'll take a pass next time.  I'm more inclined to try someplace new in an attempt to capture that special experience we used to long for.
Meh. Yellow curry was watery and I've had better pad Thai from the frozen section. Not worth the drive.

Flo's kung pao chicken is the closest I've had in the US to what I used to eat in China. It's phenomenal! This alone merits 5 stars.  Flo's service is also fast and extraordinary. All dishes are great, but I wouldn't even consider leaving out the kung pao chicken!

we started with 4 orders of chicken wings and 2 orders of calamari.  Both were crispy and well seasoned. We followed that with 3 orders if siu mai. I was underwhelmed but the other 11 in our party liked them.  After that they came with 2 orders of special fried rice 1 brown rice and 1 white rice, 2 orders of honey beef (SPECTACULAR), Chow fun ( a bit salty), beef chow mein (good), cinnamon chicken (a novelty order that reminded me of lebanese chicken), mushroom chicken, ginger spicy onion beef (super zippy and good), some breaded chicken thingy with a brown sauce on the side (think katsu and it was pretty standard), thai curry chicken and finally the hot chili oil sirloin beef (tasty and i liked the contrast with the water chestnuts).  Some of the food was surprisingly good and some of it was a bit standard.  But I would eat here again even with it being more expensive than my usual digs.  The tea was never refilled, the water took awhile but the food came quickly and hot. Also, they didnt freak out at my 1 yr old niece eating so sloppily.

Flo's Suck! Below average tasting Chinese Food at super high prices.  I'm from Hawaii and use to excellent authentic tasting Chinese Food. For example if you go to Hawaii (Oahu), there's an excellent Chinese Food restaurant where all the locals go called "He Hing" across from the famous "Leonard's Hawaiian Bakery". Don't waste your hard earned money eating here at Flo's. Seem's like Flo is a bit money hungry with her off the wall high prices, for just O.K. food.  There's a great Chinese Food Restaurant in Mesa, AZ called "Best Hong Kong Dining" on Southern Ave/Dobson Rd. Excellent roasted duck with whole cooked ducks hanging on hooks (like the old days). The food is fabulous and the service is friendly.  Regards, J.D.
This is my favorite place to eat in Scottsdale. Great Happy Hour prices, delicious food, and cute atmosphere.

Awesome happy hour with great prices and delicious food but be prepared for loud indoor dining with 'can't be bothered' wait staff. The silver lining is that we were served by Stephanie. Because of her we go back.

Did not know anything about Flo's Asian Kitchen saw it on a business meeting I was having in the area and I'm going to tell you it was fantastic they gave me chips and some kind of Asian hot sauce before my meal came and the salad was crisp the dressing was delicious and then my food came very quickly that was also exceptionally tasty I would recommend this to anyone in that area and I will be going there again and I didn't really know what to order and the server was incredibly helpful so Flo's Asian Kitchen thumbs up
Always good at Flos!! A neighborhood favorite! Nice friendly atmosphere & quick service at lunch!  It's nice to catch this busy place slightly off peak hours to avoid wait time.

Went for lunch after main rush was over at about 12:45. Place was half empty but got seated in far corner table.Service was terrible. The waitress appeared to want to be anywhere but there. Salad came and was swimming in dressing. Every table had won-tons but we were not served any. We had to ask and were served them part way through our main dish. My wife's orange chicken arrived and was cold, tasted like fish and was chewy. My entree arrived 10 minutes later. The Mongolian beef was chewy and poor quality. Wrong rice was brought and had to be exchanged for our ordered brown rice. We have eaten here many times and it was okay. Today was a radical departure for even classifying it as good. We won't be back. Flo's has gone way downhill and the service which was never stellar was terrible.

What is up with todays lunch service?? It wasn't my first time eating at Flos, just my first time writing about them.   The waitress was very rude and seemed like she was bothered to be a waitress. Last time I checked, working in the restaurant industry meant serving people their food and drinks. Ms waitress thought different, she thought, let me sigh and roll my eyes to these people. UNTIL the big lady herself walked in, FLO.  Ms drama filled lazy waitress turned a 180, and started smiling, and saying, "yes, of course I'll refill your drink because I've been ignoring you until my boss walked into the restaurant, now I have to pretend I was happy all day."   Anyway, aside from ms lazy waitress. I love going to Flos, and will always continue going to Flos.   If Flo reads this, check the attitude of some of the servers, a smile and courtesy goes a long way in the industry. Don't take away the singapore rice noodles, IT'S MY FAVORITE! Food is GREAT, but the dining room noise is something to get used to. It's like sitting in a very large living room.

I've been going to Flo's for years.  Chinese food can be hit or miss.  We decided to give it a try one day when she had her old resturant across the street from where she is now.  The food was awesome.  It didn't take long before word caught on and she had to open a bigger place.    Her food at this location is excellent (although I've tried some of her resurants and they are not as good) and she is usually there working.  Lunch menu is a great value and so is happy hour.  It is always busy, so go early.  Never had a bad meal or experience.  The only negative, it gets very loud in the dining room.
Again, we enjoyed a nice lunch on a recent Saturday at Flo's.  The $5 lunch menu has to be the best deal in Scottsdale!

We've come here several times for lunch, as it's close to work. It's mediocre. I'm a vegetarian and they don't have a ton of options -- they have the usual stir fry veggies, veggie lo mein, veggie fried rice. I opt for the crispy tofu and veggies with brown rice.   I'd suggest to STAY AWAY FROM THE TEA. Their iced tea is gross, and probably a Nestee product. They don't brew it, and if they do, I don't know what kind of crap they use. My only gripe with Flo's.   Overall, it's an average experience with Chinese food -- for an average lunch price ($8-11)

The food was good, I just took issue with what how they decided to handle a challenge. I ordered my lunch and was given the option of white or brown rice, I chose brown. I was never notified of an issue with my choice and when the waiter brought the food, he dropped it and said "we are out of brown, it will take 15 minutes to cook so I got you white." He never asked if that was ok, never mentioned the problem until my food was in front of me.  On top of that there was no apology or service recovery. I just felt it was just handled poorly with little regard for my happiness.

Well, I came in here to get an order to go .I will start by saying the customer service is fantastic. I came a little after 1:30 so they were not quite as busy as the lunch rush would be. The restaurant itself is sparkling clean and I love that.The tables are spaced out nicely,so you are not sitting so close to others. I really like that. I placed a to go order, and it was ready so fast. It was still piping hot when I got home which was fantastic!  We got the Chinese Hot and Spicy Soup-Amazing. It had chicken and Shrimp in it. I would totally get that again. Also got the Beef and Broccoli and the Shrimp Pad Thai noodles. Both came with rice and you could get Brown or White rice. Everything was fantastic. I really like the Pad Thai, the Noodles are different than the Thai version. But, still very good. The ladies restroom was so clean, and that was after the lunch rush. It was large with amble soap, paper towel,and it even smelled nice. I will be visiting this place more often. I just never knew  what I was missing there. I always thought I would stop in there one day. Parking can be busy,since it is in a busy shopping center. It is right next to Whole Foods on Rural.
Flo's always has great food and will accomodate allergies if made aware.   I love the lettuce wraps and Chicken rice soup.  I add skinny rice noodles to the soup and make it a meal.

We ordered take out pad thai.  We got back to the condo and realized that there were literally very little to no spices in it that would make us think it's pad thai.  Also, it seems that they use egg noodles versus the classic thin rice noodle.  So, overall, we were very disappointed and would not return.  If you're looking for some meat and noodles in some kind of bland sauce, then try it.  We sat at the bar while we waited for our food  The drinks were ok, just like any other place, however the difference is that they have asian wines here instead of a classic cab or Reisling.  Just disappointing over all.  The egg rolls were "spring rolls" and again not very tasty and kind of bland.

The food is probably the best in the Phoenix area. Service is very good and the selection of dishes is large. Only complaint is the lack of teapots (only have 3) for patrons requesting hot tea with their meals. The cups are small and the waiters bring you one cup at a time if the teapots are in use by other patrons. A real turn off!!!!!

Omg we went (I had to go back because I was invited by a family and I didn't want to tell them anything negative). I couldn't believe that we waited almost 3 hours for our meal Friday night it was raining it was packed but we sat there  waiting forever!!  Then they brought the food separate we got some food then we waited for other people and then we gave up and ate and then finally finished, meanwhile some of our party finally got the food.  Terrible.

Lunch at Flo's today. Haven't been here in a while as the quality of the food has been inconsistent over the last couple years. Surprised, plenty of seats open. Lunch was very good. My girlfriend thought so too. Service was good also

It was a very good and chip place not long time ago. With new menu came new prices and gone services.  Hot tea was cold and served in tiny coffee cup. They brought wrong order and we waited for tea refill forever. Food was tasteless and when I complained to manager she was arrogant and rude. We lost one more place to go. Never again

Just returned from the worst dining experience I've had in years ~ the restaurant was loud and you couldn't hear those dining across the table from you ~ the service was poorly timed, bringing out the soup with the entr√©e and overloading an already too-small table with too many and poorly matched dinnerware and utensils for the food items served ~ we ordered Manhattans that were served in tiny glasses with ice and apparently no alcohol at all ~ the food was average at best and the wait staff unattentive and rushed in a half full restaurant.  What should have been an enjoyable and relaxing evening was beyond disappointing.  Will never return.
Great prices, nice atmosphere, and the food is fantastic.  This is the best Asian restaurant around by leaps and bounds.

First off, the food and the prices are outstanding. As for the dining experience, pathetic comes to mind. Whoever the Architect was that converted the old McDonald's (Tempe location) has absolutely no concept of noise management. It kind of reminded us of a high school cafeteria. The place is an echo chamber and you can't even hear the person sitting next to you. I was in a party of 10 on Saturday night and every single one of us was thankful to leave. We actually stood in the parking lot for 20 minutes (110 degree heat) talking because we couldn't do so inside. What a shame because $1000.00 could fix it.

I've been eating here practically every weekend for the past three years!  Today, was a huge disappointment as I was dissatisfied with something I ordered, and told they were not going to replace it!  I'm sorry but when you see my face in there every week and want to treat me that way I will NOT patronize your facility!!!!
Stopped in for half price apps, the pot stickers and and skewered bbq chicken.  Was pleased with the value and would stop back in.  Little to no atmosphere.  Would have to try again to recommend.

Flo's...I'm a fan.  Been living in AZ for over 10 years and this is one of the most consistent Asian/American cuisine in the valley.  The food is pretty solid.  They have a wide variety of dishes, I'm a fan of most of them.  They have tasty curry dishes and great soups,  The lunch portions and prices are decent, but their dinner prices are a little pricey.  They used to have 5 dollar dishes on Saturday, but now they are 6, I usually hit that up and their happy hours.  One thing I do love about Flo's is their Lettuce Wraps.  They have Lao and Chinese style...go with Chinese!  Hence my background.  This place is pretty solid, I would highly recommend.

Stick to the Ginger Broccoli Beef. Everything else is so heavy on the oil that you're bound to have bouts of diarrhea. Seriously. This isn't my first time here either, so you'd think I'd learn my lesson by now.
Great service, the owner is marvelous and the food is amazing!! Will definitely come again, no question about it!!

Absolutely the worst Pho I have ever had. The soup tasted like roast beef soup. It was brouwn and the vegetables were old and wilted. They did not even serve the soup with a soup spoon. Don't ever order the pho.
This my favorite Asian food place in North Phoenix!  I haven't had anything that wasn't delicious and fresh.  Even the Take-Out rocked!
Some of the best egg foo in town ., Flo's been around for awhile ., keeping it a solid with your favorites orange chicken is a must !!
Love their happy hour.  Food is good beer is great. Excellent spot to hangout after work
We've been to Flo's approximately a dozen times since they opened and we have had excellent service and great food every time.

Food was amazing!!!!  Best fried chicken my husband has had,  ever!  His words,  not mine.   Service was superb!!!  Manager was walking around making sure everyone's food was to their liking,  including us of course.   My son is a very picky eater and he loved the orange chicken,  without the green stuff Lol!  Highly recommended:)

Food just okay nothing special. As a lunch that is okay, for dinner NOT. The staff customer service is mixed. Been there twice and the hostess in the front was terrific, the bartender was cool, the waitress - oh no!

Welcome to Tempe.  Happy hour is 3-7 with 1/2 price apps & alcohol drinks.  Place was busy but service was still great.  We ordered from the appetizer menu Thai calamari, Thai shrimp skewers, Chinese lettuce wraps & Crispy spring rolls.  Quick service, water glasses filled & yummy food.  We will come back soon.  If you need gluten free they have lots to choose from.

We have been to Flo's twice. Both times we enjoyed the shrimp pad thai the most. If you go for lunch the services are just the right size and you get crispy won ton noodles also! Service was adequate both times.  Lunch can get busy depending on the day of the week so the service at that time is less personal, but with a large crowd that can perhaps be expected. They have lunch specials, so it is a good way to try more than one dish to find your favorite. The decor is very casual, chairs are not comfortable, but they perhaps want you in and out so they can keep turning the tables. We were told they do not take reservations, so be aware if you are on a time crunch. Not a place to have a business meeting, not too many tables that are private and it gets loud so not easy to have a confidential conversation. Hot and sour soup was very good!

Boy, were we underwhelmed. Went there for lunch with my mom and was disappointed in the service. They forgot our appetizer and then, when we were almost finished with our entrees, they brought it out. We sent it back. They never asked us if we wanted something to drink other than water. Food was very, very average. Having not been here for many months, I think I'll stay away.

Delicious food at a modest price.  I got the orange chicken and asked them to spice it up. They brought it out really quick, almost frighteningly quick. With it came a side of rice.  I went there on a date and really enjoyed the experience. My only concern was that the walls were plain, but that's just a little hurdle to get past.  Thumbs up!

I would lean towards 3.5 stars simply for some changes in the years we've been coming here for work lunches. But because I still enjoy them...we'll go 4 instead of 3.   They are pretty quick for lunch and you get a salad, your lunch entree and a healthy sized serving of rice with a few won ton chips thrown in for a reasonable price. This is where that half star comes in...they used to provide a bowl of wonton chips and a cup of sweet and sour like chips and salsa style when you would be seated. And it seriously made my day every time. I'm sure people would fill up and they would throw some out, but I seriously adored it and was bummed when that practice stopped. I get it, truly. But I like what I like.   They flavor is decent. I always get the Kung pao chicken. Like some other reviewers have said its not the spiciest but I wouldn't call it bland. Mine is always filled with jalape√±os and full red chilis cooked into it. It's the right amount of kick to meet the likes of most I'm sure.   We've always had decent servers, usually great ones in fact.   But there are some changes they've made to the presentation just change it from what felt like a nice dinner place for lunch to an upscale Panda Express for lunch.

I am definitely pro Flo's. Every lunch is accompanied by a generous helping of won ton chips, sweet and sour sauce and a fresh salad with miso dressing. My favorite dish is their [insert any meat here] low mein. It's exploding with flavor and they let you customize your order if you want chicken and beef.   The service is always great. The servers and staff are ninjas, (yes, very appropriate) -- glasses of water appear before you look up from your menu and empty dishes disappear. Everyone who works there is always smiling and looking to help, even when they are serving half the city.  Best of all, this weekend, we discovered the $5 lunch special on Saturdays. The line was out the door, but it was so so worth the wait. Every lunch special highlighted in red is just five dollars until 3:00. I was reunited with my de-lish lowmein for less than what I'd spend at Subway. Now that's something to smile about.

Where in the Valley can you find Happy Hour 7 days a week from 3-7? Where?  Tell me! lol .... Well, I'm sure there's other places but I haven't experiences them .. nor have I experiences any Asian Fusin/Chinese food in the Valley as good.  I've been here at least 3 times since Flo's opened.  Thus far I've tried the shrimp lo mein, Teriyaki salmon, Chicken wraps and the Hot and Sour soup.  My goodness ... the Hot and Sour soup is absolutely delicious!  Theeeee best!  There's also a really good Pomerita they make ... it's not your average Pomerita but it's delicious. All the 3 times I've been I've never had to wait for seating, either at the bar or in the dining area.  2 thumbs up for me! Give Flo's a try :)

Wonderful  service and food from start to finish. Fast service. Hot food. Our waitress was super nice and all wait staff and bussers  were super friendly  as well. I was very impressed  on how clean the restaurant was as well. Prices were awesome. And we went during happy hour so appetizers were way cheaper.  It was $50 after tip. We got drinks, 2 appetizers,  soup,  and 2 meals. We had plenty of leftovers.

This place is packed on Saturdays and as I read about their lunch deal on Saturdays for 6$ ,I am kind of unbelievable .Even I called up before I reach there to make sure about the deal.:-)  As we entered on a Saturday afternoon, we found the place is almost filled and our waitress helped us getting a table very quickly and she answered all my questions very promptly. So here I explain the deal of Saturday. Anything on their lunch menu (Entrees) are absolutely 6$ complimented with a salad and a choice of white/brown rice.  Apart from that , I give the stars for their staff and taste of the food. This place is highly recommended on your lazy weekends or when your taste buds demands some Asian food.

After reading the reviews a few weeks ago, I bookmarked this place. My husband and I were so looking forward to having a late lunch here today.  Not sure what's going on at this place but the service was non existent. As soon as we walked in we got seated in an area with about 4 other diners eating lunch. It was kinda strange but it was very quiet in this restaurant.  A wait person, with a frown on her face approached our table and poured us some water and handed us our menus. I mean it was blatant that this server was not having a good day. I asked her nicely if lunch was still available and she frowned again and this time at my husband. Who by the way wasn't even speaking.  After she walks away, another 5 minutes go by and I flag her down and ask again where our waitress was. Again, another frown.  At that point, knowing that we were going to have a minimum $25 plus meal here my husband and I both decided to walk out and eat at a place that wants our business.  The funny thing about the whole thing was as we were walking out, a girl behind the bar area says, " have a good day. "  To which I replied to, " that would be great if we actually got to eat. " Usually I would take the time to talk to management but I just got the feeling that they really didn't care. It was already so obvious to us.  Again, not sure what's going on here and super disappointed but there's a serious disconnect with how they treat their customers and what they need to do to keep them.  This was by far the worst customer service we have ever experienced in AZ as it was just basically non existent.

A seemingly fresher Chinese takeout but lacking in flavors. Placing the takeout order by phone was problematic. It seems the person did not know the menu well, so we were off to a bad start anyway. Then the food overwhelmed me.

Flo; she's a neighborhood celebrity. And her restaurant, a crowd favorite. I've been a regular, almost weekly, customer for 17 years! Almost everything I've tried has been tasty. My go-tos: hot and sour soup, house chow mein, orange chicken, and lettuce cups. Lunch and happy hour have great deals and dishes too! Good value, good food, and it's always a bonus when you get to see the famous Flo!

Love Flo's!  Good food, inexpensive and quick!  I have been going to Flo's for lunch for quite a while now.  They do indeed have a new menu, but still have all the lunch time favorites available, you may have to ask for them if you don't see them on the menu.  You can get salad, rice and an entree for lunch for around $7.  Their food is so delicious you will want to eat the entire meal in one sitting, but I always try to save some for leftovers.  I am really picky about Asian food, and this restaurant tops my list!

The best Chinese I've had in AZ. The food was soooo good, so hot and fresh, and the flavors were fantastic! They offer more than just Chinese food here (Vietnamese, Thai, some Indian) and the menu is creative and dynamic; it's not just the stale same-old same-old. They provide fresh and exciting twists on staples or do the classics very, very well. I can't emphasize how good the food tasted... everything we tried was amazing.  The atmosphere was very upscale-looking, so you get a nicely-decorated and upscale dining experience for the usual affordable price of any other Chinese restaurant. The service was good, too: kind and attentive. I am obsessed with Flo's and will be returning again.

The service tonight was absolutely amazing and we were well taken care of.  Flo the manager was exceptional and the waiter was awesome!  Your food is fabulous as always and I can't thank you enough for everything.   I will always recommend your locations to others and next time I will come see you in Scottsdale!

My mom loves it. My daughter loves it. I like it.   Their lunch special is a great deal; one evening I went in for a late dinner and was offered the lunch special price if I wanted less food. That was actually impressive to see that they would offer lower pricing way after the lunch hours. So that's a plus.  Things to try:   Calamari appetizer: Just enough spice to make you drink the recommended daily amount of water. Tossed with red peppers and spices that will make you wish you didn't have to share with the table.   Spicy Shrimp Chow Mein: Jalapenos make this dish S-P-I-C-Y...a good thing! The noodles may be a bit overdone with a tad too much sauce, but overall it's a good dish.   Thai Coconut Soup: This is delicious. Brimming with veggies, and several floating pieces of chicken and shrimp. Must try.  The place can get a bit noisy on some days but it's affordably priced and a nice break from having to cook at home. One and a half thumbs up.

I usually come once a week or so for lunch. We just had dinner there, it was a little busy but not crazy. Server took forever to greet us. Think her name was Nicole. Our food took so long. Think it was an issue as another sever was telling his table near us. He apologized. Our server did not. Really goes a long way. Very disappointed in the whole experience. Even worse bc I now have a bad stomach ache.

This is our new favorite place to eat!  The lemon chicken is the best!  We have excellent service every time we go there.  The price is the lowest we paid in years.  We now are regulars and eat at Flo's at least twice a week!  Thank you to the staff and Kevin who manages a great place!
The food was amateur at most, A+ to service though. The food wasnt that great for the price, but edible. Go to P.F. Changs instead.
Everytime to this place is different, really like the fusioness they do with the food, like the crab puffs, jalape√±os chicken wings

This place is hit or miss. Luckily, the last time I went was a hit with the yellow curry with chicken.   I have been coming here for about 4 or 5 years. When momma is in the house, the food is generally better. (Flo) Come in for Saturday lunch special for $5. Yes, I said $5. All the special entrees come with salad. Reg. $7.50-8.50 during the week.   I also like the pad thai and spicy chicken chow mein. It has these tiny but potent jalapenos. Man, it has the burn, but really probably my second favorite dish. If you do not like spicy, stay away from that one!

This food is terrible. I ordered the Pad Thai with Chicken and it smelled not only of fish but it tasted like it too. I could only pick at it and that was about it. My friend ordered the katsu chicken and it was a rip off. The chicken was cut super thin and super small. Very disappointing. The dumplings were terrible. They were hardly cooked and tasted like the dough was only half cooked. If we weren't so hungry we would not have ate them. It took 9 minutes to get our tab after we gave the waitress our card. Not impressed with this place.

This was my second time coming here and the food is exquisite. I ordered the curry the first time and it was flawless. I had the pad Thai this time around and it was wonderful. I think I may have found my new favorite dish. The staff is friendly except I am not sure why there was 5 or 6 of the girls standing at the counter just talking. I only needed one person to help me lick up the take out. I am also disappointed with them stuff my paper bag to the top and not folding over the top. I don't understand why they didn't just use two bags. There was no parking so the bag ripped and I lost the chips that came with the meal. Not impressed with that. It is super noisy in the restuaunt so I recommend take out!
This place has an AMAZING happy hour....tons of apps and drinks for super cheap.

Not bad, not great.  Flo's has a great atmosphere, very clean, casual and modern... but none of the food was great.    We started with shrimp rangoon and lettuce wraps.  The rangoon was OK - I didn't see or taste any shrimp at all, pretty sure it was all cream cheese.  The chicken filling for the lettuce wraps was so salty and oniony - not so good.  Entrees were orange chicken and cashew beef.  The chicken was just OK - sauce was too sweet.  The beef was the best dish - really tender and well flavored, but so salty.  I prefer my local Chinese place in St. Louis over this upscale but disappointing restaurant.

Our favorite location and always satisfied here  Great happy hour food and beverage specials. Not sure what others are complaining about! More than 10 years coming to this location and they are always consistent, delicious and accommodating.

Love Flo's! Why the three stars? Because the Flo's at the Promenade DOES NOT compare to the Flo's on Thompson Peak. The food at the Promenade location is lacking. The Katsu was dry, the soup blah, and the meat was just bland. The service is awesome, which redeemed the visit (been there several times), but if you want the real experience, go hit up the Flo's on Thompson Peak.

This is hands down the best Asian restaurant in the valley. Happy hour is from 4-7, seven days a week, with half price appetizers and drinks. Everything I've eaten here has been fantastic. The spicy shrimp and pork wontons and house roast pork are to die for. I'm coming in next week for the Peking duck.

We've liked everything we've tried here - the hot and sour soup is the best we've found anywhere.  We always wind up getting an order to take home.  Service has always been prompt, cocktail list and beer selection is good as well.  My wife and I are both partial to the seafood guoba as our favorite dish on the menu.  It's close and convenient, and a guaranteed good meal every visit.

We've been to Flo's in Tempe several times. Unfortunately, the food is not consistent. Last night we did take out; the order was incorrect - included a pork dish & we don't eat meat. They did correct the Oder but by then the vegi egg rolls were ice cold. The "experience" was ruined & most of it is ready for Fri trash day. Expansion without quality control just simply isn't worth it.

So I went here for LUNCH on a SATURDAY while in town visiting friends and it was sooo good, for one their lunches on Saturdays are 5$ but even when not on special they are only 2$ more... and let me just say it was sooo delicious I shared about four dishes among 2 people and myself (we ate semi-light) my favorite of the 4 was the sweet and sour chicken it was very crisp light breading and juicy wonderful chicken... tone of the other members in my party enjoyed the egg plant chicken, and the other said she most enjoyed the pork fried rice so it is clear to say ALL the dishes were tasty. I would def. reccomend

We had a big group who needed lots of food that we could all enjoy, so of course we turned to Chinese food!   Heard about Flo's, looked up the menu, and was really impressed with how extensive it was. Given the size of our group, we were able to try a pretty wide array of options: pot stickers, noodle soup, Mongolian beef, Kung Pao chicken, curry, and sweet and sour pork. I sampled most of it, and everyone was really pleased. We especially liked how they have classic dishes with authentic flavors and not super diner-y or greasy Chinese takeout.   So if you're looking for a modern presentation of classic Asian dishes, check out Flo's and I think you'll be pleased!
Flo's is great. Quality ingredients, consistently good & well trained staff. Thanks Flo!

This was our first time back in a couple years to see if the food had improved at all. Unfortunately, it hadn't. Filling for the lettuce cups was greasy and flavorless. Stir-fried vegetables were boringly bland. And the black tea was thin and appeared to have been brewed long ago. But the service was good. Maybe we'll try again in 2019. Not.

Family night out with my wife, our two kids, and her parents and we thought we'd have a great night at Flo's. Unfortunately service was horrible and the food was ice cold when we received it. It took exceptionally long to receive our food and when we did we were so hungry we started eating. The waiter didn't return for a long while and when he did he took three of our dishes. They were not brought back for over 15 minutes, and even at that point only two were brought back. They brought a third one shortly after, but it wasn't what we had ordered, so this just added to the frustration.   When the manager stopped by (I think she was actually the owner) she said they take the food right from the kitchen to the table and was somewhat argumentative which shocked me. She offered no resolution at all. I'm not the type to complain, and this is my first review of any type using yelp or any other online tool, but felt so compelled to do so after her attitude.   I've been to Flo's many times and unfortunately this will be my last.

Their happy hour specials are great. Don't pass on the wings, they are worth the wait. I don't think the food here is as good as the Scottsdale location, although I haven't eaten there in a few years. The menu is hit and miss. I love their mushu pork and katsu chicken. Some of the other items are generic, so so Chinese takeaway staples.

It's always fun to see new restaurants come up in the area & an Asian Fusion restaurant is definitely right up my alley. We had some evening plans so we just got a couple of dishes to go from Flo's.  The first thing we noticed when we walked in was that the interior is very modern & sleek-looking. There's quite a bit of sit-down seating as well as a few seats at the bar.  After a look over the menu, I wanted to try something different but ended up ordering the Kung Pao chicken with white rice and my date got the Singapore BBQ Pork Noodles.  The Kung Pao chicken was fine but I found myself wishing there was a little bit more flavor & spice. Also, the veggies that were tossed in with the chicken were different than what you usually find in this dish. It all tasted just okay. The Singapore BBQ Pork Noodles were definitely different and interesting. I didn't get too many bites but I thought the ones I did seemed mostly bland. Typically noodle dishes aren't served with rice but this one was.  I thought that the price was not justified. The dishes were both much more expensive than I was expecting in the first place, and then after eating what was served, I didn't find it was worth it. My date did not eat any of the rice so I think it would've been better to have an option of not getting rice and paying a little bit less for that entr√©e. Overall, I don't feel like I have much of a reason to return.

Saturday lunch HORRIBLE...Bad service RUDE server and when "FLO" came over to the table she was also rude!  I hadn't been to a Flo's in eight years...Things have changed!  Its ok to treat customers like that and is OK'd by the owner!  Flo's no more...
Love this restaurant !! Food is excellent.  Great Happy Hour too.  The staff is on top of it all. Can't say enough about Flo's.

Was in Phoenix on travel, this place was suggested for happy hour.  Well the server didn't know the specials.  Then when we ordered some other person dropped food off at the table with an attitude.  Server had to be flagged down to get assistance.  We called the manager over to tell him about the service.  Glad I don't live there and wont go back if i did.  Maybe service is better at the bar than table service.

I just moved to Scottsdale last Friday and for some reason on my first night in town I just had a craving for Chinese food.  My husband had been living here since April, so he had been to Flo's a couple of times, so he suggested we go there.  We walked in around 4:30pm on Friday and were seated quickly.  The place isn't very large and it's decorated simply but nicely.  We were pleasantly surprised to hear that it was Happy Hour.  Everyday from 3-7pm all alcohol and all appetizers are half off.  What a deal!  I even heard the waiter for the table behind us telling them that many people come in for happy hour and just order an assortment of appetizers.  Sounds like a great plan for some other time, but we were pretty hungry.  We had an order of spring rolls, I had katsu chicken, and my husband had general tso's chicken (this was on a separate summer menu).  The katsu chicken was very tasty, my only complaint is that the panko breading starts to get soggy as soon as they pour the sauce on top, so eat fast.  The general tso's, on the other hand, had a different breading that was perfectly crispy even after adding the sauce.  It was not at all spicy like the menu indicated, but were were perfectly fine with that.  Pricing was reasonable, service was good, and food came out quickly.  We will definitely be back.  I particularly would love to try the peking duck (note that it requires 24 hours advance notice).

Flo's is a good option for happy hour Asian fare.   It's located right off FLW and Thompson Peak.   The Happy hour deal is pretty decent ($5 for specific/well drinks and 50% off most apps.) While you get a good deal price wise, you kinda get what you pay for. The food is average "American Chinese restaurant", it's tasty but not exciting or memorable.   It's usually slammed with the early bird crowd so there's always a decent wait for whatever you order. They also keep the restaurant pretty dark and it gets loud in there so be mindful of that.

Flo's lunch deal is good bargain. The dishes are usually around 7$ and come with a salad with a tasty dressing and bowl of won tons with a nice orange dipping sauce. I usually order the Teriyaki bowl and they now have the option of white or brown rice. It is enough food that I can only eat half of it and bring the rest home for dinner. I enjoy the ultra quick water refills as well. You can't beat the lunch deal I recommend it highly! Only complaint is that it can get a bit noisy when it's packed and it's usually packed!

Flo's made me sad.  Walking in, I was optimistic.  The restaurant was open and inviting, and the food smelled good.  Perusing the menu I still optimistic.  The selection was decent, with some interesting choices.  Then I saw Spicy Malaysian chicken and I smiled.  For those of you that don't know, Malaysian food is one of my favorite things in the world.  I'd kill a man to get a decent Lemak dish.  Chicken was ordered and our efficient server had the food out in no time.  My chicken looked...orange.  I'm not sure how else to say it.  It just didn't look all that spicy.  Sadly, it didn't taste spicy either.  It tasted quite a bit like orange chicken, which is most assuredly NOT Malaysian in origin. Did I mention that it wasn't spicy?    So to sum up, the place is nice, the service is good and the food is kinda bland.  I'd eat here again, but I would order differently

Have gotten take-out here several times and usually enjoy it. But the last time, the food was VERY salty. MSG??  Also, the dishes we ordered, pork lo mein, broccoli beef, and cashew chicken, were too dry - not enough sauces. Will not be ordering from here again.

Good food but when trying to get takeout it takes forever. I had to wait 25 minutes after waiting about 15 minutes before leaving. This was not the first time either. Staff is nice and friendly. Cool bar too.

Excellent food, service is spotty.  It seems there are whole new crews every time we go in, and we have moved to order take out more often over dining in. The best thing about Flo's food is that it is the best food the day after.
I have always enjoyed my meal. They are well priced for how much food you get. I highly recommend this chain.

I have to update my earlier review because I've become a regular of this place, and quite a fan!    This is still not your 'Bay Area' Chinese restaurant, but given the location and demographics, you aren't going to get that here in Scottsdale and I accept that now.  I've settled on several good dishes, and the place is always crowded and lively these days (I was new to the area back in July 2009 when I first visited - I guess I should be amazed that they were even still open at 9pm, at that time of the year!).    Several of the dishes are really enjoyable - the bacon / prawn dish is good, and the steamed fish with ginger is outstanding. I've started to explore a few of their "Thai" variants, and they seem to be doing a good job of those.  I love the fact that the place is always busy and lively (though the acoustics are a bit challenging, with shiny concrete floor, glass walls, hard-wooden chairs, etc - some hanging fabrics would help I'm sure ... ).

Happy hour is the best here! Appetizers are 1/2 price,  the portions are huge, and the staff is really great!  I love that they have a lot of gluten free options too.  The salt and pepper wings and the chicken lettuce wraps are my favs!

I've been to Flo's multiple times and not had a super positive experience.  I ordered the "spicy thai coconut milk soup" assuming it was tom ka and the soup that came out was more like orange-colored hot water. No taste, no spice either. It looked akin to the plastic heatable containers of tomato soup you can buy at a grocery store. I've also ordered with brown rice before and was served white rice, which was easy to fix but in retrospect, another negative mark. I came here with my parents once and ordered hot green tea which came as a small cup (and only a small cup) and that showed up on the bill as like $2. Then the potstickers are like $5 for 4 of them and they're probably just potstickers purchased from the nearby Trader Joe's market. To be honest, the only reason why I even come here now is because someone else is paying.

Flo's never fails to disappoint. Very good food and great service. Probably not authentic Chinese but delicious nonetheless. You'll never leave hungry. The only drawback is the noise level. With cement floors and a wide open space, it's always noisy and not a great place to have a conversation.

BEWARE Vegetarians and Vegans!!  I visited Flo's for the first time today and had a bad first impression.  They have some dishes listed as vegetarian (I'm vegan), and according to the waiter.....they are NOT.  He told me the brown sauce is made with a chicken stock.....ummmmm not even close to being vegetarian, let alone vegan.  He said they could make it vegan so I trusted (scary!) that they would. So buyer beware......ask many questions and don't trust the menu labeling!

A good friend recommended Flo's for the food. I'm sorry to say that we didn't get a chance to eat the food because the service was so abysmal! Maybe it was because we came towards the end of the lunch rush (1:00 pm). We were seated promptly and they asked about drinks and brought our drinks quickly. After 20 minutes no one had been around to take our order.  Even after attempting to make eye contact and flagging down our waiter, another 10  minutes came and went. We finally gave up, paid for our drinks and left. Not good.

While visiting Tempe we tried this place out! It was really good. The Chinese Chinese Chicken Lettuce Wraps were amazing! We had the Pork Potstickers and Shrimp Spring Rolls, the potstickers were good, We wish they were cooked a little longer. The Shrimp Spring Rolls tasted great and everything was fresh! For dinner we shared the Shrimp in Lobster Sauce with Brown Rice and it was delicious! We recieved a complementy order of the chocolate won tons for dessert due to it being our first time there. When we visit Tempe next time we will definatly be back!

Flo's is more of a Chinese/Thai hybrid than straight Chinese food.  But it was fantastic regardless of what I was looking for.  Loved the atmosphere and happy hour drinks!  In my party we had the Chicken Lo Mein, Katsu Chicken, and Teryaki Chicken.  All were outstanding.  The pot stickers and fried spring rolls were excellent as well. It was a little loud at times but that worked well for us as our party was equally loud.  Definitely recommended!

Really?  Ordered brown rice and was given white. When reminded them that I ordered brown rice I was told they ran out. So my husband is halfway through his meal. Why couldn't we be told it would take a little longer instead of plopping what I didn't  order on my plate.  Bad service and no offer to comp meal that was delivered late.  Food is good but that's crappy customer service in my book.
Excellent hot and sour soup - probably one of the better ones ive ever had. very flavorful and not sloppy. my entree was OK not the greatest, but man that soup...
Flo's is awesome and always yummy. They start you with a salad with an amazing dressing and all the entrees I've had rock! If you like spicy order a side of there chili oil.

This place is always dependable.  The food is always good, the service is always a little lackluster but without blame as those guys and gals bust their backends considering how busy the place is, always and the prices are really fair, especially considering portion sizes and happy hour specials.  It's a no frills experience, you go, you wait but you wait because the food is good and fresh and doesn't leave you hungry in an hour like many other Chinese restaurants.

I bring my family here for the Saturday lunch specials. The food is tasty and affordable. The wonton chips with sweet and sour and salad they bring before your meal are worth coming for alone. I've never been to China, so I don't know if this is authentic, but on the other hand, I don't care either. It tastes great.

We have eaten here probably 3 or 4 times now, simply for the fact that it's nearby and easy to get, but we must say the food quality here is pretty low, the flavors are very hit or miss (mostly miss), and the prices they're charging for this mediocre food are way too high. We would expect to pay half as much for food this poor. We just spent $40 on a to go order for lunch and not only did they mess up our order (we think the waitress was new, she didn't know the answers to any questions on the phone), but about 3/4 of our food was nearly inedible... it was just plain gross. Just a waste, we threw it out after a few bites. Suffice to say, I don't think we'll come back again.
Best Chinese food around.  Great Hot and Sour Soup, Shrimp Skewers, Kung Pao Scallops, it is is all yummy!

This place was okay as far as casual atmosphere goes, not a place to dress up for. It reminds me of something between a cafeteria and a cafe, nothing spectacular. But if you want a quick bite to Easter i guessed it was more of a casual cafe.

Flo's is good for service and their prices! They have a great happy hour and $5 lunch on Saturdays! They have an expansive menu with a fantastic variety of Asian food choices, but the quality of the food is CONSISTENTLY INCONSISTENT!   Two times the food has been great and 3 times so, so! Last time had Shrimp Pad Thai and the noodles were so mushy! Had Dan Dan noodles another time and they were great! Have had the green curry chicken twice and once it was good and the other time not. I am not sure if they have better cooks at one time than another.  Good prices and service means I'll give it another try but I sure wish they would get it together for good food EVERY visit!

The food and service was pretty good.  The building  use to be a McDonalds years ago but Flo's has remodeled it so well you could never tell.  If i am in the area I would eat here again but otherwise I  wouldn't go outta my way to drive to Flo's when there are so many other options.

June 25.  Waitress was not rude but aloof. Gave us dish w/small portions of lime for our water/tea. I complained that they were dried out/no juice and she whisked the dish away and brought back more that were the same.  My wife order an appetizer that was dried out and not fit to eat. She abruptly took the dish, with no comment and credited our  bill with 33% of the cost of the item. Again no comment.  They closed all the blinds (understandable) but without proper lighting the place was so dark it was hard to see your food.  Noise level is unbelievable . I over tipped according to the service received.  The waitress could have used some training on customer relationship.
Flo's has great food and great service.  Plus they are right across the street from Doc and Eddy's Bar.
There seems to be a. "Click" that hangs at the bar . So if ur not part of it u r basically ignored by the bartender . Not hating just saying don't sit at the bar if ur not a regular

without a doubt, the best around. happy hour. excellent, my favorites is the calamari and the chicken wings, a must have..and everything else excellent. I try and make it thier at least twice a month ..half price on appitizers and drinks from 3-7, did i say happy hour..m-f..

Last night it was our first time here.we went there after following good reviews.but what a disappointment. We ordered hot and sour soup, shrimp and egg noodles, Kung pao chicken, red curry chicken. No doubt soup was good.but red curry and kung pao was a total fail.i don't know why the curry called red curry.coz not even the colour was red.forget about the taste.there was a burnt flavor in kung pao.anyhow I didn't like it at all.never going back there.

Great stuff, we went during happy hour.  I couldn't believe the prices at the end of the day.  The only problem was the salt and pepper chicken didn't have any salt.  Probably some snowbird complained that all the salt would raise his blood pressure.  $25 for two of us, both are over stuffed, and not oiled out. I am going back for sure.   Also I saw Flo.

Flo's is pretty good. They have an incredible Saturday lunch special... 5 Bucks! Can't beat that! It gets very crowded on Saturdays, so it's best to go early or late for that lunch special. I guess it's just a strange pet peeve of mine, but it's really loud in this place. Every other sentence, and I am leaning over and yelling WWWWWHAT? to my wife! It annoys me to go there, despite the food being pretty good. I like their lettuce wraps, and the curry chicken dishes are good as well. They serve a great little salad with entrees too, with a delicious house dressing.

Kids meals were disappointing.  Terriyaki chicken is a basic kid meal staple but Flos kid meals only include rice.  If you want noodles instead with the Terriyaki meal it costs extra $2.  That's $7.50 for kids terriyaki with noodles.  Pei Wei much better and more flexible with pricing.

The  food was reasonably priced and they are very accommodating to vegitarian but the four dishes we ordered were a bit bland. The atmosphere is awesome and we are planning to try it again to seen if they had an off night

Flo's was pretty goodies.  We were recommended to go there by the concierge at the place we stayed who said they had the BEST won tons in the universe.  False.  Still, good all around place that was basically empty when we showed up on a Tuesday night.  Reasonable prices and competent service.
We eat here a lot. Very good. All menu items are homemade and taste fresh. Not cheap but I think well worth it.

I was so excited to go to this restaurant, based on a recommendation from a bartender in the Grand Canyon.  Unfortunately, after reading the great reviews about the food and the service, this experience really ruined my last night in Scottsdale.  We ordered a crab delight appetizer and the crust was chewy & heavy, instead of light and crisp, which took awhile to arrive.  Fifteen minutes later we were brough the Spicy Thai soup, which wasn't great, yet the best dish we had.  Sitting at the table, being ingnored/forgotten, after we were asked if we wanted the soup boxed up, we sat comtemplating leaving before the rest of our food arrived.  I told my boyfriend that a gal had come (who wasn't our server) asking if everything was okay and I told her we were waiting on 3 dishes and it had been awhile.  He told me he already watched the people who came in behind us eat and leave.    Our server then glanced our way and made a comment under her breath - 'no food?'.  About another ten minutes, two of our dishes arrived by the hands of someone else.  The cashew chicken was okay, the Mongolian beef was unedible and the lemon chicken tasted like you could get it from a grocery store.  All I can say for the good reviews if that these people must not have exposure to much Asian foods.  We are from Seattle, where there is a huge Asian influence on the palette.  So, if your city is known for Asian food, I recommend skiping this place, if not, you might like it.  However, the poor service was inexcusable and they didn't even apologize for the hour+ wait in a non-crowded restaurant!

I read all of the Yelp reviews and remember Flo's being very good at the Scottsdale location years ago. Ordered combination fried rice and Mongolian beef. I was stunned to see the  "fried rice" it was the most disgusting, bland, nothing 'fried' about this dish. Just awful.  The Mongolian beef was ok but more onions than beef. $30 total wasted. NEVER AGAIN, we threw the fried rice out as we could not eat it (was take-out) it was THAT BAD.

We just got back from lunch at Flo's! I am surprised it was not busier but we did go at 11 AM so maybe we beat the crowd. I had the lemon sauce chicken and the sauce was nice and sweet and the chicken was thin and crispy which is exactly how I like it! The lunch comes with a side salad first with their yummy dressing. We are going to add Flo's to our lunch options for sure!

My original review was three stars, see below, but after the owner sent me a message berating me because of my review I decided to downgrade my review to a two. I felt it was a fair honest review. He actually told me I'd be better off at Panda Express, well if that's what you feel your food is compared to I feel bad for you. I feel your food was much better than Panda Express.     Nice decor. The food was decent, similar to a PF Changs. Servings were good sized and affordable. I had the sweet and sour chicken, spring rolls and pot stickers. All were good. But not out of this world

Flo's is good, not great. Killer lunch specials on Saturdays, 5 bucks. It's loud in there, and the service is OK. Can't get too excited about this place, but it is right around the corner from where we live, the only bonus for me.
Visited the place many times. The food is great. Some dishes are fantastic. Price is reasonable. Very good lunch deal. The place is noisy, but the food and service are great.

I love Flo's! I'm so happy this restaurant has finally made its way to Tempe... So delicious.  And a really really..... REALLY good happy hour menu.  Half off all drinks and great appetizer specials.  The food is just as amazing as the other locations.  My favorite is the Mongolian Beef, but the bartender introduced me to the salt and pepper wings which might be my new obsession.  This place is brand new so expect some slight hiccups, but he final product is always is delicious!!!   I  heart Flo's!!!
So sad that the chicken satay..a main staple was removed from the menu. The main reason I came to flos. :(

Walked in and very surprise with music and atmosphere not good and noise. Very bland food with no salt nor peppers on table. All come with salad that i was ready to ask if it was bagged. Employee not very happy to be there and not knowledgeable on food. Please don't waist the money, i had better at a fast food restaurant.
We love Flos. Happy hour has the best Beers and Happy Hour Menu is soo good. Dinner menu is Awesomely Delicious. Service is very very good and friendly. Can't beat this place. Luv Mary&Carl
This food is terrible. The hostesses are hot, but the food tastes like one of those $4.95 all you can eat Chinese buffets. Seriously, the Emperor has no clothes. It sucks.

In town for the week, was craving Chinese food and found Flo's not too far from our resort. We were initially shocked at how busy it was for a Wednesday night but we were happily seated right away. We decided on sharing the orange chicken and Mongolian beef with crab wontons to start. The wontons came only a few minutes later and were delicious! Our food followed VERY shortly after. Our food was AMAZING! Probably the best Chinese food we have had. The portions were huge, which we of course at at home later that night. The service was very fast and friendly, Emmi was a great server! Would recommend if you are in the area, all around a great restaurant!

For the past 10 years I've been ordering the Yellow curry chicken dish. I love it so much. Now I even have my father in love with this restaurant and dish.  If you're looking for proper Asian food go to Flo's.
Ok food, not much better than PF Changs. Some unique dishes but not great and not very authentic. The crispy and spicy chicken was good though.

While the waiter was attentive, the food was so salty, it was inedible. Huge waste of money. I ate 3 pieces of the edamame after having had to wipe the heavy salt off of each. Had about 4 bites of the Hot & Sour soup - way too salty, as well. Very disappointing. Should have asked for a discount, or should have been offered one, but no.

Love all of the food at Flo's! They have a very large menu from many different Asian countries and it was hard to chose everything sounded so amazing!  I ordered the Dan Dan noodles and they were perfect! The food and drinks came out quickly and the noodles and chicken were fresh and delicious 10/10 experience.  The two hostesses Kristen and Katrina were very very nice and friendly and my server Tony was excellent and very funny! Love this place :))))

One of the restaurants in the valley that I stop by to frequently. Great prices, great service and always awesome food. Being that Flo's started in Arizona, I love it that much more! Crab Wantons & Southeast Asian Peanut Chicken

I've been to Flo's numerous times over the years, but there seems to be a downward trend.  It looks like I'll be finding a new Asian Fusion spot...  The Man and I had a couple hours to kill and hungry bellies to feed, so we popped into Flo's for their (seemingly) amazing happy hour.  I ordered a froo-froo drink, which I'm pretty sure was half-price because it contained half the alcohol it normally does.  Tasty, but strong? Um, no.  We moved on to a bunch of appetizers: crab puffs, chicken satay, spring rolls, BBQ pork, and pot stickers.  The BBQ pork was yummy, but that is where our satisfaction ended.  All of the other items seemed no better than from-the-freezer snacks I can get at the grocery store.  Are they making any of these on site?  Maybe, but it sure didn't taste like it.  The crab puffs were the most disappointing.  So little crab, so much cream cheese.  They should definitely take a look at that ratio and either rename the dish or up the crab quantity.  Just a thought...  Now I'm off on a journey for a new go-to Asian spot!

Terrible! The expensive calamari was so chewy I couldn't even get through a single piece, the chicken was unbelievably dry and the sauce that came with it made my stomach hurt, and the pot stickers tasted like they were frozen out of a box (soft and bland). Never eating here again!
Bad ambience. The food was a disaster. Wonton soup was water and uncooked wontons. Red curry came without the rice. The only food I enjoyed was the lettuce wraps.  Never again.

My "go to" Chinese joint in North Scottsdale although my favorite dish is not Chinese! The Thai Tom Yum is as good as you can get and for only $6, an unheard of bargin with lots of big yummy  shrimp. My wife swears by the Sizzling Rice Soup and my teenage sons love EVERYTHING but especially the Katsu Chicken and of course Spring Rolls and anything Wontoned...   Be sure to get an Oder of Flo's Special Fly Rice, it has all the proteins in it including the kind that quacks before it finds it's way into the wok!  Xie Xie (sheh sheh)

The best burritos I ever have in around this area and it is very closed to where I worked that I can pick up my lunch in a few minutes. I came here sometimes and planned come back sometime in the near future! More I can say that I truly recommended!

New location opened in Tempe at Rural and Baseline, its actually located in a former McD's but you wouldn't know it by walking inside. They have a nice long bar area and the dining area is large and open. The menu is huge and varies between chinese, thai and other asian fusion.  They have lettuce wraps that are delicious and the Pad Thai, Pork Lo Mein and Shrimp in Lobster sauce are all good choices.  Go in for Happy Hour or on Saturdays when the menu is $6 from noon - 3!  Such a deal.

I have been going to Flo's for years and every single time it is AMAZING! Whenever I have family or friends in town I always take them here and nobody is every disappointed. Not only is the food exceptional so is the customer service. Flo herself stops at every table and ask how your meal was... I seriously don't understand how every single time I have been there in all times of the day she has done this. By far one of my favorite places in AZ.

Another random stop for lunch last week and this place was pretty crowded around 1pm on a weekday, but we got seated right away. The first mistake was being served salad as the opening course. Even though the peanut dressing was really good, no asian restaurant worth its merit should be dishing out iceberg salad. They need to do the traditional cup of soup or eggroll for us to get the full experience. Most lunch dishes are around $9 or $10 and I had the lemon chicken. Pretty simple and tasty. Panko breaded chicken strips with a lemon dipping sauce, white rice and a few wontons. I got soy issues, so my Chinese experience is boring, but still a good dish.

We went there for dinner in April 2011. The dishes are hit and miss, and all are over priced. My wife ordered pad thai, and it was horrible. Instead of the traditional, flavorful dish with peanut and bean sprout, this dish at Flo's is just a salty, chicken noodle. My wife and I both took a bite, we had to send it back. It was not edible. Too salty. Only chicken and rice noodle. There was no peanut, no bean sprout, no pepper, no egg, no ..... Basically, it was NOT a pad thai at all.   On the upside, my son ordered a sweet&sour chicken, and it was better than most places. They used fresh pineapples.  Based on food quality, ambience, and dinner prices, I say there are tons of other places that are better.

Disappointing. I went to Flo's with my family tonight and will not be back. The Basil Chicken entree had two pieces of basil and the cheapest chicken imaginable. My meal was cold while my husband's was steaming ?!?   The service- The waiter took 10 minutes to greet us. We quickly ordered and he never once came back to see how anything tasted. Towards the end of the meal he finally returned to our table to hand us the check... Ha!   Not worth the money. Not worth my time. I probably could have eaten better and cheaper at a Chinese takeout fast food place. Gross.

Disclaimer: My sister used to work here, so I have eaten my fair share of free food from this place, allowing me to taste more or less everything.  Flo's has some of the best hot and sour soup I have ever had.  It is so good, it is a bad thing because I cannot eat it anywhere else without being disappointed.  Really.  The food is all pretty good, nothing outstanding, nothing terrible.  I try and mix it up every time, so there is nothing that I prefer over anything else.  Take a stab at any thing.  The happy hour here and at all Flo's places is pretty sweet, 1/2 off all appetizers, table or bar, and same with drinks.  It is hard to beat.  The restrooms are nice private stalls, clean and stocked.  4 Flushes.

What is not to LOVE about Flo's.  I haven't eaten here in years and it was just as great as I remembered.   I am from New Orleans and their shrimp rivals the fresh gulf shrimp that I grew up on.  I had the seafood soup and it was delicious and full of shrimp and scallops.   My meal was only $11.00 and I have leftovers for tomorrow night.   The hot and sour soup was also amazing and I hear their beef and noodle soup is delicious.   I am here for a month and will be eating here a lot.   I can't even make dinner at home for less than that.

Three stars for any Chinese restaurant in the area is really good. There aren't many options, and most are meh. We went in time for Happy Hour (before 7:00) at the FLW location and it was packed and extremely LOUD. We were seated within 10 minutes and staff was very pleasant and helpful. Spicy lettuce wraps were tasty as were chicken wings. App portions are very large, so we enjoyed them the next day. I had chicken in Cantonese sauce--very different than I'm used to, but tasty. Hubby didn't love his pepper chicken and will try something else next time. Might try Promenade location next time as waitress said it's a bit quieter. Overall, it was decent Chinese and will go again. Portions are generous.

You know it's not authentic when they give your party forks instead of chopsticks, lol.  To their credit, the food wasn't terrible tasting... but it's whitewashed Chinese food. And not GOOD Americanized-style Chinese food (think Panda Express - greasy and yummy, Americanized) but rather... just... very bland "Chinese" food.  The venue itself is super clean and nice, and the servers are lovely people.  Go here if you are too nervous to try authentic Chinese food but want to feel multicultural for a day. Don't worry, they won't give you chopsticks unless you ask.

Food was delicious, service was more of a community effort.  We had an issue with the food, more of a personal preference, and it was resolved quickly.  Would have liked more attention from our designated server. Will eat here again.  The business should close up the south end of the patio to hide/quiet the Baseline road noise and lights coming into the parking lot.
Damn good Chinese food! Nothing much else to say

Pretty disappointed with my first trip here. I usually go to the one on Thompson Peak and I was expecting similar food quality, needless to say I am surprised. The chicken is like chewing on leather, the portion size is smaller, and there was barely any sauce. Staff was friendly, but the food is overall bad. I won't be returning to this location.

I recently became Pescatarian, but REALLY love Asian food. It's basically a guilty pleasure. So when we walked in and smelled the amazing Flo's smells, I almost died. Our server, a tall blonde man was great with getting us beers and waters, and made sure to help me find the right dish -- Sweet and Sour Tofu with white rice. and it was DELICIOUS. The atmosphere in the Tempe Flo's is great too. We will definitely be back :)

Good service. Nice restaurant. The food is not very good though. At least what I ordered. I ordered Kung Pao Chicken. It came out too quick. You could tell that it was processed pre-cooked chicken that they just flash fried really quick. Very fatty not good quality chicken at all.  Will try this place one more time or another dish but if it's the same quality I will be not back again.

I really enjoy the menu and all the wonderful options and tastes.   For example, by offering (and mentioning it in the menu) the flexibility to substitute tofu in any dish, it opens up endless possibilities not offered in most other Asian restaurants.    The last few times I have subbed in the rather unhealthy yet tasty fried tofu in the pan fried noodle and beef and broccoli dishes.   As a bonus, they even reduce the price when  replacing meat with tofu.     Here's where Flo's needs improvement.   First, the service has been very very slow the last few times I've been there.  I don't know  what the holdup is as there appears to be plenty of staff present.   Perhaps the staff needs additional training.  Second, the food has come out warm, not hot.   Could be the slow staff leaves food sitting under the warmers getting cold.     Overall a great place and worth checking out if you're in the area.

The only thing I would change in this restaurant would be adding booths . I think it would add a more warm and comfortable feeling .   The service was great for lunch . We absolutely loved the egg drop soup ! My husband love the fried rice and he keeps talking about going back for it lol!  I really liked how clean the bathrooms were. The bar was very nicely set up .  I can not wait to try more food !

I've been obsessed with Flo's for years and have never had any issues until recently. I so want to leave more stars but I've been dissatisfied the last 4 or 5 times.  - there has been a mistake in my take out orders 3 out of 5 times. The hostesses sound 15 yrs old and rush the call resulting in errors with my food that I can't send back bc I'm already home  - the portion size has dramatically downsized. I asked the waitress last time I ate there and she said "yes, there have been a few changes"  Now, instead of getting a basket of won ton chips on the table, their new technique is to put a pile of them on one side of the entree plate so they take up space so people hopefully won't notice the skimpy portion size. I'm an average person and don't overheat, but for these prices, the amount is very skimpy  - lastly, flo has raised her prices to the point of being absurd. Maybe her locations cause her to think all her customers are rich, but I seriously can't afford to get take out anymore. Tonight I ordered 3 basic dishes for my daughter and I and it was $40 before tip.  The average dish is $12-14 which is ridiculous. Most other restaurants are $8-11. I noticed tonight the lack of flavor in the lo mein and the small number of cashews in my cashew chicken.   The sad thing is, good chinese is so hard to find in Phoenix, but that doesn't give Flo's the right to take advantage of that fact.  2 years I wouldn't have complained but now I'm in search of a new obsession

Guy has been busing tables, wiping tables with nasty rag that has not been rinsed, sweeping floors and picking up stuff off floor, then proceeds to set fresh dishes and silverware, bring out ' clean' bar glasses, refilling glasses, etc, etc and hasn't ever washed his hands. Just took my daughters glass, refilled it and put a straw in - stirred the drink with the straw by holding the top of the straw, handed it back. Daughter is so grossed out. Along with rest of ppl at table. Wash your hands. Simple thing. Have watched him for another 20 min. Still hasn't washed Last thing he asked our table if he could box up leftovers. A big 'no!' From everyone at table.   Good food, good service. All ruined by somebody not being clean.

This location has been horrible, the other locations have been great. Since this location is near my house, I still for some reason due take out a couple times a year. MY MISTAKE, I ordered tonight and I always inform the CSR to place notes on my order to please make everything fresh as It is not always fresh from the past. Well, I picked my order up and sure as can be the spring rolls and crab puffs were cold, I informed the manager and he said hold on a minutes and took the two items back. He came out and said, "here they are fresh straight from the oil" Well, I got home and I was shocked the store manager would take the original items and toss them back in the oil and not even have the professional solution by making the complete order over, how do I know, both the items were burnt. Very obvious they were reheated in oil. I took pictures, but do not see a place on yelp to upload.  This is not cheap drive-through, and as a store manager he should of made it right, I am ashamed that customer service is coming to this.

I've been coming here for years, and always enjoy my experience here. It's a great place to bring guests to enjoy great quality Chinese dishes. Also they have the best happy hour! 3-7 everyday!! half of their drinks and appetizers! Their appetizers are so good! My family loves them, the crab puffs are so good with the sweet and sour sauce (the best sweet sour sauce I've ever had), shrimp skewers gotta be my favorite! The shrimp is so juicy and the peanut sauce is such a nice pairing! My parents love coming here, their pricing also is so affordable!   They have this lunch specials on Saturdays, anything that you can order in a lunch portion, is 5 dollars! Also comes with a side of rice, a side of salad with their amazing dressing!! and side of those yummy WT chips with the sweet sour sauces! The service has always been excellent, Flo's got the best crew! They made sure that everything is excellent and the owner and managers are friendly and helpful too! All of their dishes are so good, this is by far the best Chinese restaurant in America. You can do take outs too!   I first came about 4 years ago with my family, and we were hooked! The kids always loves the sweet and sour chicken, and the chocolate won tons! right now I'm definitely in love with their cashew chicken! they have a great vegetarian menu too, and you can ask to have your food gluten free! I took one of my friend to try out the happy our there and she fell in love with the spring roll and also thought that the staff are all really good looking LOL.   Over all, this place is definitely worth the visit, and it's a great experience. It's affordable, great quality, very customer friendly and definitely my favorite restaurant!

One of my favorite Chinese restaurants to go to... we are regulars here.  Great food, awesome happy hour and wonderful staff especially Jeanne (the manager) and long time wait staff like Dony, Nikki and Mike.
Great food, nice environment, service mediocre. Can't believe this used to be McDonald's!!

great food great service but the fortune in my fortune cookie were the same as my friend .....   this place is a scam!!!   never coming back again because of the fortune cookie incident.    it broke my heart.

My friend at work just loves this place.  I'm not blown away by Flo's but it isn't bad.  The salad dressing is wonderful, and I wish I could buy it by the bottle.   The food isn't spectacular (though I will admit I am not always adventurous when it comes to Chinese food)   The service is usually pretty good, though this last time, I think the gentleman was new because he was ALL over us, and then we didn't see him again for nearly 30 minutes. But I'm sure once he's more comfortable he'll be a great addition.

basically az's pf changs or whatever  you want to call it ... the food isn't all that wondeful but what am i supposed to say? this is probably one of the higher end places arizona has to offer ...   service was decent. prices are appropriate, $7 an entree?  if you want chinese food in scottsdale, flo isn't a bad place but i would rather save my appetite for something better ...  meaning, id rather go elsewhere (not a restaurant) but grub on some homemade chinese food which is normally the way i like to eat my chinese food. *shrugs*

I have never had such service that I had to let others know about it.Yesterday was Valentine's Day and so we decided we were going to order take out and have a family night. We choose Flo's  in Tempe because an individual recommend it said he goes there for lunch all the time and  said it's fantastic. I wish I could have received the same service he gets at lunch time. So I call to order take out and the young lady answers and asks if she could put me on a brief hold sure I said knowing it's a busy day of the year so it was a little bit of time that I held probably 3 minutes or so and she comes on I tell her I would like to order take out coconut soup,pot stickers, wings,crab puffs and pepper bacon shrimp she kept correcting me chicken bacon I'm  like no my husband seen it on your menu then she finds it tells me the keys on system are always moving ok whatever 58.00 I seen on the website 50% off most appetizers and drinks ( doesn't say in house) you should probably put which ones are so people can see them. But was in shock I thanked her and hung up  omg I was thinking I text my husband to tell him how much  because he was on his way.
