He asks WTH did you order I'm thinking regular Chinese food appetizers  and though one might at least be half off. then I called back I asked the woman to remove coconut soup and she  very abruptly say I will and hangs up the phone(rude) so my husband proceeds to get home we sit down to eat and I was shocked this food was like nothing we expected at all the only thing half decent was the crab puffs because they weren't soggy and for 7.50 and only 6 in the bag the wings had a good flavor very scary looking because they put crispy wings on a plastic container that's not a good move and that was 12.95  wasn't a dozen  which I was shocked for that price and ordered the pot stickers they were gummy as if they were not cooked fully and they were pork so didn't want to take a chance getting food poison, my poor husband after working all day gets a container of soggy bacon what looked like Roma tomatoes soggy and it had 4 shrimp in it. Our Valentine's Day was to focus on each other and express the love we have for each other  instead we didn't eat much of this very over priced meal. To top it all off in conversation about how mad at ourselves we were for getting food from there. My husband says you didn't get your coconut soup I said I know I called and cancelled he said they still charged me for it I called and explained to them what happened there was not a sympathetic answer given basically it was 20 questions I was asked was it a man or woman that checked you out? Do you happen to know their name? My favorite one was are you sure you didn't get it? Then she puts me on hold and a man picks up ( please let your customers know that they will be transferred) I said do you know why I'm calling ?he said yes and then told me what I can do is give you store credit we have a book here with the names in it ( I had to chuckle because I understood after what I was served I understood why)or I can void your transaction and I'll need to take your credit card over the phone with the 8.50 plus tax taken off . We chose the void. He says I do see a 10.00 tip should we keep or remove that no keep it I stated it's Valentine's Day so he then tells me what my total is charges the cards I still have not received a sympathetic response even from the manager. I will never eat nor recommend this place and I will be telling my close friend that frequents there today when I get to work. I have been in the service industry for years my recommendations  are: 1. You should never make any customer feel like your to busy to assist or take care of them and not a good idea to the game clue when a customer said they didn't receive something. 2. You should probably reevaluate the container you use for hot food because as cost effective as they may be that alone will loose you business nobody should be subjected to pay high prices for soggy food 3. You should put quantities on your menu so people know what they are getting for that price 4.If the roles where changed I may have "apologized" for the level of service along with asked how everything else was and more then likely being it was one of the busiest days of the year would have at least gave 50% off the meal to encourage return business . 5. Know what goes out of your restaurant should always be known for quality not quantity. I would never tell no one to eat at flo's because that is just not me but I wanted to share my service with you as a first time guest. Thank you

I have been coming here for a few years now and it got really big since they opened. Sadly, it lost a little in food quality over time and for some reason I always seem to have stomach issues that I don't get at any other Asian eateries. They might be cooking with MSG, I am not sure since my wife does not seem to have any problems with the food. Waiting time can be very long depending when you want to eat so I usually just order it as a take out since we live near by. It's best to call ahead to get a feel for how busy they are. I am also discouraged by the inconsistency of the food quality, while sometimes the egg drop or wonton soups are awesome, they are bland and tasteless at other times. So I give it 3 stars which seems fair But I would rate it 3 1/2 stars if Yelp would allow half points.

I've giving them 3 stars instead of 4 based on lack of parking. It's absolutely ridiculous. There's no 10 min parking for takeout, be prepared to walk a couple hundred feet. Once your inside it's great. I've been here at least a half dozen times. It's always packed. The food doesn't blow your mind but it's predictably good.   The kong poa & orange chicken are my favorites.

My first time with a friend. Just OK, nothing special. Ordered crispy fried beef and Mongolian beef. Portion at lunch was generous, served with a small salad and lots of ordinary brown rice. Waitress friendly but after the meal came, not seen again. Probably won't return as we prefer at least 3 other Asian places.

I do like flo's Chinese food. But it can be hit or miss sometimes. I always get their pho soup. Usually very flavorful. My husband likes to get their eggrolls, chicken fried rice, sweet and sour chicken.

Love, Love Love this place for happy hour. 1/2 price drinks and appetizers and the food is great. We always come with a big group and the service is always very good. There's a good size patio to be able to eat outside also. Definitely will be back.

I love this place for so many reasons. The foods great and it never disappoints. I only go for lunch but I hear the happy hour is great as well. It's priced right. I can't get a better value for my money. What I love the most is the service. I'm a nobody but when I go in there they make me feel important. I always sit at the bar and although I may only go in a couple times a month, the bartender knows my name, order, and modifications. The manager has randomly comped my meal just out of appreciation for my business. I don't write reviews but these folks have it figured out and other people need to know they are doing it right. I'll be forever loyal to this Flo's. They truly inspire me to be better to people.

Good stuff...been to the one Scottsdale several times and always enjoyed...glad they brought one to the SE valley. For apps, we orders the spring rolls and the pork dumplings.  The I'm in love with the egg rolls at PF Changs and these don't really measure up...sorry! The dumplings were amazing.  They are steamed and we had them done a bit crispy.  They were a perfect combination of steamed and lightly pan friend!  Amazing!! We went with the classic Cashew Chicken and the kids Sweet & Sour Chicken.  Both were great.  I love this place!  We passed on desert so no review there.

This place was pretty good but didn't stand out significantly. The ambience was okay but the lighting was too dim. My mom had to use her flashlight on her phone to see the menu. Our server seemed a little overwhelmed and was taking on quite a few tables by herself. I ordered chicken fried rice but again- it didn't stand out and didn't have a lot of flavor. I might try this place out again for happy hour.

We have been looking for our go-to Chinese restaurant in the valley and now have found it. For dinner we had a bowl of Wonton soup and a black bean beef entree. The wonton soup was delicious and filling with homemade wontons. The black bean beef was a special order that they  graciously made for us. Service was attentive. Only ding is the black bean beef could have been a little hotter when it made it out.  We'll be back!
Went there for an early dinner today and the good and the service was excellent.  Very clean and sparkling.  Will definitely be back soon

Worst dinning experience ever, i will never come back to this place , the food was decent it took about 40 min to get our food out , we saw our server maybe 3 when we needed something we always had to ask , the managet was this blond girl that was just hanging out in the host stand doing nothing not helping her staff , they had maybe 4 servers for the whole restaurant and they had a wait list , i blame her for the bad planning and not helping her team . Dont waste your time at this place very disappointed.

My girlfriend and I eat here about once a week!! Love this place! We always sit at the bar, because Katie always treats us well, and she really knows what to suggest, when we want to try something new! She always welcomes us with a big smile...and has taken time to get to know us, as regulars!  Best service EVER!! Food is always good...but Katie is the real reason we go back again and again!!

Opened at 3pm on Christmas Day and the crowd was pouring in before then.    The hot and sour soup was the freshest I ever had, and was gigantic.  Everything was freshly made with good ingredients.  Friendly service.    The Spicy Ginger & Onion Beef, along with the special spicy fried rice was delicious even when reheated as leftovers.

Love their lunch here. It's an excellent value. You get crispy won ton's, salad, and an entree for $7-$9. It's quite a bit of food so I always take some left overs back with me.   However, it is always really loud an crowed here. Parking can also be a nightmare in this lot. It's a small shopping center with a couple of popular stores/restaurants (well it doesn't look like there's much else but apaprtments/condos/houses in this immediate area) and minimal parking.    And it's pointless to make reservations here for large groups here. We've had issues a couple of times. Most recently we had a business lunch here a few weeks ago and called and confirmed our party of 14 twice and when we got there on the day of our reservations they acted completely clueless. And because it was during a busy lunch time it took them awhile to get some tables together to seat us.
Flo's Flo's Flo's!  Anyone in the general vicinity of Scottsdale Rd and FLW who is searching for great Asian fare, your journey is over.  For great dine in or take out eat Flo's...period.

If you're looking for a great happy hour spot,  Flo is your girl. She has 50% drinks AND appetizers till 7. If you're a wino like my bestie and me go for the whole bottle. We have been on the look out for new happy hour joints for years but always come back to Flos. When you can do a tangy bottle of white wine, spicy lettuce cups and crispy spring rolls for a great price it's hard to justify going anywhere else in North Scottsdale.

So, the first thing you should know is, slow service.  The theme of the evening was hearing the staff say "let me check on that, it should be ready by now" or "I'm sorry your order is taking so long". Not a good sign and if I had been paying attention when my daughter and I walked in for our first experience here I would have turned around and left.  We were there for TWO hours for what essentially was mediocre Chinese.  Not bad but not good either and particularly not worth the time invested.  Even the people waiting for take out were having to wait a long time, the problem is the kitchen.  Figure it out.  The only thing was by the time we got our food the manager ended up comping our meal and all I did was tip the poor waitress.  She was good and pleasant under the extremely stressful situation of having incompetent kitchen staff service her customers .  I won't be back and you should avoid this place.
Good food good service only reason i didnt give 5 star was because its way too loud.  Def would come again

Situated in north Scottsdale, it's a gem to discover. With its small bar and dinning areas, this place really impressed me. All staff were so friendly and patient to this newbie. I ate at the bar and the barista was perky and jolly... A breathe of fresh air on an overcasted Sunday evening. It's not really a "full" bar, but it will get you through. The place was clean and very coordinated with its orange, black, and white color scheme. Very calm, relaxing atmosphere.   The menu is lengthy compared to other Thai restaurants. They are sure to have your dish. I ordered the hot and sour soup for starters. The dish was delivered very promptly. It was so hearty and plentiful, that I didn't order a main dish. AND I took half the soup to-go!   The only negative: I didn't get ONE napkin during this whole experience. Seeming that the soup comes with a spoon, I guess it wasn't necessary to give me the utensils wrapped in a napkin. No biggy. I'll return again... and demand a napkin! ;-)

Diverse menu. Food usually pretty good. Great happy hour prices. Decent beverage selection by Chinese restaurant standards. We have had good service when we have gone.Easy parking. In a shopping center but don't let it discourage you.  This is part of a small chain and they all seem to be good.
My kids actually eat here! They love the teriyaki chicken. Love the shrimp and bacon dish! And Pomarita-Florita. Eat here regularly. Service is great.

Really good food and a friendly staff makes this a great place to visit.  I have been several times, if you like spicy the spicy ginger beef is my favorite by far.  They have a wonderfully priced lunch menu.  My two daughters, aged 8 and 5 love the kids honey chicken.  It is our go to spot when we are in the area.

Flo's was a great dining experience. They serve a full-course meal that will definitely satisfy. The menu is huge, but everyone was satisfied with what they ordered! The building is recently renovated so it is very nice and clean inside. I recommend the pad Thai!

We popped in here after the Phoenix Open for some dinner because they were on our Elite AZ restaurant list! Since we don't make it up this way very often, we figured that we might as well take advantage!  We started with vegetarian spring rolls and they were good, not great. My husband and I got in a little debate because he ordered them while I was in the restroom and chose vegetarian instead of chicken but vegetarian spring rolls are always warm, mushy veggies! Not my thang.  Anywho! The entrees were EXCELLENT! I ordered the beef and broccoli with wide noodles and oh my goodness, these were HEAVEN. I would 100% recommend them over just basic beef and broccoli. The sauce and noodles were dreamy. Next, we split the orange chicken and that too, was tasty! The meat was good quality white meat! Yay! I'm not a fan of dark meat so this made my happy. We ordered white rice to go along with it. Both portion sizes were HUGE!!! We were both pretty hungry and my husband can eat A LOT (it is super rare for us to take home leftovers) and we had a good amount of both leftover! Yay! Always a plus!   All in all, the food was fresh and tasty! They were super busy for a Thursday evening which was noticed in the service because it was a bit slow (we waited forever for our check). But oh well! We were full and happy. The portion sizes were huge and the menu is very well priced. We'll definitely be back!

Always been a Flos fan, it's been a family favorite since my siblings served there! I loved the ginger beef, comfortable environment, always kind of cold. They do have a bar that's separate from the dining area! Great service.

Best happy hour ever!   The following have been tried and are delicious:  salt and pepper chicken wings, edamame, crab puffs, hot and sour soup, sizzling rice soup, basil thai chicken.  All bartenders are fantastic.  Good selection of wine.  Only reason for 4 stars is their desserts (only 3 available) are terrible.

My boyfriend and I just stumbled upon this place tonight and we enjoyed it so much I felt compelled to review.  The food was delicious, fresh, and filling! The staff was great, along with the atmosphere.  Definitely would go back again! Also, for vegans, or gluten free, etc. it is easily specified what it contains as far as allergies on the menu. No matter what your needs, Flo's has many options for all which makes choosing a great dish for everyone fun and easy- just wonderful :)

Flo's Asian has finally made it to Tempe! We have been fans of "Flo's of Scottsdale" since she opened her 1st restaurant in Scottsdale! So it's great they're open now in the heart of Tempe, at Baseline & Rural Rd. Great Interior Design...such a nice, bright open feel! We had excellent service and the food did not disappoint!  We started off with  1/2 price appetizers, Crab Puffs & Spicy Wontons.  (Happy Hr. is every day from 3-7pm with 1/2 price DRINKS also!)  For the main course, I got the Cashew Chicken and my partner got the Kung Pao Chicken. All were as delicious as we remembered! At the end of our dinner, Flo herself came out to the table to check on us & thank us and wished me a Happy Birthday! We topped off the delicious meal with complimentary "scrumptious" Chocolate Won tons!  We'll be back for sure! Way to go Flo!

I am never disappointed when I come here. Service is always fast, friendly and the food is ALWAYS good. I got the Dan Dan noodles with chicken and it was great! They even accommodated me by making it Gluten-Free! I highly recommend this place. You won't be disappointed either. The only negative was the hostess didn't say "bye" or " see you next time" she just watched me walk out. Still enjoy this place though!

The Princess and I have been huge fans of Flo's for years, since the original Flo's next to Osco on TPPW before they moved across the street.  This location is our local favorite and try to get over from the NW Valley at least once a month. The Saturday $5 lunch special is truly the best lunch value in the value. I really admire her business acumen for recognizing the need to pack her place during the economic downturn, provide excellent jobs, and still make good money on volume rather than GM%, but I digress.  If the food wasn't good, it still wouldn't be worth $5 and it is.  We love the food and especially the generous discounts during happy hour.  My favorite on the menu is the house chow mein with shrimp, chicken, and beef-extra spice. It is one of my all-time favorite things to eat.  The Princess always gets the spicy ginger beef, kind of a play on mongolian beef, it's excellent as well.  Make sure you get the salad with their amazing, one of a kind ginger dressing, you'll want to take some home (and yes they will sell you a container of it).  Hat's off to Flo's! Fantastic food and excellent service!  Well done!

Since this location is brand new, it wasn't yet on Yelp. I requested for an additional menu to gather information and add the business onto Yelp. I informed our server it was strictly for Yelp adding purposes and that I wasn't going to order anything else. He informed the manager and they sent us a free dessert for helping aid their start to social media. Great management team!! Thanks Flo's!
If you love Asian food you need to try Flo's reasonable prices & food is off the chart. OMG!! happy hour is fabulous
Great atmosphere and service. Pot stickers wonderful as well as the soy braised tofu. Pricy but delicious!!!

Flo's is in one word... AWESOME! My family and I had reservations for 6 PM last night. Although the restaurant was very full we were shown to our table promptly at 6. The hostess waited for us to be seated and handed us our menus. She was very personable and answered all of the questions we had. Our bartender Blaze warmly welcomed us back for he must have remembered our faces. Total thumbs up in my book! Chris was also very attentive and the food was DELICIOUS! Blaze very patiently took care us and made the whole family out-ing great. Blaze, Chris, and all of Flo's staff... YOU ROCK! So glad Flo's has opened in our neighborhood.

The Chinese food was alright.  Our egg rolls were probably the best out of everything.  I ordered the cashew chicken and I didn't like it. The chicken was very rubbery.  The twice cooked pork was a tiny bit rubbery. I gave it three stars because the egg rolls were delicious and service was good. I will not be coming back here.

Its ok food. The portions are small especially for Chinese food. I think they actually pour oil directly on the dish. Ive never had food this oily.  I do like that you can ask for extra won tons but they charge you .25 cents a won ton.   Not very good, everything tastes the same.  Im also not sure if they use any hydrogenated oils
Greatest Happy Hour in Scottsdale!!  Excellent food and drinks and very attentive service.  For a really special dinner, order the Peking duck a day in advance.

It's sad that one of my first reviews is for a restaurant that is so utterly bad.   If I could give it a negative rating I would.   My advice is to skip this place.   The service is slow and the food was cold which I'm guessing are related as it seemed impossible that such a simple dish would take so long coming out of the kitchen.   The beer had stuff floating in the bottom of the glass which looked like sludge from the lines not being serviced. I mentioned the stuff in the glass to the server who ignored the comment and asked if I would like water!?!   The rice is recycled from other tables or I would guess it is as I found food in it! Further had a texture of new and old rice that had been mixed together and reheated several times.   The main dish I ordered was soft and almost without flavor did I mention cold like it sat for 20min.   I could go on but I won't.  I'm going to take something to get rid of this feeling of wanting to vomit.
Wow. Now I know what the fuss was about. Service could improve a bit. But food was very good. Would recommend this place anytime.

YUM! Everything is made fresh and they don't over cook the veggies.  They use a sauce in most of their dishes that is fabulous.  I take my visitors there and they say it is the best Chinese food ever.  Especially the hot and sour soup.  YUM! The service could improve.  When we do take out, it only takes 15 min.

This is my new fav way to eat Asian cuisine. Sorry peiwei doesn't even compare now that they cut their portions. I've been to flos 2x for lunch and dinner and the food is DELICIOUS big portions so I have more for later and the service is incrediable. Friendly waiters and people floating to fill drinks and so helpful with doors when I have the baby with me. Greta atmosphere, great food and great service. I'll go here at least 2x a month :)

Flo's is awesome! I love all the unconventional Asian dishes available here. They offer mainstream Chinese as well as some other delights from off the beaten path. The curries are all very good. And they make the best brown rice in town. A very solid restaurant. Great choice for a quick lunch under $20.

I love the food at Flo's but the parking and interior acoustics are dreadful. I know, I know, it's not Flo's fault that the parking is difficult, but Yelp is here to help others make educated dining decisions and I think the parking issue is relevant. So there you have it.

It was Sunday night and I'm craving pho . Unfortunately pho restaurants are usually closed on Sundays. So I gave this place a try . I ordered their beef pho and lettuce wraps . Lettuce wraps good typical lettuce wraps . Tasty and satisfying .  Now the pho ...... disappointed. I wasn't expecting much but seriously how can you call that pho . Soup tasted nothing like pho . The meat was good but not the typical meat that goes in pho . Where's the brisket ? Sliced rare beef? Tripe ? Tendon? Ugh I really wasted my money on some watered down not anything tasting pho .   I will definitely not order the pho again but might be back to try the Chinese food but hey I have pretty high expectations for it because of how pricey everything is .
All those things that Chanel said. Plus lettuce wraps. ~food boner~
Really good food. The management is really great. The staff is always nice. Very busy location. Get there early!

This is a really good place to eat....most of the time. I have tried several things off the menu but there is really only one thing I like there, Lunch. Otherwise I would have given it higher marks. they have a fantastic ginger dressing with the lunch salad and to date is still my favorite dressing period. They serve it in advance of the lunch item you ordered and fried won-ton chips come with that. The combined flavors and crunchy of the chips make it a great intro to the main lunch item.  My one and only favorite thing at Flo's it the Ginger Beef. It's in a dark spicy sauce and I also order it with peanuts. This flavor combination will rock you and the beef is very tender.  Try it for lunch some time.

This will always be my favorite Chinese Restaurant!  Hello, $5.00 lunches on Saturday's???  I AM IN!  The service, food and ambiance is always great.  The waitstaff work their tails off to get your food out to you as fast as they can.  The salad dressing is made fresh everyday and is the best dressing I think I have ever had.

I like Flo's for lunch. It's fast, it's tasty, and it's a ton of food for a pittance. I skip the wonton strips that come first and dig into the small green salad with the scrumptious ginger dressing.   My favorite dish here is the Yellow Curry Chicken because it has lots of  veggies. It comes with eggplant, broccoli, onions and peppers and tastes divine without being to overly rich. And there is always more than enough for a second meal. All that for just over 8 bucks (drink not included) is a heck of a good lunch deal. Lunch is served until 3pm too, which is nice for people who prefer a later lunch like I do.
Great fresh food and reasonable prices.  Love their soup!   So good and fresh.  Very clean and neat.

What a great surprise and a gem of a find! While some of the servers are quite young and clearly learning the ropes (we all learn somewhere, sometime), the service was excellent and the food was great. It is shocking that this place was a McDonalds for many, many years, you'd never know it,...and I know it! They did a fantastic job remodeling and rebuilding to make it very open, lively, warm, welcoming and a fun atmosphere.  The food was excellent!  All the ingredients were clearly fresh and each plate made to order. Spices were alive and spot on. Drinks were excellent! We went during happy hour and the value was incredible!! We had 4 or 5 appetizers, where were all good size and 2 drinks and the bill was less than $30,...and we were both stuffed and very, very satisfied! The manager stopped by to say hi and he was a super friendly, knowledgeable, caring guy, that was great.  This is seriously one of the best restaurants in the area. We only had appetizers and drinks but the entrees on the other tables looked delicious and huge and steamy hot!! I can't wait to go back and try them. If they are as good as the apps and drinks we had, I may need to "up" my review to even higher.  Really, stop in and try this hidden little gem, you won't be sorry!!!

Ordered to go. Asked for a small modification on one entree ("can you leave one item out"), but when we got it, it was not modified. So I just paid $15 for an entree I can't eat. Even if it was made modified, it was very dry. The other entree was just ok. Not worth the cost. I hade Asian food from food carts with better flavor.  Cost did not reflect quality. Too bad, since it's close to my house :/
It's an okay place. I liked 1 out of the 4 dishes that our table ordered. Very clean place and staff was friendly. Expensive for the food though.
Flo's is absolutely delicious! Their hot and sour soup is an absolute must, as are the lettuce wraps and cashew chicken! GREAT happy hour as well. Their wine list could use a little work though..
Good food, good service, not the highest quality ingredients (I usually have a few bites of chicken not worth eating). But overall a great place to eat!
Nice decor, busy for lunch with good lunch prices.  However, two of our meals - teriyaki chicken and cashew chicken were substantially overcooked and very tough, hardly "stir fry".
Best Food in Tempe & Scottsdale however I prefer Tempe (closer to home) prices are so great! I cannot say enough about the Food! It's the BEST! Staff are Amazing too!

I have been to this Flos 5 times and this was my worst experience here.  The food is still not here and we have been here for 30 minutes.  They said they were so busy that all of their 12-15 tea pots were being used by customers, but I looked around and saw only one table with a teapot.  Then, we waited 10 minutes for a tea refill.  The waitress must have realized we were becoming impatient because she excused the slowness and apologized.  However, the other Flos is always more busy but also more prompt.  So I know they have an example to live up to.  Really disappointed.  Won't be back. Won't recommend.

First time at Flo's last night and I was impressed!   My partner and I wanted to take my parents out for dinner and since my mother loves Asian food, we decided to try something different.   We all shared several different appetizers and dishes and the food was full of flavor and fresh!! We might of found a new favorite Asian restaurant.   The establishment was clean and sleek looking. It wasn't too hectic busy, but it was not dead either for a Sunday evening.   The service was great as well. Our server was personable and very helpful.   The prices were lower compared to other Asian establishments I have visited in the past.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a different place to eat at.

Good Asian food, can't give a complete review because I am very unadventurous and order the sweet and sour chicken every time, but that itself is great!  The Pre-meal salad is also good, coming from someone who is not an avid salad eater.  The only downside is the dressing coats your throat and you will be tasting it throughout the remainder of the day!
Can't beat the happy hour prices but enjoying a good Southeast Asian Peanut Chicken. The place is hopping but it is loud inside. That is the only real negative.
Fav Chinese in Phoenix area!  Fast order/take out too.  Family always wants Flos when they visit.  I like very spicy and lots of veggies.

I'm picky when is comes to Asian food. I used to work at a Japanese restaurant owned by a Japanese chef and I can never find anything that compares until now.  I was here lunch and had the summer spring rolls and chicken katsu.  Both were excellent.  The rice they serve with it is delicious.  I'll be back soon to try other dishes for sure. Mitchell took care me and the service was perfect.  Highly recommend Flo's.

Flos's is the place to go for happy hour! Seven days a week half priced drinks and appetizers! Need I say more? Ok... Appetizers are delicious and the cocktails are on point! I don't live in Scottsdale, or even in Arizona for that matter, but I do visit frequently and I make sure Flo's is on my list of "must do's"! The staff are professional and friendly. They check on you often enough to make sure you are well taken care of, but not too often so they don't interrupt your conversation with friends and family. The lighting in Flo's is perfect for the romantic and also for that business lunch! I love the atmosphere at Flo's and I'm sure you will too.

When we first moved here six years ago, we really liked going to Flo's. Their dishes were tasty and interesting to the pallet.  The two of us came for a late lunch and thought wow, things have gotten very expensive and the food was just okay.   I agree with everything my friend Marvin A wrote in his updated review just a few months ago. http://www.yelp.com/biz/flos-scottsdale-3?hrid=TJuxgsGDqv6OjBCHJk7gpw   Also, my friend Scott D brings up some very good points as well. http://www.yelp.com/biz/flos-scottsdale-3?hrid=l4MSDHKXs1IDBvKn1TjaHQ  So I call your attention to both of their reviews.   It seems Flo's no longer has a Luncheon Menu, only smaller portions of their regular dinner menu. We decided to start off with some pork Pot Stickers for $5.00. We were vanquished, so I decided to ordered two (if only to have some for later, or so I thought). These however were minis, barely half the normal size (see photo) and bland  Our lunch entrees were Chicken with Cashew for $9.00 and the Chicken Asian Peanut sauce over noodles for $11.50 (photos). Both were okay, just not memorable as we remembered eating in Flo's in the past.   We were saddened to see the direction Flo's has taken. There is no je ne sais quoi anymore. So our return factor is pretty low, though we might give them another try at some point.   Our lunch bill came in at $30.50 and our server Irene, was very good and kept our water glasses filled. So two and a half stars and barely "A-Okay". Now, where have you taken Flo?

You can't go wrong with the food. We ordered lettuce wraps, pot stickers, orange chicken and a few other "to-share" dishes and it was all amazing. However, the service here is terrible. I'm not sure why because usually it is pretty dead for the most part, but it is terrible service. Recommend the food, not the service. Maybe order take-out.

21/2 years in AZ and we have thrown away more Chinese food than we have eaten, I had given up.  But someone took me here, I was of course hesitant.  I ordered the Lo Mein.  Service was very fast and the place is crisp and clean.  We were given a small salad, the dressing was delicious, I licked the plate.  The Lo Mein was more of a chow mein but not quite what I have been looking for but fresh, good, very very good.  I ate it all, did not throw it away.  Looking forward to going back and trying something else.   FINALLY!!!!
Not sure what happened this time, but we had to wait for forty minute for our order, and the spring rolls were very greasy.  The rest of the order was only mediocre.  Too bad

Great happy hour and it lasts till 7pm! CHEERS to that!  Half price all drinks and appetizers. The chicken wings are delicious! The service has been slow but only when all tables are full and that is understandable. They are doing something right!

This isn't bad Chinese, but it's not great. I got the sesame Thai peanut chicken. The only thing "peanut" about it was the fact that there were chopped peanuts in it. What about the Thai peanut sauce? Aw, bummer. At least the veggies were good and the chicken wasn't bad! The service here is really good, and the staff are extremely friendly.
Flo's is excellent. I love the food here. Quality tasting, good portions and great service. We love all the dishes we ordered, and in love with the wide beef noodle dish.
Definitely americanized asian cuisine. But very good none the less. I had the green curry and it was pretty good. I'd definitely recommend it to other people.
Arrived for dinner with minimal wait time. First impression very noisy. Wait staff very attentive. But lack luster food. Pool of grease came under the spring rolls and the entree was very dry.

great food, and fast friendly service.  We go there often and also get takeout.  It's definitely a go-to restaurant for guest in town or when we are in the mood for chinese.  The only reason I can't give 5 stars is that I wish the menu was broader or more creative.  I end up ordering the same 2-3 things everytime.  Still one of our favorite places.

It was good, but it was overpriced for quantity and what you got. Guess I'll go back if I really need to. Will definitely investigate less expensive options. I think it's the most I've ever paid for Asian food. Was desperate for a quick meal. Wasn't all that quick even

Went for lunch today.  Place looked great inside.  We had lunch off of the appetizer menu.  Lettuce wraps were fantastic, as were pot stickers.  Our waitress was Stephanie, and she took good care of us.  I was really impressed with the whole place and am glad to see this type of food available.  We would not hesitate to try it for dinner as well.  I found the price to be very reasonable for the quality.

The fact that this place is so crowded at lunchtime just confirms my suspicion that most Scottsdale residents have more money than taste.  This place is aggressively mediocre and proud of it.  You could get better Chinese at Applebee's for a lot less money.  I had to load on the soy sauce and chili oil just to make my lunch have any taste at all, and even then it tasted like mildly spiced dishwater.  Pretty bad when even your chili oil lacks flavor and authenticity.

Had dinner there last night to give it another try.  Something is going on in the kitchen as the food is getting worse.  Had potstickers, small and tasteless, lettuce wraps, lettuce wilted, chicken and snap peas, white meat not soft and tender without sauce like it used to be and lacking in flavor.  If the food was better we could put up with the noise level which is terrible, but afraid we have to find another place for chinese food.  Somehow, the place is going down hill fast.  Sorry.

The food was excellent and so was our waiter. The price is very reasonable.  Other than our excellent waiter, every other employee was rude and aloof. The woman seating us said nothing, but pointed to where we should sit. The man bringing out our food gave the impression he was in a big hurry, and could care less about us. As we left, a woman said in a monotone voice "Thank you for coming" without looking up from what she was reading.  We arrived as the restaurant opened at noon on a Sunday. There were very few people there, but they sat us all close together. It was extremely loud because there is little to soften the echoes and noise from other tables. If we go there again, we will ask to be seated far from where others are seated.

I love Flo's... they have lunch specials during the week only that include brown or white rice and a salad.  Love the miso dressing... its delicious!  I usually get the kung pao chicken... friend likes the double cooked pork or something like that.  Happy is great... 1/2 price appetizers and drinks!  With the happy hour apps they are full size... not smaller due to 1/2 price.  Wings are good, potstickers are yummy too.  You can order lunch size portion anytime but I don't think you get the salad with it if its not during lunch.  I think I like the other location on Frank Lloyd Wright better... it seems they do things differently there... i.e. I think you can get fried rice with lunch special there where I found that at this location...  if you want fried rice... you just have to get an order of it.

the food is decent, not my favorite place to go but you definitely get a good meal. and the prices are great, especially for how much food you get. the people inside have always been very nice as well. so no complaints.

"BLAND" is my one word summary  1) vegetable dumplings...i'd say it was frozen then thawed out and tasted like pot stickers you'd get anywhere...the one's at Fate now those were good. (2 stars)  2) hot & sour soup was huge which is usually a good thing...but useless if it doesn't taste hot & sour at all...all I tasted was sweet & more sweet soup. (1 stars)  3) chicken vindaloo (what was I thinking ordering and indian dish at a chinese place?)  anyways probably the worst thing I have ever tasted in my life and tasted absolutely nothing like chicken vindaloo. (0 stars)  4) wife had vegetable fried rice...i think they forgot that we ordered everything spicy...had no flavor and i think they even forgot the soy sauce to make it fried rice (1 star)  on a positive note my wife did like the free salad and wonton chips and the service was good.  overall I wouldn't give this place another try even with all the stellar reviews.

Food was great, but I was disappointed with their customer service. When ordering a plate that came with a side of white rice, I asked them if they could substitute the white rice with fried rice and I offered to pay them extra to do so. They said that there was no way that they would be able to do that even after I insisted that I'd pay them a good amount just so that I could have fried rice... just seems like a simple request from a customer that would do the restaurant no harm, especially when the customer is willing to pay for the substitution...

The food here tastes good and overall it's a nice place but the prices are high for the quality/qty of food you receive, point in case the fried rice is $13 and whichever protein you add is proportionately small. Kids meals are $7 for a large serving which is great. Happy hour makes drinks and apps. half off which is nice. There are many other Chinese cuisine options that offer better quality food at a more affordable price.  The downside to dining in is that it's loud, mega loud inside but if you're a large group this would be a good place since the service was very attentive.

Good food and service was efficient. We ordered the pad Thai and yellow chicken curry soup. Both with quite delicious and savory. While the pad Thai wasn't traditional, their spin on the dish was quite pleasing. The yellow curry with chicken is absolutely delicious, a must try! The restaurant is located in a busy plaza and has very clean upscale decor. Give them a shot and I think you'll be pleasantly surprised :)
Love this place. The best happy hour ever. Half price appetizers, half price drinks, and the food is amazing. This is our new favorite local hang out place in south Tempe.

Ive eaten here twice and I dont think Ill ever eat here again. I ordered the lettuce wraps and the food smelled like horrible BO. It made me so nauseous I couldnt even eat it. The salad is decent but I still cant get over that smell!

I'm had an appointment in Tempe & when I left I was looking for a place to eat and Flo's caught my eye. Very nice place. Very clean. The service from employees was outstanding! I truly enjoyed my lunch special, it was a lot, plenty left over for dinner :) I will differently be going back!

I really like this place but they definitely have some things to work on. I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could.   Pros: food is great, service is good, drinks are strong, restaurant looks nice.  Cons: if you come during dinner time it is extremely loud. They did an extremely poor job with sound management. It would also be nice if they put some booths in as the seating isn't the most comfortable. Also seems like they might be understaffed, though I myself am surprised a restaurant is this busy on a Wednesday evening!   I think this place has a lot of potential. They do a very interesting mix of Asian foods including Chinese, Indian, Thai, etc. I really hope they can work out their kinks. Especially the sound.. It wasn't fun to sit here in silence with my fiance.

Average food, average service, average prices and thereby an average rating. This place is nothing out of the ordinary. We primarily decided to go here because of decent ratings and reviews, but weren't really impressed with anything. First of all, they seated us right next to the entrance door, saying that the rest of the area "was closed", although I could clearly see people eating there. After requesting several times, we got a better seat, and shortly after we were seated in the "closed" section, a group of 10 people were seated there. Seriously guys? We ordered the green curry chicken, and the scallops/mushrooms as entrees, both were okay at best. Definitely a one time eat place, life is too short for just ordinary! :-)

My girlfriend and I went to dinner here and her meal came out with the wrong type of noodles so they went ahead and remade the dish for her. Then our waitress informed us that the manager and her went ahead and comped our WHOLE $34 meal (2 entrees and an appetizer) for us because of the kitchen's mistake. Good food and great customer service!! We'll be back!
What a great place for happy hour! We sat at the bar food and service was great and such a good price!

Who doesn't love Flo's!  This review is only for their lunch menu, but let's face it - it is all delicious! The lunch menu is such a great deal for the food that is prepared for you. Tried the chicken chow fun and katsu chicken, and both dishes were fresh and extremely tasty. My mother and I both said, "Wow, this fried rice is amazing!" I would highly recommend for anyone needing an option to select. We both needed To Go boxes to bring the rest of our food home!  The interior decor kind of relaxes me and feels zen. I will be a regular of Flo's as long as their around!

My new happy place when it comes to Asian food. It's trendy, casual but not too informal, the open space is great for groups or if you feel like having a drink at the bar and a solo meal. Kitchen ran smooth, apps were done and entrees quickly followed. Staff is super friendly and our servers had great suggestions to try, and explained the tastes perfectly. Def worth trying something new every visit, been here more than 3 times and haven't been disappointed.

It disappoints me to give Flo's a 1 star as the food at their Scottsdale location has been decent but I will not return to this one again. After ordering, we were sitting for an over extended period of time for our food. (Ordered carry out). After a while someone brought out a carry out order to the desk but the attendants were not there. Finally the girl walked back to us and said she was going to check on our order. the next thing I see is that she is coming out the other door and walks toward one of her friends working and strikes up a casual conversation completely forgetting about us waiting. I decide to get up to look at the order they brought out and it was ours! Talk about bad service.  So... we get home to eat (ordered the Lemongrass chicken. The dish was completely without flavor and was only a bunch of noodles and some small pieces of chicken. Everything else was left out including the flavor. Charging as much as they do for measly dishes is just plain out ripping people off.  I would never recommend anyone eating here. There is Yupha's Thai and many other delicious places around with much better service staff and quality of food.

Pot stickers round 1 still very doughy asked for chili paste showed up after I finished round one pot stickers round 2 pot stickers better than round  1 showed up with chili paste ........ had to request water3 times ..........

I thought we were in for something special. After driving from Chandler just to try this place, we were gravely disappointed. The food was average at best. The mangolian beef was burnt and flavorless (See attached). Trust me, you'll drive past better Asian food places to get here. Good Luck!

Fresh and tasty! Big menu, I feel I could eat here often without getting bored. I had the shrimp wontons to start which were good but nothing special. The shrimp chili stir fry for entree was full of flavor on the other hand and presented beautifully. My girlfriend and the shrimp pad Thai. She said it was delicious with thick noodles and a light sauce. Their food feels light and fresh instead of heavy and saucy like so many Asian restaurants. I'll be back!

Had lunch there yesterday, first time there.  I found the atmosphere very cold a barren.  They had hard rock music on, which made me dizzy.  Service was good, didn't have to wait long. the place was almost empty (at noon).  Food was good, small portions. I had Kung Pau Chicken, nice and spicy.  Wife had asparagus chicken, I felt it was too bland. Probably not go back.

Passing by the opposite direction on way to an appointment saw this place and thought it looked different form what I usually see in Tempe. Baseline is a changing from our living there 20 years ago. Most of the businesses have changed or been replaced with new buildings and businesses.along Baseline.  This place had a vibe look to it and after our business in Tempe i pulled into Flo's for lunch. It was a very open floor, many tables inside and a nice patio outside with hanging wired lights which gives a feeling of fun. Of course it was lunch and no need for lights but the patio was clean and had a modern look. Have to go back some evening and enjoy  the ambiance with the great food.  Back to lunch. It took us a little extra time deciding as it was our first time eating there. I coped out and went easy ordering the Chicken teriyaki and a app of pot stickers. My wife had so curry something. It looked and tasted good. I enjoyed my meal and the service was more than excellent.  As Arnold says, I'll b bac

We can't figure out why all of the rave reviews. We've been here several times with friends, and the best thing about the place isn't the unique food, but the unique decor. The food is O.K., but not outstanding. The lettuce wraps don't even come close to PF Chang's wraps, the chicken skewers with peanut sauce were overcooked - dry and chewy, the peanut sauce gloppy and thick, the chicken fried rice was not flavorful at all. The Mongolian beef was good.  You can't beat half-off happy hour, though. Maybe that's why the place gets such rave reviews - after a few drinks, almost anything tastes good!

I usually just get take-out from this place, so I can't speak for an important factor - the service. Whenever I get take-out however, they have a good amount of food and doesn't take too long to be ready.   Worth mentioning: The hot and sour soup is amazing. I would seriously get take-out just to get that soup. The mushrooms especially are phenomenal. Who would do shrooms when Flo has much better mushrooms in her soups? Ha!

We ordered a to go order and when we got to the restaurant they forgot to place the order and tried to make us believe we ordered the food from a different location! We asked for the manager he apologized and told us he would cover the bill and when the food came out he over charged charged us and the amount ended up being $37.00! Since we paid for the food we reluctantly ate is and it was horrible! Bad management, horrible take out department, nasty food! If I could give zero start I would! Don't waist your time McDonalds down the street has better service! Oh wait! This property was a McDonalds! Don't waist your time this place is bad!

I love this place and it really is the only good Chinese restaurant in the area that's not super, super casual. (Asian Island is good but it is really casual).   Their won ton soup is so amazing and delicious. It is huge for $5. LOVE this soup.   I had the sweet and sour chicken and my boyfriend had the chicken katsu. The sweet and sour chicken was really good and "typical" flavors. The katsu was soo yummy I ate more of his than mine. I keep sneaking my fork onto the plate for some of that delicious rice. Katsu it is for me on our next trip to Flos.  It would be nice if the restaurant wasn't so modern looking, I love the traditional Chinese food places. The atmosphere is still really nice though so I can't fault them too much.

This place has the best happy hour on the planet. Every day from 3-7. Even weekends. Half price on all drinks, including bottles of wine. Half price on all appetizers, of which there is a substantial selection and the food is fresh and good.   We had:  A bottle of wine ($38 full price) Chicken satay Lettuce wraps Chicken pot stickers Shu Mai dumplings Teriyaki chicken skewers  Hot and sour soup  Veggie Lo mein Grand total before tip: $55.05 And a lot of yummy left overs!!
Great food and a good price! Owners are nice too! I have only been to the Scottsdale location but I'm sure all are great!!

Two words - HAPPY HOUR!!! Actually- more words - SEVEN DAYS A WEEK! Appetizers are almost all half price, drink specials are totally reasonable. The spring rolls are so good. Spicy ginger beef - yummy. Orange chicken w sauce on the side. Mongolian beef - add spicy. I could go on and on. Only thing I didn't Love was the calamari. Bar staff is nice, and happy hour - again- is seven days a week!
All the food is good, spicy lettuce wraps are so great!! And the happy hour from 3-7 is truly a great deal. Love Flo's

Trying to find good Thai in Phoenix can be a challenge. So is trying to find good Chinese that doesn't make you want to fall asleep an hour afterwards. I think Flo's just came up 2 for 1. My GF is gluten free and loves calamari, loves breaded calamari but can't eat it. Bam. In comes Flo's to save the day. They have this seasoning that imitates breading and is actually pretty awesome. I had the spicy pork and added pineapple. Recommendation of the the waitress and bam, home run! It was out of the park good.  The portion size is great for the average person to have two servings. I'll admit it, I ate the whole thing.   So good.

Very disappointed. The menu looked great and the restaurant looks nice, but the food is just awful. Ordered shrimp skewers and spicy orange chicken. The shrimp was probably the worst shrimp I have ever had. The orange chicken comes with the sauce on the side. Sauce was decent but the chicken, which was breaded and fried, was awful. Really chewy and had a strange texture.   I know this restaurant was converted from an old McDonald's and sadly I wished I had gone across the street to McDonald's instead.

Flo's is the bomb-diggity. My family has known Flo since she was the cook at Eddie Chan's in Scottsdale. I loved that little hole in the wall Chinese restaurant and was sad when they closed and reopened in Cave Creek as an expensive up-scale place. But Flo's is still affordable. The portion sizes are good (I can't even eat a whole kids order of sweet & sour chicken) and they now have steamed bbq pork buns *drool*. The atmosphere is a little nerve-racking though. Maybe it's the bare floors and high ceilings but it always seems loud and chaotic there.

I LOVE Flo's!!!!  They have great service, the food is delicious and well priced.  This is one of my favorite places to go for lunch or to take out of town guests.  I especially love their salad and their lettuce wraps.

I don't know how to describe it, but the food tastes clean here, and I think its a good thing.  We ordered take out, I had the Chicken Lo Mein, the wife had the Seared Ahi Salad, and we shared an order of the fried shrimp and bacon.  Everything tasted great, and it didn't leave me with the greasy regret feeling afterwards. At about $40 with tip, it beats cooking.

Went for Happy Hour. Drinks and Appetizers are half off from 3-7. Ordered Wonton Soup which I did not like at all and Spicy Wontons which I did not like. Teriyaki Chicken Skewers were very good and the Pork Fried Rice was very good. Chicken Lettuce Wraps were very good too. Service could have been better, but it was happy hour. I don't think I will come back but gave it 3 stars as it may just be my personal taste, as it always seems to be busy there.
Absolutely love this restaurant! Very clean and great atmosphere. The food is always good, fresh, and very well seasoned. They have really good lunch specials also.

Trying to decide what to do for dinner the other night ... we settled on Chinese.  So at Flo's - we selected Lemon Pepper Chicken, Kung Pao Chicken.  We shared both dishes - and both were loaded with flavor and just hit the spot.  There was not one morsel of food left on either platter.  Can't wait for the next visit!  Service was great, and It's nice to see the owner circulate and ensure service and food lives up to her expectations.  Well done!
The worst service i have ever gotten at any restaurant.  It took 30 min. just to get drinks. I will NEVER go back. After not getting out order after 40min. we left.

They have redeeemed themselves! I was really craving chicken vindaloo and was in Tempe so decided to see if things had changed.  It was absolutely delicious.  The vindaloo was done perfectly and the service was great. So glad to see that they are now up to the level of the Scottsdale location.

Have to say the quality is going down hill as is the service.  We typically go here once a week and the last two times have been less than desirable. The service was slow and the food was warm at best.   I hope they turn it around because we used to really love going there.

used to be a daily lunch spot when I didn't want to deal with the chaos inside ajs just for a salad. I've never once disliked anything. the service is quick and quiet. 99% of the time it's busy but the ticket time is super quick so tables are turned in no time. idk wtf is going on with those little peanut cookies they give opposed to a fortune cookie but I could eat a million of them.
Nice decor, clean & semi decent food. Still searching for good, authentic asian food in scottsdale-it doesnt look too compromising :(

Went to Flo's tonight, we ordered hot and sour soup, which was very sour & not hot at all; crunchy tofu with veggies, which was ok, one of the highlights of the meal; veggie chow mein, which was tasteless; veggie fried rice was ok, nothing special; and moo shu chicken, which wasn't good. The majority of the meal was tasteless. There were 5 of us in total, and we paid $50 plus tip.

First of all, there really is a Flo. It's her face on the website, and you will see her at Flo's Chinese Restaurant often, walking the tables, checking on her guests, a strong quiet presence. Here is what I think you need to know: Flo gets it.  She understands what people want, how much, how fast, and she get's that while things are better, they can still be tight.   Iv'e been to dinner at Flo's with a party as big as 17.  Finding a restaurant that will please the 17 distinct and neurotic personalities of food-mates, (Settle down, I keep you anonymous) is no small task.   There are roughly 15 Appetizers to choose from, and Flo's sweet and sour sauce is the mortar we use to hold them all together. It is great on everything, and I've poured it straight from the saucer into my mouth. It's so good I've devoted a whole paragraph to it. Back to the Appetizers. My daughter Olivia will lie right to your face to get an extra Flo's spring roll. She will fake a limp, put her arm in a sling, ask you if you've lost weight. Whatever it takes. Our Wing-nut, we'll call him Cluck Norris, calls Flo's Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings one of his favorites.  I'm happy enough with the little bowl of wontons and sweet and sour sauce, Flo's version of chips and salsa, that come to the table gratis.   Flo's offers a green dinner salad. The lettuce is fresh, topped with some orange slices, pretty standard stuff. It's the dressing, this magnificent, green, sweet, horseradishey (look it up, it's an actual culinary term) nectar that is absolutely fabulous. We've tried to coax a few of the ingredients out of Flo's savvy and tight-lipped crew, telling them we have allergies and that it's a safety concern, but no dice. They smile knowingly and give nothing away.  The main courses are solid, and we can't budge our kids from their favorites. My son, 19 and 6'7" has two favorites, the Cinnamon Shrimp and the Sweet and Sour Chicken. The shrimp are plump and saut√©ed with peas and carrots in a sweet-spicy sauce with a hint of cinnamon. It is served, as several of Flo's dishes are, over shredded lettuce. Yeah, shredded lettuce. My favorite dish, the Lemon Pepper Shrimp and Chicken, comes over shredded lettuce and it hits all the gustatory pleasure zones. The shrimp pops in your mouth, the chicken is sliced thin and together with the lemon and pepper, the oils and scallions, is savory and spicy, crunchy and rich. I have to tell you, I've tried to speak while eating it and drooled right in front of a loan officer I'd taken to lunch. It's just the price of doing business at Flo's.   A Chinese restaurant is only as good as it's Sweet and Sour Sauce. I know an authentic sweet and sour sauce is supposed to be browner than it is red. The sweet is supposed to come from the sugars in fruit or honey, the sour from vinegar. So, in terms of authenticity, where's all the ubiquitous bright red sauce come from? I don't care. I want my Sweet and Sour sauce really sweet, and slut lipstick red. Flo's delivers.  It is soo good.  I could eat a bowl of white rice, drenched in Flo's Sweet and Sour, every day for the next 9 months and not get bored. When I'm alone, I like to take a big table spoon of it and smash it into my face then pull the spoon away and let it fall down my shirt, then I spend the next 3 minutes licking my lips. Yeah, I have a problem.

I had a take out of Cashew Chicken a few months ago since Flo's was on the way home from work, I believe it was in the $12 dollar range. I thought the meal had no real taste to it. I didn't even finish my meal, which is a rare occurence for me.  I just don't get how the restaurant is always filled. There are much better Chinese food options around Scottsdale such as Ling & Louies or Asian Island to name a couple.  Oh well, let the lemmings keep coming back for more, they just don't know any better.

For the life of me, I cannot understand why everyone loves Flo's.  The only thing that this place appears to have going for it is the location.  In this neighborhood, they really are the only option for quick Asian food.  I've been stuck ordering food from here several times because my Starbucks of choice, jeweler, waxer, and nail place are all in this shopping center; when you only have 15 minutes in between appointments and you are starving, sometimes you just have to suck it up.  The service is horrible, especially at the bar.  The bartenders typically spend most of their time socializing with one another and other servers.  There have been a few times that a dirty glass from another patron (or an empty glass from me) have sat unnoticed and are only cleared or refilled after flagging someone down.  The food is a hit-or-miss experience.  It's either good or completely shameful (tending more towards the shameful).  The crab puffs are good, but only if you adore warm cream cheese with a few hints of fake crab.  The summer rolls have potential, but could be improved if they didn't put so much shredded iceberg lettuce inside.  Their idea of pho is a total joke.  The beef is well done strips of leather (not rare) and they use overcooked noodles that have no business being in pho.  Their pad thai is moosh and pretty sad (if you want excellent pad thai, you should try the Wild Thaiger--amazing!).  The final insult came when they started using spaghetti noodles in the Lo Mein.  They do offer a great deal on Saturdays ($5 lunch) but it reminds me of Nordstrom's Last Chance; yeah, the prices are stellar, but who cares if you can't find anything of quality?  The only reason they are getting two stars, instead of one, is because of the few appetizers that have been edible.  So, if you are stuck there because of a nail or wax appointment, go ahead and take a chance, but you will probably regret it.

This location just opened in June and I finally stopped in last night with friends to check it out.  SO glad we did!  There were six of us so I had the opportunity to try a bit of everything!  Such a great menu and I couldn't find a dish on our table that wasn't awesome!  A bit pricey, but well worth it!

Such a disappointment!! Love their Scottsdale's original location. Thought this would be the same but it was at best mediocre food. The service sucked. The waitress was inefficient and didn't care much. We ordered the spice dish which was the worst I have ever had.  Compared to the other locations this one is just a let down  Will probably give it one try otherwise just one step up from Panda Express!

Pricey and Bland.  We ordered takeout for the whole family.  Spicy Orange chicken sauce was ok but even with the sauce the deep fried chicken had an ultra bland taste. Black Pepper chicken was a little better, but overloaded with huge onion chunks and bell peppers about 8-1 ratio Onion and bell pepper to chicken.  Crispy spring rolls were also a dud.  The place was packed, but it was 7pm on a Friday night and it's new to the area.  My wife said the tofu was descent.  Long story short I'd go to Pei Wei or PF Chang's 10 out of 10 times over this place.

The egg drop soup comes in a HUGE portion. Like, it was surprising to get that much soup for that price and as an appetizer. It was delightful though! I had the pad thai and loved it! My husband has the Kung Pao and said it was the best he's ever had. Would definitely recommend this place :)

So the story...this place was started by Paul Fleming...who started PF Changs, after he sold Changs off to the restaurant group.  It's been a long time since I lived in Phoenix, but that was the urban legend back then.    The food is solid, as is the line at lunch.

Always solid service, food, love the updates they did to the restaurant (beautiful booths, colors, pux).  Clean, friendly and the best chinese fusion in the area.   Been coming to flos for over a decade..saturday 6.00 lunch.. Amazing! Salad + seems like over 20+ items to choose from for sat special. I would come and pay full price :) arrive before 12 noon the place will be packed by 12:10.  -flos bbq pork+ chicken fried rice always a must. Chili oil and their yummy salad with their signature dressing. Delish!  Support local! Your belly will thank you.
Pretty good. Was told it was like pf changs (not as good) Close to my house. Decent Chinese. Friendly staff. I eat here atleast once a month.

Half price happy hour is what caught my eye, since I have teenagers that eat a ton!  In and out is easy so long as you go before 5:30, otherwise there is a bit of a wait.  Food quality good and love all of the shrimp dishes!
I'm not particularly a fan of fusion but Flo's is definitely the exception. The food and service was great!

Flo's has done an amazing job of remodeling an old McDonalds. The former McDonalds' drive-thru is now outdoor seating and the inside has been redone in a "yuppie-wannabe" sleek, modern look. It was 12:30pm on a cold, rainy day and the place was not even half full.   I was seated right away and my server brought me some water and took my order promptly. I requested some hot green tea since it was a cold day. Beverages are not listed on the menu, so I have no idea what this costs. I never did find out since they never brought my tea. My server stopped back as I finished my meal and I told him to cancel the tea since I was done eating.  I ordered the Lemon Chicken ($9 for lunch) with brown rice. This was supposed to be a special recipe of the chef. Unfortunately, there was no detectable lemon flavor--in fact no flavor at all. Surprisingly, this was the most bland Asian food I have ever encountered. It was so bland that I could not even eat half of the food on the plate (and this was a smaller portion size than most Asian restaurants serve). The chicken was odd in that it was in small flat squares--sort of like the frozen meat chunks you encounter at YC's Mongolian Grill.  I was also brought a small salad with some kind of ginger-peanut sauce on it. It was OK, nothing special. It was also a surprise since there is nothing on the menu about salads being included with my meal. The obligatory fortune cookie shows up with the bill.  The restaurant is clean and the staff efficient (except for the hot tea fiasco). Parking has always been difficult in this particular shopping center. I probably would not go out of my way to eat here again.
Have been back twice since my initial visit.. Not too pricey but fast and delicious food with fantasic waiting staff and a pleasent decor

Fastest lunch ever.  Great vegan options.  Friendly service.  I wish my wife liked Chines because it would definitely be a dinner option.  For now, it's my quickie lunches at the bar.  Fried rice and crispy tofu!

LOVE Flo's!  We have been coming here for over four years, and it's a family favorite.  The food is always FRESH, the service reliable, and the flavors amazing.  My family has their favorites:  the Wonton soup, a light broth, with fresh basil, sliced char sui pork, and wontons; egg drop soup with shrimp; we always get two orders of Calamari, which is sooo addictive- chewy crunchy with vegetables and a salty-spice seasoning; fabuloso lettuce wraps, no special sauces needed; and my youngest loves the crab puffs.  Note- I haven't even addressed the entree's, but we have had many and have never been disappointed.  We usually order our usual orange-style chicken (kids), and one other entree that's new to us.  Truly, never a bad experience.  I'm partial to the vegetarian eggplant dish, and the YangChow fried rice.  I'm just getting ready to take my family there now for dinner, in fact!  We have done Mother's day there, and family birthdays.  There is so much variety, and everyone is happy.  Prices have gone up, but lunch deals are great.

As far as I'm concerned, Flo's Chinese Restaurant can expand their mini dynasty into MY neighborhood!  I'd heard largely good things about Flo's and decided to take it in, myself.  Surprise, surprise...it's in a strip mall, but a quaint one at that.  The interior is sorta (sub)urban-chic.  It's a mix of upscale and low-brow with linen table cloths and throwaway paper napkins.  Cool enough for adults, yet casual enough if you're bringing the kids.  I was fortunate in that unlike some other Yelpers, I had no trouble finding a parking spot and the decibel level was comfortable.  The hostess was smiley and seated me right away.  The server and busboy (or is that bus man???) were quick to have ice water, crispy won tons with duck sauce and a complimentary side salad (iceburg, romaine, carrot slivers) on the table within seconds.  It's evident they are aware the lunch crowd may not have time for a long wait.  I didn't go crazy, sticking to a couple of "safe" options ordering the orange chicken with steamed white rice and the Triple Chocolate Mousse.  The dessert was pretty, but just OK for flavor and texture.  However, I have to say the chicken was fantastic; moist without too much batter!  I've had orange chicken at many other restaurants before and have been served lumps of fried dough with an indiscernible amount of actual chicken.  Not the case at Flo's!  The portions were good and the prices very reasonable: just $7 for the lunchtime entree!  Next time I'll take advantage of the $5 special on a Saturday!
Overrated and pricey, with a combination of bland food And complete lack of service. Avoid this place, unless that Is what you are looking for.

I took my father here for dinner because I had heard so many good things about it. The restaurant was relatively slow when we arrived. We were sat by a very friendly hostess and waters were promptly delivered. Then we sat at our table for over 15 minutes without receiving any further service. I had to ask the hostess to find our waitress for us.  Once they finally came over and took our order they hardly seemed apologetic for the neglect. In addition to having to wait so long to even place our order they forgot my order when the food finally arrived. I will not take anything away from the quality of their food but the service is less than up to standard. Id recommend getting take out.
Great Design Very Modern Excellent Food  Menu & there wonderful HH EVERY Day like in N. Scottsdale. Staff Super friendly !!  Glad to see it here as we just moved to Tempe after YEARS in Scottsdale

Since Day One~ Month One ~I have gone to this restaurant. Recommended it to Many Many people- Clients, Friends, my Real Estate office-taken many of our family and friends but usually go ourselves, usually 2X a month.... because we were able to get in and enjoy a inexpensive HH- ...  But tonight we were skipped over after waiting almost 30 mins-  and did not get in-they now have a call in reservation or call in wait list . I think Long time loyalty should be recognized. Sorry Flo-  you shouldn't leave LONG TIME CUSTOMERS STANDING- who come ALL Year round for the SNOW BIRDS.

Meets all the criteria for a splendid lunch.  Quick and efficient service.  Great prices.  Food that doesn't make you want to take a 2pm nap.  And food that is exceptionally tasty....even a tad healthy.

Fred,Flo and the entire staff are delightful. it is my neighborly placeto go for a carry out, or even a cocktail with friends, or best yet to have a nice meal in the casually elegant dining area.                i have had experiences many times where they go above and beyont tomake sure I eas 110% pleas ed. Just go there,, both locations are great,, exceed expectations at reasonable price!,

I love this place and I think it's hilarious all these dumb people getting take out and bitching about the amount of food they get.  NEWS FLASH PEOPLE: TAKE OUT CONTAINERS ARE THE SAME SIZE EVERYWHERE!!  Go to the restaurant and order a dish and you will have food for a few meals! It's amazing how that works...  The food quality is amazing, and the portions are amazing IN THE RESTAURANT. If you get food to go the chefs have to pack food into a container.   The apps are awesome and fresh, good size. The entrees are large and have plenty of veg and meat (depending what you order). We frequent this place (both take-out and dine-in), and when we go there we get twice as much food as when we take out. HOWEVER this is not the restaurants fault, it's just the way it goes when you take food out of a restaurant.   Eat at the restaurant and enjoy great service and even better food. Take out and expect less food but great food.
This place is terrible. Slow service, slow food and cold chicken. We've been here a couple times before and never had this much of a problem. I even asked for salt and pepper and never got it. Wow
Got a hair in our crab puffs, a big disgusting hair. They didn't do anything but take that part off of the bill. Not sure if there were anymore hairs.

Flo's has the most delicious food and absolute great service. Their lunch specials are fantastic and prices are great, I come here for lunch periodically through the week and on the weekend for dinner and i have not once been disappointed with service or food quality. I highly recommend.

Great gem in Tempe. The food is flavorful and plentiful. Service is great and the servers are well trained.  Don't order too much. Lots of plates are big enough to share. And if you do get too much, it is yummier the next day.  Get there for Happy Hour. Great drinks and appetizers.

'Delish food at reasonable prices' -pretty generous with their portions. - reasonably nice ambiance - Tom Yum soup was good... a lil on the saltier side...but lots for the price -basil chicken was great -kimchi was fantastic and again lots of it 4 the price    Associating the word 'Confusion' with a restaurant is somewhat rare for me...but my experience definitely deserves it.. The place was a lil hard to find in the the big strip mall- confusion 1 We were still waiting on the entree when the waitress comes and packs the leftover appetizers- confusion 2 We get the check before the entree comes...lol  - confusion 3

A group of us came here for dinner and I was not a big fan! The portion sizes were small and the price we paid was big. The food wasn't tasty at all. I think Pei Wei's food is a lot flavorful and the food portions are better. We spent close to $80.00 for dinner for five. The service was very good because the restaurant was empty during dinner.

My sister invited us to have dinner with her and my brother-in-law at Flo's in the Promenade, Saturday evening at 5:30, so we could get their early bird 1/2 price appetizers!  It was a 30 minute drive for us.  I poured over at least 70 or 80 reviews that afternoon.  When it comes to oriental food there is a distinct separation into Americanized and Authentic in our population, you need to be aware of what group you belong to. Flo's is definitely for the Americanized palate:(  a group we don't belong to.  But family is family so along we went. We ordered 5 Appetizers: #1-Salt & Pepper Chicken Wings (Seasoned with spicy chile salt and tossed with bell peppers, fresh chiles, and onions) and told there would be a 15 -20 minute wait, no problem.  Also ordered #2-Thai Style Calamari & Chiles. (Breaded calamari seasoned with chile-pepper salt, diced bell peppers, green onions, and a hint of lime). Next #3-Chinese Lettuce Wraps. (Chicken in a sweet hoisin sauce with water chestnuts, mushrooms, and green onions.  #4-Pot Stickers (Pork), and #5-Singapore Chicken Satay (Skewers of tender chicken breast drenched in a rich peanut sauce). The chicken appeared to be ground and somewhat gritty but the peanut sauce was tasty and worth 2 1/2 stars. #1 & 2 were listed as spicy, - NOT, no heat at all!  The wings were crispy and had a nice flavor, alone I'd give them a 4 and the Calamari were quite tough and chewy, cut in long thick strips and had a "fishy" taste and no spicy taste I'd give a 1.  Also decided to order their Chinese Hot & Sour Soup - A thick and hearty soup made from an old village recipe with chicken, shrimp, tofu, mushrooms, eggs, cilantro, and green onions.  that had rated several rave reviews, I wonder which soup they really had.  No hint of spice, a strange aftertaste and a rather large portion that didn't taste like any other hot & sour soup we have had. Rated it a 1.  The lettuce wraps had no water chestnut crunch and little flavor and rated a 2.  The pot stickers were somewhat dry but with fair flavor and their accompanying dip needed help, gave them a 2 1/2 as I would also give the Lettuce wraps.  The restaurant environment was attractive, appeared clean with rather dim lighting.  Service was fairly good and friendly.  My bill was almost $30 without the tip. I've had better and will not return.

Came in for lunch after shopping. I would recommend the orange chicken, it's not spicy like the menu indicates. My wife enjoyed her vegetable fried rice, not greasy and came with a large portion of vegetables.   Service was excellent. Timely and responsive. Clean establishment.

Frank Lloyd Wright location always seems busy, so I guess it is a neighborhood favorite. Service is friendly and attentive. Cocktail menu is inventive.  The food though.... hmmmn.  Nothing was authentically Chinese. This place is American Chinese Food. Dishes are thickly coated in sugary orange-colored sauces, and everything tasted the same. We did not even bring our leftovers home. Gloppy, goooy disappointment.  I really wanted to like this place, as it is convenient for us. We've given it a couple of chances, in case we had just been there on an off night or ordered the wrong things for our tastes.  Rats! Our search continues for Chinese food in North Scottsdale.

This is a good Chinese place compared to other places of similar caliber.  I like almost everything here except for the scallops and mushrooms.  The scallops tasted rancid and were overlooked.  The curry is good and so is everything else.   Service was slow and not attentive.

I met up with a friend for an after work dinner outing. I was looking forward to a calorie conscious meal as I'd researched their menu online a few days before. That's not what I got.  The service was good. I was politely greeted seated quickly. While I waited for my friend and water and the menus were promptly delivered. Our table was right in front of the door and I contemplated asking for a new table but realized it was the only table for two in sight. Yes, I could have asked, but whatever. It was a table.   For dinner I asked for the teriyaki chicken skewers and a side salad with the ginger dressing on the side as I like to control the amount of dressing that I have. The salad arrived first, but dressing was NOT on the side. I looked around for our waiter but he was no where in sight. Oh dang it...I'll just eat it as is.  The dressing was pretty yummy and the salad was fresh.   Then came our meal (which were on the appetizer menu) and I knew that the chicken was not grilled but fried. Oh cr*p. I didn't ask how it was prepared. My bad. It was a pretty hefty portion with about 6 skewers. Not bad.  Then I took a bite and wow...not what I expected at all.
