The chicken was "bouncy" and not tender and juicy. It was fried (or broiled) I think and pretty oily. The teriyaki sauce was very, very salty and I knew my rings would be tight the next day. (I was right.)     On the other hand, my friend's dish looked amazing! She had the lettuce wraps and they looked super fresh.  She said it was yummy and practically ate the whole thing. Again, the portion was sizable.   As another Yelper mentioned, It was pretty loud and at times I couldn't hear what my friend was saying. The noise was distracting.   Since I was looking OUT of the restaurant toward the door, I didn't really take in the interior decor so can't comment there.    I'm not sure I'll be back. I was not wow'ed and to me Chicken Teriyaki is super simple to make. I could probably do better at home. ;)

I have been eating at Flo's when this location was across the street. Todays lunch was a big disappointment.  The salad is now very small. The $9.95 lunch special is half the size than it use to be. With rice serve on the plate that covers 70% of it.  It took forever to order and the same with paying the bill. One server seems to be handling the entire restaurant.   This will no longer be our favorite place to go.... To many other places just as good for the same  price and you can leave full.

Suffering from a serious case of inconsistency, Flo's has alternately provided some of the best and worst chinese in NoSco. Their lunch special is a steal, with fried wontons, salad with some of my favorite dressing, and a healthy portion of many of your standard offerings.  Unfortunately, the quality often lacks. Breaded chicken used in a variety of dishes including sweet and sour chicken, etc., is almost always too dry to swallow without significant liquid assistance.  Speaking of assistance, good luck getting any. Wait staff is on par with McDonalds in terms of skill and experience. Then there are the BUGS.  Only a mass-production assembly line approach to running a restaurant kitchen can result in the number of undesirable additions that can be found at Flo's.  If you are repeat customer, it's not a matter of if, but when, you will experience the same nauseating discoveries.

Mike the manager should be fired! Zero customer service and 100% lack of intelligence. I ordered a house salad, and when I picked it up i was being charged for a $15 salad that had oranges and walnuts and who knows what else..and when I mentioned it to him that it was not what I ordered, his response was "just take the stuff you don't like out" once again I said, "why am I being charged for a more expensive salad that I did NOT ORDER? I ordered a house salad!"  He once again suggested I take everything I don't like out, but that id still have to pay the price of the more expensive salad because it's what they do!   After insisting for 10min, that he had my order wrong, he went to the back and brought back another salad, and said it was the house salad, when I checked, I saw walnuts...it looked like he poked through my salad and just took crap out. I was soon frustrated that I just wanted to get out and pay.    Now paying was another ordeal! I was also picking up an order for my coworker. When I called and placed the order I had made it very clear that it was to be separate checks...well not with mike at the register!  He suggested that my coworker pay the full bill on her card, because he didn't want to split the check!  That was another 10min of dealing with this idiot!  I mean I have never had such an experience with a more basic individual...Flo's I hope you can do a better job at hiring your managers. This guy didn't even understand basic customer service...sad part is that not once did he try remedy the situation...he was just straight out lazy and disrespectful! I feel bad for the girl in training standing next to him...as a manager you have to lead by example...sad to say this was not the case!

I walked in and it was clean. The service was good. We ordered take out. Portion size was good. Food was good. I got the spicy orange chicken which was tasty, the shrimp chow mien, which was awesome and bumbling which were bomb.  I will go again next time I want some Asian fusion

Probably our regular dinner hangout whenever we crave Asian cuisine. Their Dan Dan noodles is the best! Period.  Service is good. Just would be nicer is servers weren't rushing around and if they could smile a bit. Of our 7 trips as of yet, we had a server who smiled just once.  Ambience is nice, a bit on the dark side (no pun intended) as compared to their Scottsdale Rd location.  Very kind in terms of correcting their mistakes and humble too.  Love this location. We always recommend this location.

I do love this place. And not just because one of the hottest waitresses I've ever seen in my life works there. (I still haven't mustered the courage to say much more than "Please" and "thank you" to her, for the record).   I can't think of a Chinese place that serves tastier hot and sour soup. I love the free salad with peanut sauce dressing that comes as soon as you sit down. I love the flat $7 price for almost every single entree no matter how elaborate it may be. Granted, this is yet another cafeteria-style restaurant with seating for 8 million people, which I normally detest and mark points off for. But if the food is good enough to compensate, I'm willing to overlook it.

One of my favorite spots! Fresh food with lots of flavor. Great happy hour specials, good ambiance and friendly staff. Food arrives pretty quickly and turnaround time at the bar is very fast. You won't end up waiting on your drink order, even when it's packed.

Dear Flo, your sure know how to make a girl scarf her dinner! It's all because of your delicious Chinese cuisine that I just can't help but pile on my plate! How it took me this long to visit Flo's, I will never know. However, now that I've had a bite...err plateful of food, I will frequent this restaurant over and over again.   Let me start with the atmosphere. This is North Scottsdale suburbs at its finest. You'll find a lot of families here eating, but there's also a bar with plenty of TVs that make it perfect for an Adult's Night Out as well. This is not a dive. No, this restaurant is decorated with trendy Asian decor. The staff is incredibly friendly as well. We went on a Thursday night in the middle of the summer, so I'm sure that can attest to the fact that we were able to sit down without a wait at 8:00 PM at night, but there's plenty of seating so I'm sure even a small wait doesn't last long.   Now on to the blissful food. Two words: Katsu Chicken. I could eat the entire plate myself but I did share. It's breaded chicken that's so tender, you don't need a knife to cut it. The breaded chicken is bathed in a sweet Teriyaki sauce and sits upon a heap of egg fried rice. It's delightfully delicious upon every bite. So much so that I went back to seconds (and thirds). Secondly, the Sweet and Sour chicken. It's pretty much your standard Sweet & Sour chicken but it's good, tender and worth a second helping as well! Their lettuce wraps were juicy and a great starter. We didn't get dessert, but I noticed chocolate won tons and banana spring rolls which sounded pretty sensational as well!   This is solid Asian dining and worth the visit if you're in the area (or even if you're not!)

The service was great.... love the happy hour. I recommend the chicken lettuce wraps and the fried rice... the chicken pad Thai wasn't that good to me especially since I'm used to the small noodles, but overall I would go back

Good food, although I wish they'd not used so much soy sauce.  Also, since I ordered an appetizer and a main dish, I wish they had given me a chance to finish the appetizer before bringing out the main dish. It wasn't that crowded; they didn't need to bustle me out in order to turn the table.   Good service, though.

This place is very good. For the price, you're getting good quality Chinese/Thai food. They have a good menu with lots of soups and appetizers. Only downside is food takes quite a while when they're busy, and the wait staff don't seem to watch each other's tables.

Very blah. No flavors stood out at all. Actually if you ask me the biggest flavor was salt. I kept asking for more refills of water to wash my salt down. They would fill the water up with 90 percent ice, refill again please. The kid serving me, I doubt he could even spell Chinese or for that matter find China on a map.   Poor food, poor service. Its almost like they copied Pei Wei and did an extremely poor job of copying a mediocre restaurant.  Look for this one to close down in 12 months.

My favorite Tempe locale for some taste you food. Snuck in before happy hour and they were great about getting two beer orders and some appetizers. Great service.  Eclectic patrons with happy servers. Gonna keep going here.

So Santa was very generous this past Xmas.. he left me loads of yummy eats gift cards including Flo's Asian Kitchen.. Ive been here once before and while I liked it, thought that the lacking service and typical dishes found pretty much anywhere else would stop me from coming back. Well can't disappoint Santa!  I'm not a fan of the dumbed down over sugared, over salted Americanized fluff supposed Chinese places that have been serving in our lovely urban sprawl for some time.. THAT place starts with initials. Flo's offers many different regional specialties done very well. For instance the Calamari with Chile's was just plain awesome.. simple and fresh, crusted calamari with chile's, no sauce, sugar, goop or glop.. just simple and delicious.  The chicken curry skewers we're so tender and flavorful with the additional taste of coconut milk.. oh how I heart coconut milk!   Service was good and the Tiger beers were nice and cold.. will certainly return to Flo's soon! Also to be mentioned, while this place gets busy not nearly the noise level of Thompson Peak.. actually very intimate considering the size of the dining room.   Thank you Santa.. I love you!

Flo's has a very modern ambiance so I was excited to come and try their authentic Oriental food. I was a little disappointed for a few reasons:  - They don't allow fried rice as a side dish during the lunch special (no subs) - The appetizers tasted like they were frozen and fried up instead of made from scratch - Kung Pao Chicken tasted very much like star anise (licorice basically) which is not how it's advertised  A plus- they give you an assortment of different sauces with all of the food brought out, which is awesome because I like to dip my food.  Probably won't go back, but a good place to go if you want a quick and cheap lunch with a big group.
Went for lunch after reading review.  Ordered take out - yellow curry chicken.  It was very solid.  Good amount of food and a good value.  I'd go back to try some other dishes.

I have eaten here several times now since it opened and Tempe and it just seems to keep getting better and better.  Now they have outside seating which is even better!  I have been turning all my co-workers on to Flo's and they have all like it.  The ambience is awesome!

I love this place. Great place for happy hour if you enjoy appetizers which is just about 2 pages from their menu and not to mention drink specials. The food is fresh and tasty,  service is phenomenal, and sometimes, you get to meet Flo as she checks to make sure her customers are satisfied.  I don't eat meat so I opt for their shrimp kabobs, veggie spring rolls, and potstickers.  Top it off with a $3.00 sake and I am one happy gal!

Please don't waste money here.. Very disappointed after reading the reviews. If Flo's is the best Chinese food in AZ i am the king of France. Bad food we didn't even eat it.. Simply couldn't eat the food. Another Scottsdale fail.

I've been in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area for so long, and I'm kicking myself for not visiting Flo's more often.  The food is reasonably priced and ever so tasty!  I went recently with my girlfriend and enjoyed getting two dishes that we both shared.    The service was good as our server was attentive to us.  We also didn't have a wait upon our arrival.  The food also arrived in a reasonable amount of time.  We looked through the menu, which does a great job highlighting vegetarian, gluten free, and/or spicy dishes.    We shared a garlic chicken dish, which instead of zucchini, mushrooms, and onions, we swapped the mushrooms and onions for broccoli and extra zucchini.  We then also ordered sweet and sour chicken, which is breaded chicken with pineapple, bell peppers, and onion glazed with sweet sauce.  Both dishes were great on the evening we visited as well as made great leftovers as together we only ate half the food we ordered.    I also wish to note that Flo's participates in the Elite Restaurants program (https://www.elite-restaurants.com) where we can visit so many restaurants and receive buy one, get one free discounts twice (per restaurant).  This was the first time we had used the promotion at Flo's.  After using it at several other restaurants in the program, Flo's was the first restaurant where all the servers were fully knowledgeable about the program.  I was impressed!

I've gotten advertisements in my mail for this place and was curious about trying. I don't think I will ever go again. There was hardly anyone there when we went inside at lunchtime. The manager seemed nonchalant about us when we walked in. At least he wasn't ignoring us but the overall sterile atmosphere contributed to my overall not-super feeling about the restaurant. Our waiter, although he was very nice, could have been a newbie and when asked of different dishes didn't really give too much detail that gave indication of the dish. Granted he probably didn't know enough about Asian cuisine to comment but it would help in the future. The less than mediocre appetizer of 4 potstickers (too doughy and not browned enough) for $7.50 gave us a clue to what was to come for our main dishes. In my mind I gave them the benefit of the doubt that it's hard to find good potstickers anywhere. But our main dishes were around the same identity...less than mediocre with flavors of inauthenticity that one would appreciate if they shopped at the Fry's "Asian" section. The garlic eggplant that I ordered was hardly seasoned while the other dishes that the others got were too Salty or lacked sauce where it needed (ie in the Curry) to soak up the rice.   The waiter was trying to be nice and ask us if we wanted anything from the appetizer list to rectify our doughy potstickers. We declined. Ok so I thought he was done being new and trying to help the situation but later he came way too fast to ask about the check and made us feel rushed (not good). The manager came over as well to ask about our food and while I think he sensed our disappointment he didn't inquire further which in a restaurant like this where there were hardly any people dining and servers galore, there should be time for them to come and really learn about a diner's experience. That never happened. Hmm well I'm getting tired of writing negative things so will wrap it up.   If you are interested in going to a higher end Panda Express or Pei Wei than this is your place by don't expect to get authentic and tasty food for the price you pay. I understand it's hard to get good "Asian fusion" or even figure out what Asian fusion food is but Flo's please don't call it that because of dishes like "Pad Thai" and "Vindaloo" that you have on the menu. Call it that when you have unique Asian inspired dishes and people who care about your experience.

First, the good news. Good location, plenty of parking, nice staff.  Unfortunately, the bad news. Worst Chinese food ever had. Every dish we had was worst than the prior dish. No further details needed. I honestly don't know how folks keep frequenting the place or perhaps it was a bad night there. I don't think every gave a one star rating before.  In any event, won't be going there again and forewarning to others.
it doesn't matter what i have ordered this is the best chinese food i have ever ordered. i just wished i have had this food before.

Best Chinese food in arizona :)   I recommend the lettuce wraps to start.   Our favorite entrees 9/10:  spicy cinnamon shrimp: simple amazing flavor which I've never imagined could be achieved.   9/10: vindoloom curry, which a wonderful sweet and spicy pair of Indian and Chinese flavor.   8/10: chicken Pad thia - great veggies and large noodles   Michael was a great delight, respectful and swift :)

Great food, loud ambiance. Servers have been very attentive! Very often a wait but the food is worth it. The Salt and Pepper chicken wings are awesome, as is the Beef Chow Fun and the always delicious Spicy Ginger and Onion Beef!

Had the Tom yum soup and lemon chicken..... The soup was so far from original with a huge bowl and so lemony I had to put water and ice to fix it myself...the huge bowl only had 3 shrimps but had plenty of mushrooms.  The lemon chicken  was enjoyable as well as the service from the bartender.  The place has a calm atmosphere but I will probably try another place and come back once more before I completely forget about it.

Flo's food quality and the staff are as good as ever.  We were one of Flo's original customers more than 12 years ago and loved the freshness and flavor of her menu items.  Having returned to Scottsdale after living out of state for a number of years, we had to return and have found the food quality and the staff to be a good as ever.  Flo is still there to say hello and insure the quality is as good as ever.  The menu has new items as well as the selections we had enjoyed for years. This is a must in Scottsdale and is much better than other well know national Chinese food chains.

I really like Flo's. I always try to hit the one in North Scottsdale when I'm in the area so I was ecstatic that they opened a location in Tempe.   The whole family went tonight. The restaurant is spacious and beautifully appointed and the food was very good, as always. But the service was appalling.  My husband and I took separate cars so I arrived before him with two of our children. When we walked in, we were told they didn't have a table. Just like that, "We don't have a table right now". No offer to put me on the waiting list, nothing. I had to prompt the guy as to what happened next. He said to take a seat, they were cleaning a table. Then, a girl followed up and told me it would be 10 minutes because they were clearing a table.   We got seated in fairly short order though, so that was OK. Our server took awhile to come over. Now, understandably, my husband and other daughter weren't there yet, so I didn't get too fussed. He took our drink orders and said he'd stop back to get our order when our party arrived. My husband and daughter got there and sat down.  The waiter walked by us about 5 times and didn't even acknowledge that he saw the rest of our party. He then came over, plunked my drink on the table and walked away again, without asking my husband and daughter if they wanted a drink. Then he proceeded to walk past us about 5 more times.  He finally came over to take our order. He didn't listen to my husband and put in the wrong order.  Our food came out very quickly but we had to send my husband's back.   So, the short version is, food was good, service was bad. I'm sure I'll be back but this was disappointing.

Seriously the best Asian food I've ever had (granted, I've never been to Asia so I leave off one star for that, but still, it's amazing). This is the location to go to, the others aren't as good in my opinion. I have friends that come into town just to eat here. It's really worth the visit.

Have you heard the NPR episode where the seafood industry has a problem mislabeling the species of seafood sold and served? The story goes on to discuss an urban myth that pig bungholes are repurposed and sold as calamari strips. I want to tell you; it's not an urban myth. I had them yesterday at Flo's new restaurant in Tempe. Flo's calamari appetizer was as chewy, inelastic, and muscular as you might imagine a pig's bunghole to be. Even my dog, who likes a nice chewy rawhide occasionally, only ate one and left the remainder in her bowl. I avoided the garbage disposal for fear the motor would burn up trying to macerate the tough over-processed protein.  The entr√©e we shared was the chicken fried rice. It was nothing special. We also shared a 16 oz. bottle of Tsing Tao Beer, my favorite, but we wondered when we paid the $33.00 tab if we'll ever be back. And it's a shame, Flo's location is very convenient to where we live.  I have to add, our server Bethany, was charming and attentive to our requests. For Bethany, we give the extra star otherwise Flo's only deserves one star.

Good place for take out! My work orders food from here sometimes and it's always good. Yesterday was my first time ordering it on my own before! My sister got lo mein noodles and I got Thai yellow curry. We both liked our food! My curry was a bit bland and I think I'll get the tofu steamed the next time, but overall good stuff! My sisters food was a little pricey but the portions were huge so no complaints, I'll definitely order from here again.

The food taste like Pei Wei but Flo's doesn't make you stand in line to order which I appreciate.  My girlfriend and I came here for lunch and it was packed but the service was lightning fast.  I must say I was pretty impressed with how efficiently the staff works together to serve the customers and quickly turn over tables.  I had chicken curry and the sauce was delicious, the chicken was tender and the veggies were crisp.  I'll be back for sure!

This is a pretty unique concept. Their food selection seems authentic which I like. They have Thai food, Vietnamese well pho, and Chinese. I like their food selections. We came here for happy which is from 3-7pm. Very affordable and huge portions! The place is clean and spacious! This place is good for family dinners as well!!!
Love flos food is always good. Had to stop going due to gluten allergy but was recently informed that they offer gluten free options so may have to start coming back to try them

This is one of my favorite Asian restaurants. I like that it has a slick modern look with an open dining area. Mostly I love the crab puffs, which are some of the best I've ever eaten. I have never ordered anything that I haven't enjoyed. The wait staff is always friendly and helpful. We'll be back.
The best Asian food I have ever had! I will never go to PF Chang's again!!! Wonder atmosphere and the food was divine!!!!

Uneven experience at Flo's tonight for our party of five (including two children). Potstickers and veggie spring rolls were terrific and the kids' meals came out promptly. On the downside, the egg flower soup with shrimp lacked flavor. A dash of low sodium soy sauce could not revive the concoction. The main courses, chicken pad Thai and spicy ginger beef were excellent. However, there was a bizarre service issue where the servers could not be bothered to clear the plates as the main courses arrived. Picture dishes from two appetizers, one soup for four ... And trying to fit on another two major entrees without clearing all those empties. I never experienced this type of plate-clearing confusion. Comically, they sent ONE solitary server to clear all of these plates. To sum it up, great food, poor soup, bizarre service.
Amazing place. Happy hour is so flipping cheap for such great drinks/service/food. An absolute must!

Had a nice dinner here last night. I hate to say I can't remember the servers name but he was very efficient. He could teach a class on how to be a good server without overdoing it :-).   Food was good, lot's of flavor. I had the ginger beef... could have been a bit spicier, but that's a personal matter easily resolved with some chili paste.

Sadly, a new menu was implemented recently. Prices have increased by about a third across the board. Many of our favorite appetizer/happy hour items have been omitted. The food is still good, but the casual environment does not justify the new high prices. It is no longer my favorite Chinese restaurant.

Be careful when you order take out. We ordered takeout on Monday Sept. 1 .  I was told we should be at the restaurant at 5:40PM to pick up my order. I waited 25 minutes.  The order was not ready till 6:05PM.   No comment was made from the staff anD no complimentary desert or anything was offered. I think this is BUSINESS AS USUAL FOR FLO'S.
This by far is our favorite Chinese restaurant in the valley.  Always good food and service along with reasonable pricing.  Both locations are excellent.

I probably order food for pickup here once a month. It's consistently good.  The sweet and sour chicken and the pepper bacon shrimp are my favorites.  It's nice to see the owner here all the time keeping an eye on things.

We used to love this place but today's visit proves that things change and not always for the best.  In their infinite wisdom they have Changed their menu and removed some of our favorite things, most notably is the calamari appetizer we always ordered.  They also decided to remove all descriptions from the menu so happy guessing. (The printer must charge by the letter). Also, they serve the same dish multiple ways, one way for dinner and another way for lunch.  I ordered the yellow curry chicken lunch. It was served dry, when I asked for the sauce I was told that they serve the dinner size in a bowl with the sauce, not the lunch.  So my curry is altered for what purpose?   I think I'm done with flo's after this sad visit.

Went to Flos in tempe for lunch Saturday.  I have gone there at least 6 or 7 times on Saturdays for their lunch which has been very reasonable and the food decent in the past.  This past Saturday the restaurant was busy and the food terrible.  My wife's chicken curry had very old dried out pieces of chicken and her rice was dried out, terrible.  I ordered a shrimp pad thai and it was really bad,  nothing like real pad thai, pretty much egg noodles (large and flat) with a couple of shrimp, bad flavor and again, dried out and old rice.  They add some fried won tons which are really just a waste.  I guess I won't return.

This is the best of all Flo's restaurants.    It is probably one of our favorite places to eat in Scottsdale.    It isn't unusual to see Flo walking around the restaurant checking on the customers.   The menu is very reasonably priced and they have great lunch specials!   If you sign up for their email promotions, they have great deals on gift cards - 20% off and sometimes even 50% off.     If you haven't been here, definitely try it and it is well worth the wait if there is one.

I was just here for lunch today and I got the spicy beef with ginger. Very good but I asked for it to be extra spicy as their version of spicy and my very of spicy is very different. Sigh... Oh well, I at least have leftovers and can add a few extra spices to get it as spicy as I like.

The girls and I decided to stop by for lunch. I read reviews and determined it was promising. Till This day my girlfriend still gives me crap for picking this place. Food was mediocre, service was slow and my friends dish looked like someone threw it up into her plate. If your looking to try to new places and don't really mind the quality of you're experience I would say try this place.

Gave this place two tries. The service staff is friendly, but the food is not good at all. Hot and sour and wonton soups are bland at best. I tried shrimp and pine nuts and Mongolian beef, and I would not recommend either. A friend ordered teriyaki chicken which looked great but did not taste good. My guess is that the cooks are not tasting the food before serving to check quality. A disappointing experience for a restaurant I had high hopes for.

Yes it is noisy,but the food is great. Much much better than the corner chinese!  Hands on management insures great service. The chef knows his way around his kitchen for sure. Well worth the $$$ and delicious!

Food was priced right.  It was real loud inside and hard to hear from across the table. Waiter was nice and helpful. My only other comment would be that they wait by your table to take your dish whether you were done eating or not. That irritated me tremendously.

Enjoyed Flos for the first time Friday night. Ordered the wonton soup & the chicken wings. We LOVED the wings, so delicious and worth the wait. I also ordered the chicken vindaloo but had it with beef instead, it was a bit too sweet to my liking and not enough spicy. So I took it home and made it a bit more spicy. Overall everything was good.

I was so excited when I found out there is a Flo's in Tempe.  I was a frequent visitor of the Scottsdale locations throughout high school.   Half off drinks and appetizer's for happy hour, you can't get better than that!  Their crab puffs are still some of the best around.

Delicious food and great service! Our waters stayed filled and the happy hour deals are amazing! This is a place gives quality everything and they are not over priced. The manager is so sweet and our server was extremely patient with my million questions. This was my first time at Flo's and it we not be my last! #WeAreNotSorryWeOrderedTheCalamari

Out of all of the Flo's locations, this is the one I've frequented the most over the past 3 years of living in the Valley.  I've seen the menu change here and there, but I have to say, I've never had a bad meal at Flo's.  I met my friend Melanie H for dinner this evening and we really enjoyed our meal... we had great service - our waters stayed filled throughout the time we were there, and our food was served promptly. Our server checked on us several times as well.  We started with vegetable pot stickers and requested that they come steamed.  They were delicious! Next, we shared 'Indian Curry Vegetables' (I ordered it with shrimp) and Indian Vindaloo Chicken.  Both were extremely tasty - fresh veggies, chicken, and shrimp in really flavorful sauces with just the right amount of spice.  The curry vegetable dish came with broccoli, mushrooms, carrots, snow peas, and long beans.  The chicken dish had tomatoes and onions. We also had steamed white rice.  Note to Flo: We were both disappointed that you took the Vietnamese Spring Rolls off of the menu and I miss the days of the green curry dish with calamari. One more thing - the chicken corn soup that you serve at the DC Ranch location should be offered at the others as well - I love that soup!  Fortune cookies came along with the check and we both were happy with our fortunes.  The bill didn't break the bank either.  See you again soon, Flo!

Okay, so I would still give you 5 stars based on the things that I have personally ordered, but today I took a bite of my better half's Dan Dan Noodles and wasn't terribly impressed. I ordered the Black Pepper Chicken and it was perfection...again. (easily one of my favorites there), but the Dan Dan Noodles were really blah. My suggestion...either make it as awesome as your other dishes, or take it off the menu, life is too short for you to have something sub-par on your impressive menu and it makes me sad that this was his first impression of your restaurant. *sniffle* *sigh* so I'm taking one star away.

Had a really great meal here tonight and a fabulous server that let me customize it.  I ordered the veggie stir fry and asked that no sugar be added to the sauce.  In addition, in lieu of rice, they steamed cabbage for me  My family thinks I am high maintenance but I really appreciate the restaurant working with me!    Several members of our party had sweet and sour chicken and that was delish as well!

Nothing special. Loud atmosphere, staff lacks experience in proper service. If your desperate to eat and are ok with average food, poor atmosphere and a staff that lacks experience then your good to go.

If you are looking for "authentic" Asian food, look somewhere else, however Flo's provide tasty "fusion" type of cuisine served in a friendly, attentive environment.  My mother and I did have to ask for more spice to our food since it tended to be more of this slightly spicy/sweet combo taste.  My mother sent her order back after they offered to make her a more spicy dish, which they offered graciously.  My rating is based upon customer service, taste (which again is not authentic, but fusion), and the attentive/friendly staff.  Also the decor was tasteful.
Front cashier did make make a good first impression. Server "Katie" was a gem. Energetic, knowledgable, patient and friendly. Food was pretty good.
Excellent place for Saturday/Sunday brunch!! The ambience is nice and the food here is great!!

I eat here for lunch or dinner at least once a week. Lunch specials and happy hour are killer and the food is always on point. The bartenders (Dave and Kierstin to be specific) are top notch and highly attentive.   You can tell this is a locals spot because the staff remembers who you are and are always welcoming. If you on the fringe of wanting to try this staple, just do it. It's well worth it!

Flo's is our new happy hour spot!  We stopped by on Friday night around 6p for dinner. To our surprise, their happy hour runs from 3-7p. Also to our surprise, it's a pretty amazing deal - 1/2 off all alcohol & apps!  We ordered lettuce cups, wontons, spring rolls & a couple beers. The food was delicious & they were all large portions.  Our total for 2 beers + 4 apps = $17.   Flo made her presence known which I also found refreshing. Everyone was friendly & the food was top notch; you go girl!

Came here a few weeks ago for lunch with my daughter's family, my daughter, her husband and 2 teen-aged daughter's. Everyone loved their food and service was excellent. Decided to come back today on Mother's Day for dinner with same group plus my husband this time. Everyone was very pleased with their meals once again! Service great as well. They will serve both white and brown rice for the asking. All of us had leftovers from our plates to take home. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone even if you have a fussy eater. One of my granddaughters had sweet-sour chicken...she was very pleased. The other one had egg/foo Yung and was pleased also. We'll definitely be back again!
Great food!  Quick service!  Probably my fav Asian place! HH is great as well.  Nice and clean as well!

I like many types of Asian food and I noticed Flo's while grabbing a burger next door at The Habit a few weeks previous.  I was greeted as soon as I walked in and given a choice of a table or the bar.  Being just a few minutes after opening the place was empty.  I chose a high top in the bar area.  Was given a menu and my drink order was taken right away.  I must not eat out in bar areas often, that was the first time I had seen iced tea dispensed from a bar gun.  When my drink came my salad came with it and the waitress took my order. The food came out in a reasonable time.  My waitress checked on me several times. The food was good.  I will definitely be back.  Other than the decor the place reminded me of the now shuttered Zang Asian Bistro in Glendale that I went to often.  Right down to the dressing on the salad.  Flo's also has many more items on the menu.  I also like that they have lunch pricing, and I assume portions, on most of their menu items.

We stopped in for a quick bite on Saturday after shopping-this place is conveniently located at the Pavillions Shopping Center on Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd. I hate to compare Scottsdale Chinese food to my native San Francisco, but I just can't help myself. The pork potstickers were only okay-pretty greasy when they came out from the kitchen. The combination fried rice was overcooked and didn't taste freshly made at all. The single dish we ordered-Chicken with green beans was freshly made but the disappointing other dishes but a damper on the over all meal. Still looking for good Chinese in Scottsdale!

Flo's has been on our restaurant list for too long...because we finally ate there tonight after reading lots of Yelp reviews. Service: attentive & well paced. Cocktails & Beer good. Menu: very large & varied...from Indian to Thai to Chinese to....made our choices very difficult. Started with the Crispy Fried Shrimp Wontons - nice sauces, good fry but too much shrimp & needed seasoning....but that doesn't mean we didn't eat all of them. Entrees: Beef Lemongrass & Rice Noodle and Lemon Pepper Chicken - good flavors but again would have been much better with fundamental seasoning (salt). It's a 'keeper.'

First, the modern concept and set up is cool!  Makes you feel welcome and a clean feel to it too.  I found my friends there were 1 hour before me and happy already from happy hour.  LOL!  OH, they have a great HH menu for drinks and food.  The service was OK.  We needed to keep flagging down our server for refills, additional orders, etc.  Since I was only stopping for the ornament exchange, I ordered the Singapore Chicken Satay and Chicken Pot Stickers.   I got my satay and never got my chicken pot stickers.  Had to grab the servers attention to make sure the chicken pot stickers were removed from my check.  TOO bad the chicken satay was very good, and I left hungry!

We had lunch at Flo's in Scottsdale today for the first time. What a wonderful experience. From our greeting, to our waitress, to the salad, entree, and very fresh fortune cookie-it was all first class. No issues of any type to report. The house made salad dressing is to die for as was the pork and eggplant dish that we shared. If you are anywhere near this restaurant, you really need to give it a try. With half price apps and half price drinks, happy hour seems to be wonderful too. If you like Asian food, this is the place!
Ask for Corey behind the bar and get some great food and happy hour 3-7 all day everyday. Classy new spot but still have PBR on draft.

I have tried this place about 6-8 times since moving here in 2002 because others rave about it, and I keep thinking it will be different but every time I seem to get something bland. Ordered some sort of peanut-spicy chicken thing and it was basically flavorless and the onions were raw. Are they in a hurry or something? "Chicken" tasted thin and rubbery. Place was SUPER noisy - do NOT go on a date there! Ling and Loiue's on Shea and 96th blows this place out of the water in every category.

I've tried several of their dishes at this Flo's location and they've been all good.  What keeps me coming back again and again is their hot and sour soup~ made fresh, full of flavor with large pieces of white chicken meat and large shrimps.  Usually, when I am feeling under the weather, like today, I stop by Flo's for a quick "pick me up" of their aromatic and delicious hot and sour soup and after consuming the large bowl, big enough for four people, I felt better and left a happy customer~ along with a to go order of wonton soup to nurse my coughing throat for later on in the day.

Tip: Come on Saturday to get the cheaper lunch specials! The meals listed are actually $7.95, but only on Saturday day time - not in evenings and not on Sundays. That is at least what our waiter told us.   Parking: This is a busy strip mall area, like the entire valley, but parking is easy to find.   Service: Quick and thorough. The service staff are on top of it and are usually quite quick to take orders.   Food: I have been here twice. The mixed vegetables are crisp and cooked just right. They could use a bit of spice. During the lunch special, they provided little salads with a tasty ginger dressing. It was a nice light crisp dish with all the creamy / hot foods. The potstickers were good as well.

First timer..found via the Urban Spoon App. Service was excellent, Im going to say that right off the bat. The rush had come and gone and by the time we sat down it was 5 til 7pm. We didnt even know about the HH that was about to expire but our server let us know we had 5 minutes left and told us the HH deals ..which was a nice surprise since she could have said nothing and we would have been none the wiser. My date and I were chatting up a storm and the server was great she just kept checking on us but wasnt hovering or rushing us to place our order.   We started with the pan fried pot stickers and they were excellent, no complaints. I ordered the spicy cinnamon shrimp.. just because it seemed so unique and it was great. The texture was great, not soggy. I just couldnt really tell if it was spicy because I was 2 cherry vodka/diet cokes in.. but the cinnamon was apparent..you could taste it on the inhale.. when you take a bite, but no cinnamon taste left behind. It was like a magic trick in your mouth.. lol  I would definitely go back to try other dishes not even a question that needs an answer.

Flo's is good! Gourmet? Well, okay...I agree that it is predictable, but I enjoyed what I had (NO LIES!). Their brunch/lunch specials are sort of affordable. At least, the dishes are cheaper, eh? The Dan Dan noodles, crab rangoons (although I think they call them puffs here), and we got a spicy beef plate...I forgot the name. NERDS! It's not really authentic by any means, but it still filled me up and was tasty.   There are these crispy won ton chips that they bring out, too. And a small salad.   I know probably none of this is actually good for you -- health-wise, even the salad drenched in that orange dressing (which I personally really dug). Maybe it's just that I was really hungry when I went? Isn't that why you're supposed to go out to eat? To NOT be hungry at the end of it?   Mmhmmm. Flo's. Comfort American-Chinese food. For me.

Let me start out by saying their food was decent. I had the sweet and sour chicken and I thought it was pretty good but nothing special.   The reason for the 2 star review is their customer service. The other day I came into Flo's with 3 of my co-workers. We were greeted by a very kind hostess and immediately seated. We sat down and waited all of 30 seconds before our waiter came over and took our drink orders. He must have run to the kitchen and back because next thing we know, we all have drinks and he's taking our meal orders.  I bet you are wondering where the problem is....just wait, this is where it gets good. From that point on the waiter never came back to our table. Someone else delivered the food, we had to flag down a different waiter when the entire table was waiting for a refill. Worst of all, I had to chase down our waiter to get our check so that we wouldn't be late getting back to work. I literally had to race after him (in heels might I add) and I followed him all the way to the kitchen and then grabbed him as soon as he exited.  I've never been in a situation where I had to ask someone to bring us the check. Usually that's when the waiter is most on top of things.   Food: 7/10 Service: 2/10  Will I come back? I think I'll give them another chance, but this better not be consistent behavior.
The food isn't bad but it doesn't warrant dealing with the dining room noise or the lack of parking.  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zkJvxLssz5E
Take out service is excellent.  We have been long time customers of Flo's and will continue to buy from them.

Sorry Flo, but I won't be coming back to this location..  The food was totally uninspired & bland as can be.  It's amazing that  even though it's the same restaurant, the Flo's on Thompson Peak is SO much better!  This is what we had:  1) wonton soup:  watered down tasteless broth, HUGE slivers of pork which was kinda gross and wontons that were 99%skin and 1% meat  2) hot & sour soup:  it was just OKay  3) mapo tofu:   salty, starchy, &  sauce had NO flavor 4) pepper beef:  tasteless and again salty.  It tasted like soy sauce and not much of anything else.  The 2 stars are for the service and the miso salad dressing.  it was good but the herbal vinegarette at TP location is SO much better!!

You really can't go wrong with any of Flo's entrees and thus everything I've tasted was good, just not great.  I am grateful that it's nearby because it 'hits the spot' when my chinese food craving kicks in and you can find me there at least a couple times a week.  My food is usually carry-out, but I have to comment on the superior service everytime I've eaten there.  The servers are soooo attentive:  1) always checking to see if everything's okay 2) clearing empty plates 3) refilling beverages, etc...  I'll admit I'm obsessed with the herbal vinegarette salad dressing.  I think it's the 'perfect' dressing to any salad and my only gripe is I wish it was sold it bottles.  I would buy it.  The fried wings appetizer is also tasty and they're perfectly fried and presented on a bed of chopped lettuce, onions, and jalapenos.  It's salty, spicy, crunchy, and there's alot of flavors going on.  $8 is pricey for 8 pieces, but it's worth going during HH when it's 1/2 off.  Oh yeah, the sweet/sour soup is really good too.  $5 for a huge container is a great deal!  3 stars for the food +1 for the service!

This place was pretty busy the night we went, which usually bodes well. The open space is nice when you don't like to be on top of the table that's next to you. I like that you can get food from all Asian cultures, but it's not the best in town. The price was fair. The service was fair. The taste was fair. I feel like there are many better choices in town. Not sure I would return.

Happy Hour everyday is awesome (half off most apps and drinks!). Entrees are ok, last few orders vegetable to meat ratio was a little high (I like more meat!). Can get expensive if eating outside of happy hour hours.

Went here based on a personal recommendation.  Service was really good.  Note that the menu and prices on Yelp are not correct with the actual prices.  Ordered the Pot Stickers - Chicken/Pork/Vegetables $7.50.   It comes with 4 of them....arg.  Rather expensive little things.  Nothing remarkable about them.  For my main entry I ordered: Crispy & Spicy Chicken $12.95 (9.95) Breaded, butterflied chicken breasts smothered in a Sichuan red chile garlic sauce.  The chicken looked like Katsu that was sliced.  Also came with what I thought was a bowl of soup.  But now that I am reading this, I am guessing it was the Red Chile Garlic Sauce that I was supposed to smother it in?    It really wasn't that Crispy or Spicy.  The salad dressing on the salad was really good.  He said it was a house made and had Miso in it.
I get takeout from here all the time. I only get the sweet n sour chicken! I could use more pineapple!! It's the best part! Great food! Seems like all white meat chicken. Very flavorful!!

I love Flos Tempe location.  I don't love every single dish on the menu, but, there are enough dishes on the menu that I crave, that I go to Flos two or three times a week.  I love the moo goo gai pan, the orange chicken, the honey beef, the mongolian beef and few other of the main dishes.  The lettuce wraps, salt & pepper chicken wings, and spring rolls are great appetizers.  Flos will gladly alter any dish to your liking, like adding mixed vegetables, or putting a different sauce on your dish. At lunch, they serve a complementary salad with fancy greens and a tasty dressing.  This location has a wonderful group of servers, that not only provide excellent food service, but are some of the most friendly and happy servers that I have encountered in the valley.  I am so happy Flos moved into my neighborhood.  Is it perfect...no...no restaurant in the Phoenix metro area is, but I am a pretty fussy eater, and the food and service here keeps me coming back, again and again.

Value. When you factor in cost and quality this is 5 star all the way. Hot and sour soup lives up to the hype of previous yelpers. We tried a variety of appetizers, the aforementioned soup and the twice cooked pork (it has bacon that's enough said).

I went to Flo's restaurant on a recommendation from a co-worker and I was pleasantly surprised. I had the broccoli beef and it was amazing--such wonderful flavor with the sauce, thinly sliced beef and various vegetables--on my way home I started eating some and I could not stop. I really wanted to turn around, go back, and get another order (smile). Next time that I go I will have to sit in versus getting take out as it looks like a very nice and relaxing atmosphere. The staff that I did interact with were very friendly and open to changing the soy based sauce that usually comes with the broccoli beef to a white sauce (I am allergic to soy)  I hope that in the near future that Flo will open up another restaurant--hopefully in Old town Scottsdale or central Phoenix, so those of us who live in Mesa, Tempe, and south of North Scottsdale can have quicker access to Flo's amazing food!

This place was recommended to me by a good friend who said this was the best place to go too for Asian/Chinese food. The atmosphere is nice. I like the way it is decorated but I will say that for the prices, I wish the seating was a tad more intimate. It had more of a fast food seating arrangement. It is very clean and nice though. For appetizers, we ordered the crab puffs and the salt & pepper wings. Fyi, the wings take a minimum of 20 mins, our main entree came out first. For our main dish, we ordered the crispy honey beef. This was by far AAAAHMAZING. Awesome flavor. Also got an order of bbq pork fried rice. The rice was just okay. The pork needed more flavor. We also ordered a drink and beer. Before tip, our total was about $69.  For what we ordered, I don't think it was worth that price but it won't keep us from eating there again. Also, it would have been nice to have our food boxed up instead of ourselves having to do it....I would recommend this to others.

Of all of the Flo's restaurants in the Valley, the McDowell Mountain Village location is my favorite. It's located on the northeast corner in the same plaza as AJ's, so parking can be a bit trying during peak eating times.  I've never been disappointed with the food at Flo's. It's easily the best affordable Chinese food here and even rivals some of the best places in the Bay area. My personal favorite is the lemon pepper chicken, which is delicately tart. The kung pao is also pretty fantastic. No matter where you go on the menu, it's hard to go wrong here.  One of the best things about Flo's is that you can substitute tofu into any of the menu items, or ratchet up the spiciness with no fuss by the staff. It's refreshing that they're so accommodating.  Prices are normally pretty reasonable, especially given what you're getting. Dinner is in the $10-15 range for the most part. However, on Saturdays, Flo's runs a crazy lunch special from noon to three: $5 lunch! For five little Washingtons, you get a nommy house salad (with a tart herb dressing), crackalicious won tons and your choice of entree with rice. Even at lunch portions, it's still a good amount of food. I typically take half home with me. The rest of the week, most of the lunch menu is $7, which is still a steal. Happy hour (half priced drinks and appetizers) is on weekday afternoons from three to seven.  There is typically a short wait for lunch at Flo's, but service is quick and efficient. The restaurant is always clean, and although it can get noisy at lunchtime, I have never found it difficult to carry on a conversation here.
Delicious food! I've tried many Asian style restaurants and this is by far one of the best. Service was outstanding and food was phenomenal. I will definitely be back.
Vegetable potstickers and Veggies and Tofu are amazing for a vegetarian!! Really good lunch specials and HH. Just wish there was one located in Central Phoenix!

I usually get the yellow curry chicken through DoorDash, and I love it the only thing I hate about the delivery is that it comes in a  plastic bowl and the food is super hot, I hate using plastic since it's unhealthy I wish you guys use paper bowls like Most restaurants use for soup instead, thank you.
This is one of my family's favorite places to go for Chinese! The food is fresh and delicious! There are also a few veggie options which is great for me! The flavored are good and the staff is great!

One of our favorite place to have Asian food. We are always content with Singapore noodles. We have had plenty of their dishes and always delish. One thing I may change is their fried rice. Recently we have seen and tasted that it's a bit different. It lacks the brownness of it  which is probably the soy sauce and egg. Other than that it's delicious.

Headed here for lunch with a co-worker the other day, and I must say we were pleasantly surprised by the sleek and modern interior of this place! We were greeted as soon as we walked in and seated by the window.  Their lunch menu and dinner menu are one and the same, however, they offer smaller versions of their dinner options with a lunch price in ()s next to the regular dinner price. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken with white rice. The sweet and sour sauce was exactly what I was looking for flavor wise (sometimes you can get a sauce that's too runny and just doesn't coat the meal...not the case here!). The chicken was cooked perfectly.   The waitress was quick to refill an empty class and to check on us regularly. She was obliging to separate our checks for us and had us checked out and on our way pretty quickly for a lunch hour.  Overall: A We will definitely be back for a lunch!

Good flavors, fast service.  Love their green curry.  Great happy hour where appetizers are 1/2 off the reg price.  The downside is that most of the appetizers are deep fried.  I like lunch better than dinner as they offer a nice salad with the meal.

I give it 3/5 because the food is ok.  It's not bad but at the same time it's not good.  To be honest I'd probably rather just go to Panda Express.  It's cheaper and has the same averagish take on the cuisine.
Good food!  Good service!   Great choices!  What else could you want.   Flo's GOT it.  Wonderful addition to the great city of Tempe.   Try it.

I have passed Flo's a bunch of times while driving and always wondered if it was any good. So I finally decided to do some Yelp investigating and based on the reviews and how close it is to our house, we decided to try it. We ordered for take-out on a Sunday night. The girl who took our order over the phone was very friendly, and the food was ready quickly, in about 20 minutes. We ordered the Summer Rolls, which were fresh and delicious, the Kung Pao Chicken which came with fresh vegetables in a very tasty and just the right amount of spicy sauce, as well as the Orange Chicken. The orange chicken comes fried (wish I had read the menu more carefully) and the sauce for the orange chicken comes on the side, so you can use as much or as little as you'd like. Overall everything was really delicious, and didn't feel heavy. I'm sure we will be visiting Flo's again for some more yummy take-out!

I have gotten take out 2 times since they opened. My boyfriend and I have shared the shrimp pad thai, orange chicken, sweet and sour soup, crab wontons and kung pao chicken. Everything was great! I loved the pad thai the most. We live a mile or so away so it's close and easy to get to. Friendly staff. I didn't give it 5 only because I haven't received actual "service" in the restaurant... yet.
Had a nice lunch here. I got the fried rice with brown rice, was delicious! The place is spacious and modern.

Flo's "Asian" Kitchen...?  Where is the Asian food?  The food had no flavor whatsoever!  It makes the ultra gross chain restaurant PF Changs seem like Asian food in my opinion.  Not to mention this "Asian" restaurant is extremely overpriced!  I know this is Scottsdale, but come on.  Makes me miss California more and more...
Love this place! Super flavorful and reasonable. We normally do take out. A must try...
Nice happy hour! I love the fried chicken wings with minced garlic and jalapeno peppers. Green Chicken Curry is also very yummy!
I've had better........from the frozen aisle at frys
Best sizzling rice soup and crab puffs anywhere! Love this place.

I know everyone and their grandmother has already reviewed this place, so I will be quick.  I love this place.  Yes it is more "western" chinese.  But it is light years better than PF changs, or other chain type places.  Every time we have been going we get something different from the menu and have yet to have anything less than a fantastic meal.  It is also very affordable. Plenty of things on the menu for under $10 per plate.  Me likey...

I have been wanting to try Flo's for a while now. Today I finally got my chance, but it was so disappointing! I ordered the Panko Chicken Salad and the greens look like a bagged salad from the grocery store (supposed to be mixed greens, but more like iceberg with 3 pieces of baby romaine). It had shredded carrots and NO walnuts (menu description says walnuts). The chicken is just OK. Honestly, this is a McDonald's quality salad for $9.50. I also ordered the edamame appetizer and the pods are slick with oil. Yuck! I am extremely disappointed, will not be returning to Flo's. Bummer, since the menu sounds so good- but obviously is not.
I've been wanting to try this location for some time and it did not disappoint!  Very fresh & good. We have Mogolian beef & peanut chicken in a mild spicy sauce. Good...
The food was awsome, you gotta try the soup!  I only wish there were more items on the menu.  It would also be nice to have a location closer to me.  PV Mall area.....

This restaurant is getting one star for taking items off the menu i personally liked most. Very disappointing because now, many of the items can be ordered at a fast food chinese restaurant at half the cost. The thai style calamari with chilies was delicious and so was the beef with cashew. But you will not know because these items are no longer served.

As a gluten free vegetarian, it is quit a job finding meals as my family and I dine out. Here at Flos I had the pad Thai with a few adjustments, making it fully veggie approved. It was and by far has been the best, most tasteful and fresh Pad Thai I've ever had. The triple chocolate moose was freshly made and truly worth the calories. Definitely a five star value! Not to mention with four people in my party making dining, 11 entrees and four alcoholic beverages our bill was only $86!!!

Fantastic service from Stephanie! She really knows how to make her guests feel welcome. We've also had super service from Jenny on previous visits, be sure to ask for one of those girls! We had the wonton soup and a huge spread of the happy hour appetizers, everything was perfect and larger portions than we're used to for happy hour specials, great job and thanks again Steph!

Flo's used to be better.     Our meals yesterday were good, but not remarkable.  (Kung Pao Chicken and Thai Style Green Curry Chicken.)   The salad dressing is too sweet and the server was haphazard when applying it (My husband's was underdressed and when we asked if he could have some more she squirted a bunch more on both our salads....and mine was already overdressed.)    I ate there a month ago and once again, just sort of average.  With the exception of the soup (Spicy Thai Coconut), which was very good, the rest of the meal was relatively bland.  And the lunch portions are way too pricey for the small size you get.  Re service, we sat at the bar.   It wasn't busy, but trying to get our bartender's eye contact to order, to ask for chopsticks, to ask for something to give our meal some flavor....good luck.   She really exhibited no interest in our dining experience at all.  And speaking of the bar, for a tiny glass of average Sauvingnon Blanc it was $10...and in one of those cheap, small catering type glasses.  The wine selection is tiny and overpriced.  And if you still decide to go, parking is not easy to find for the entire shopping center.  This place is in between a 2 and a 3.  I wish I could still recommend it, but I can't.

This place is a family favorite. I personally love the vegetarian tofu wrap. I love this restaurant because they never mess up your order and you can get everything customized, also their is free unlimited rice unlike many other restaurants.

Hands Down the BEST Happy Hour in Town!!! Our favorites are the wings and crab puffs. My son loves the honey chicken and we always share a bowl of the sizzling rice soup! The staff is super attentive and you can tell they run a tight ship. You can always find Flo walking around talking to guests. It's super clean too which I personally appreciate because I work in this business!! This place will NOT disappoint it's the best asian cuisine around!!

The best Chinese food in town. The salt and pepper chicken wings, eggplant, sizzling rice soup, chow fun and especially the lettuce wraps are all amazing!  If you want authentic Chinese food with friendly service this is the place!

We have been going to Flos for many years and have always loved it but the last few times its been really off. One fav was always the Thai Coconut Soup until the last couple of visits, it's now completely lacking that amazing flavor we expected. We asked at both these visits if they had changed the recipe or something 'No' was the answer & the manager had no idea what was different and really was not concerned. Also the dishes keep getting smaller & pricier, I love veggies but as an example when it's called a chicken dish shouldn't it be about the chicken? Also we liked it when we would go for lunch it was served on platters like the dinner menu, now you get a small lunch plate with a single serving and half the plate is filled with a large ball of formed rice & the small plate of dry lettuce just doesn't cut it either. I am so disappointed to say we won't be returning any time soon-when twice bitten, twice shy.

After an awesome trip to Taliesen West, my two friends and I found Flo's. The decor is a little strange, with some "cultural" posters, such as a series of pictures of women standing next to a plane during wartime, interspersed with poorly designed posters such as one of the word "stir-fry" superimposed onto a picture of raw broccoli.  The menu is your typical pan-Asian menu, so I had low hopes, but the food turned out really great! I got the Thai Basil Chicken, which came with lots of vegetables (which I like) and a scrumptious side salad. I also thought the wonton chips that came with each lunch order were delightfully quirky and delicious. All in all, it was a fun experience, made even better by the great company I had.

It's honestly quite difficult to ever find a nice Chinese restaurant. Usually, it's a fast food or quick service kind of place - I'm so glad this isn't another one of those!  Flos is actually a very nice, clean restaurant with delicious food. The times I have gone, it has always been fairly busy but never loud. Everything on their menu is amazing! Their Mongolian beef is delicious!!
Delicious.  The remodel has helped with the noise level.  High quality food in a nice atmosphere

After recommendations from several family members, my husband and I decided to try Flo's while vacationing in AZ. They have an awesome happy hour from 3-7 daily. I would suggest trying the lettuce wraps and crab puffs.. so good!

They have excellent food, but the portions are average to small and the pricing is expensive for this type of cuisine. I'm not sure I would go again compared to other options I have for chinese food. The staff was average as well. I'd like to see better staff and bigger portions in the future if I were to go again.

This restaurant has a great thing going for it -- everything is cooked to order. I love their Tom Yum soup. Not very authentic, but it's flavorful with a slight spiciness. I'm not a fan of seafood, so they make it for me with chicken instead of shrimp.  Their noodle dishes are delicious and remember, it's all to order. So if you want to customize your meal, go ahead!  This place is crazy busy in the evenings, especially weekend evenings. It's even worse in the cooler months -- to the point where I don't go there for dinner unless it's summertime.
Love the hot and sour soup.  That and a bowl of rice hits the spot.  Staff and service is mediocre but always come back for that soup.
Chinese fusion food. Reasonable price for lunch or dinner. The food came very quickly  and the staffs were nice and friendly.  About the flavor??? I just haven't get  that the kick flavor yet.

First timer. The service was good. We enjoyed the Asian pork and pot stickers. Very reasonably priced. Will have to go back to try more items. It was different than the normal Asian tastes, I liked it.

Flo's is our go to place for takeout but recently we went in for a sit down dinner and it was such a disappointment. The service was the worst. Slow, inattentive, didn't listen or deliver items requested, and took forever to take our initial order and bring our drinks. The food was good but because of the service I will not be returning unless it's for takeout.

Flo's is good place for a business lunch. They have good size portions and a salad and fried chips are included.  I like the Pine Nut Shrimp with broccoli or the Thai Basil Chicken. Service is quick and friendly enough. You can order takeout too.
Went in with some family for lunch today. Loved that all lunch entrees on the menu were only $7.95 for large portions. Food was pretty good, and the service was really excellent.

I wish I could give this location 5 stars but due to the service I last received when introducing my mother to this place it gets 3.   Previously I had a great experience with a large group of friends one happy hour after work, but fast forward to when I brought my mother here it was a completely different experience.  The food hands down is delish and you can beat 1/2 off any drink and 1/2 appetizers (with exception to a couple that are not included).   The place was actually quite dead when I made my last visit, which struck me odd that our server was so poor at serving us. We actually had about 4-5 different servicers drop by our table since our waiter went M.I.A. on multiple occasions. Come to find out he's outside on his phone and I found him chatting it up with a table that had shown up some time after us. Later I found out there was a co-worker at that table and apparently that gets you priority service.  Anywho - if you're looking for an awesome happy hour with great prices and delicious food check this place out but be prepared it's a hit or miss experience with the service.

Flo's has amazing Asian food, it's definitely my favorite in the Valley!! My favorite dish is shrimp with asparagus on brown rice. There are so many selections to choose from and served hot, fresh, and quickly. Lunch prices are great and served with a delicious salad. Happy Hour is a must served 3-7p throughout the Resturant, great drinks and appetizers to enjoy at terrific prices. The servers are all excellent and several of them have worked at Flo's for many years. 5 Stars for sure...

Flo has managed to create a mini Chinese restaurant empire here in the Valley.  Maybe it's the funky atmosphere, maybe it's her personality ... it doesn't seem to have spawned from the food.  Although it's good, it's nothing spectacular... especially for the price.  But then again, where do you go for inspired gourmet Chinese that rises above the rest?

My friends said this Asian-y place was started by the wife of the guy who started PF Chang's. I don't know about that as I already have apprehensions of "modern" Chinese food (or rather, non-authentic).  I had the panfried noodles with "everything" (beef, shrimp, chicken and calamari). It was tasty though salty and a tad bit greasy.  I also liked our veggie lettuce wraps and fried calamari appetizers.  And who serves sake in a Chinese place?  Oh wait, this is the "Asian Kitchen."  Okay, fine.  I love sake.  Service was really good.  I actually saw a Chinese family eating merrily here while talking loudly.  Hey, it was like I was almost home in L.A.

We used to go here a lot a few years back, when a long line before 12 pm on Saturdays was the norm. Quite a bit has changed, but I still appreciate their lunch special. It's just a little disappointing to see the major changes implemented over the years (fond memories of the unlimited chips in the middle of each table). The salad that comes with the lunch special has the best dressing I've tried. We normally order the following dishes: - Shrimp w/ Long Beans: not much shrimp to be found, would appreciate more sauce; note: this is spicy unless you request otherwise - Cashew Chicken: I appreciate that you can order this the "old style" aka with breaded chicken; a good portion for lunch - Beef Chow Fun: actually quite authentic, but the noodles seemed unusually chewy (undercooked?) - Pad Thai: decent

Happy to have a good Asian place in the neighborhood! I cannot believe this used to be McDonald's. They did a really amazing job making the place over. For a former fast food joint stuck with another ol' strip mall they managed to make this place feel inviting yet open and airy.  Okay, on to the food. My boyfriend and I started out our meal with the regular lettuce wraps. They were really good. I could have just eaten these as my meal. We would have liked a little more sauce for them though - mostly because the sauce added so much flavor to it.   For our entrees I went with a chicken and veggies dish - it was a slight variation on the chicken and veggie stir fry and my boyfriend got sweet & sour chicken. The portions were huge - we definitely could have shared. And I liked that they gave us both white and brown rice - perfect for a little mix and match. The ingredients tasted fresh and the dishes were very flavorful. Overall we really enjoyed our meal. And then we enjoyed it the next day as leftovers, too.   We'll definitely be back.

I've visited Flo's a few times this past year and consider their food ok. However my last visit I tried their shrimp and asparagus which left me with food poisoning and sick for a complete day with stomach cramps. I don't believe after being this sick that I will ever return to this restaurant.

Took a date and had decided to sit on the porch. The inside seemed a little too loud for us, and the porch is very pleasant with a high fence and outdoor heaters to keep us comfortable.   I had the green curry and will order it again. She had orange chicken and seemed to enjoy it. We also shared crab rangoon and they were fine, nothing crazy, but still good.   The hostess was very pleasant and our waiter was a gentleman. We enjoyed our night and have talked about revisiting.

We were pleasantly surprised with the quality, quantity, and cleanliness of Flos. The menu offers spicy Thai, spicy Chinese, mild dishes as well as gluten free items. They have fleshly brewed China mist black tea which is mild and delicious. Happy Hour is 3-7pm every day. Saturday lunch special is $6. I had the pad Thai which spicy but not "hot spicy". They have a full bar and deserts. Casual dinning and comfortable seating, no booths. Friendly service from the hostess to our server. I will be back and highly recommend Flos to everyone. Try them out you'll be glad you did!
Take out or eat in .. both are amazing. Fabulous bartenders! Love the menu. Love the food.

First, the service was excellent. My waitress could not have been more attentive or capable. Tried the Hot and Sour soup, Dumplings and Dan Dan noodles. Soup was good, slightly above average. Shu Mai Dumplings were average, I see the same or better at any Dim Sum. The Dan Dan noodles were completely disappointing and I sent them back after 2 bites. The chicken and sauce were tasty, but the noodles had the flavor and consistency of cheap, overcooked spaghetti noodles from a generic box. Very disappointing.

I'm not a big fan of Chinese food. I like other Asian types of cuisine, but Chinese food always seems monotonous and uninspired.  Flo's changed that. We went to the Thompson Peak/Pass restaurant on a recommendation by an Uber driver.  Beautiful place. Attentive but not over bearing staff. The young lady getting our water really lined me out on some of the menu items I was curious about.  Hot and sour soup was great, with shrimp and a lot of other great stuff. Perfect for sharing.  Salt and pepper wings were plump, crispy and still juicy.  We got the twice cooked pork( xtra spicy, duh) and the spicy ginger onion beef(I think that's what it was, basically super duper Mongolian beef) and roast pork fried rice.  DAYUMMMM!!! Hadn't had Twice cooked pork in a while, amazing. Veggies done to perfection, meat was tender, not rubbery. Great spice but not overpowering.  The super Mongolian beef was a revelation. I don't ever get beef from Chinese restaurants because the beef is usually super Lowe grade and it chews like bubble gum. Not this stuff. Great cuts, juicy, and again very tender without being too chewy.  Flo came out and met with us also came back to make sure we were satisfied(to say the least).  An overall excellent experience. I'm always coming back here whenever I'm in Phoenix, hell anywhere in the southwest. Worth driving out a bit for a complete dining experience.  Flo threw in a complimentary desert which unmanned to find room for.  Oh yeah, and the true test of any Chinese food is the leftovers. Later that night after a few margaritas, I destroyed any and all leftovers. So excellent. Even the fortune cookies were great.  Thank you Flo!!!!

Our monthly group dinner.  I ate at one of their locations in Scottsdale.  We order several dishes and shared:  Beef with Wide noodles, Lettuce Wrap, Fried Tofu & vegetables, Katsu Chicken, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Singapore Chicken Satay, Spicy Ginger Onion Beef & Twice Cooked Pork.  It was all good, tasty and well prepared.  Our waitress was very quick, accommodating and friendly.  I wouldn't mind coming here again, when in the area.

DON'T COME HERE IF YOU WANT REAL, AUTHENTIC ASIAN FOOD!  This place is full of people who use forks. We should have walked out right when we stepped in and realized that there were no Asian diners. Just a panda express disguised as fancier dine in. Chicken was dry and costs over ten bucks, our "calamari" was a joke as well. A couple of the employees were slacking, it was awkward seeing a couple of them flirt and not pay attention to their tables. They obviously don't care about looking and acting professional. Go to panda express and save your money and your taste buds if you want fake Chinese. Also, it's not exactly the fact that it was so far from authentic, because I like and tolerate fake Asian food just as much as the next college student, but this was just overpriced shit. It was one of those rare bad food experiences where you regret even walking in. There is absolutely nothing worse than paying for a horrible meal.

I use to work here.... My favorite dishes on the menu are: hot and sour soup, yakisoba noddles, orange chicken, red curry and Mongolian style beef.    Happy hours are good for appetizers I recommended the wings and calamari ask for a side of salad dressing to dip with-----amazing!  Saturday lunches are 5 dollars for any dish includes a salad. Be aware service and time can take a little longer since the kitchen is backed up with in house and to go orders.   This place has good food and fast service.

Service was slow and fairly apathetic, I'd expect a little better on a Sunday afternoon.  I'd heard plenty about Flo's, mostly good, so I was excited to try it. The salad that came before lunch was cafeteria-grade iceberg. Dressing was tasty, though. My entree was shrimp with bacon, cabbage, and tomato. It tasted okay, nothing special though.  The reason I'm giving them one star, though, is because something in this meal (I'm assuming shrimp) made me sick, and I'm still paying for it two days later. Far from impressed, and I won't be coming back.

If I would have written this review after our first time ordering here I would have given it a 5 star review. Our first time we ordered pork and shrimp dumplings, twice cooked pork, and their onion and ginger beef--all of which were absolutely delicious. We liked it so much that we came back a couple of days later and ordered the same thing. Tonight we decided to try something new and quickly discovered that we had made a mistake. We started with the calamari (half off on happy hour) which was chewy, bland and did not come with sauce. Then we had had the salt and pepper chicken wings and they were good, but not amazing. My boyfriend ordered the hot and sour soup which is his favorite; it was a bit weird tasting and not in a good way. I ordered a Thai beef and noodle plate as my entree. We sent it back. The dish had a good flavor profile, but it was very dry--"drier than the Sahara Desert" as my boyfriend put it. All in all, I am super disappointed because we were so excited about this place after our first visit. We will still be back, but we will be sticking to our original order. On a side note, happy hour from 3-7pm here is a great deal. All drinks and appetizers are half off. I really enjoyed my Flo-Ha cocktail.

Flos has some decent chinese at an affordable price. It is located in a parking lot with yogurtology, AJs, and chipotle. Yogurtology is a great place for desert after!   I get the teriyaki beef here. It is pretty good, although I don't like it that hot. It is sometimes soggy. I'm not really a fan of the other options on the menu (but don't worry, I'm picky. The menu is huge!)  The reason it gets a 4 is because it has the best deal in the valley. Come here for a 5 dollar lunch on a Saturday! Great deal and it gets very busy. On Mondays and Tuesdays, you can get lunch prices at dinner time as well!

Maybe not the most romantic restaurant for dinner, but offers an amazing lunch and has great drink offers from the quaint, little bar.  Very good Phad Thai and Spicy Basil Chicken...  Have a Flo's Bloody Mary while you are there.  Great food!

Oh Flo's how do I love thee....Let me count the ways  1. Quickly seated from a sweet hostess  2. Fast & Friendly service!!  3. Those little heavenly wanton chips that I dip in Flo's out of this world sweet and sour sauce  4. THE FREAKEN GARDEN SALAD! For the love of all things holy! I wish they bottled and sold the salad dressing! Its crack people! Crack on a salad! Cant.Get.Enough.  5. The lunch size sweet and sour chicken is great! If you are really hungry its just enough, or not so hungry its good for a little lunch tomorrow! And the chicken is crisp yet light, and its not drenched in sauce, its just perfectly sauced...always!   I heart you Flo's, I really do. I haven't even taken the hubs here yet, you are like my  little secret! I need to take the hubs here, he will love it and most likely leave me to make out with the salad dressing, cause its that amazing!

Best Chinese food in the Valley. As others have said, salad dressing is addictive as IS available to take home in containers. Shrimp dishes are outstanding with large, plump high quality pieces of shrimp. I have never had even an average dish here. Go and enjoy!
I love this place. I am so picky with chinese food because it never tastes fresh, but Flo's is always fresh. I drive from Anthem to eat here. Love it!!!

A M A Z I N G and by far the BEST, most delicious and fresh Asian food I have ever had.  We so enjoyed this dinner while visiting my P's in Scottsdale.
