If I could have, I would have dined here every day, every meal, as often as they would let me come.  It was crowded for dinner, as I would expect, but we were seated within about 15 minutes nestled amongst families, date night'ers and soloists.  We started with the wings - get them, get two orders.  They were crazy good, no breading just crispy hot tasty chicken wings very meaty.  The egg drop soup was out of this world and I am not a soup person - I have had egg drop soup a dozen or so times in my life and this one takes the cake hands down served in a giant crock.  We ordered chicken fried rice which was white and fresh and we could not get enough, chicken satay with a wonderful peanut curry sauce and lettuce wraps to graze on for about an hour during our stay.  We enjoyed every smidgen of food here - every single item was made with such quality ingredients and served in abundance as we had plenty to take home.  I love this place.  I wish they had one in Chicago.  FLO'S PLEASE COME TO CHICAGO, WE WILL EAT YOU SO MUCH!!! OH!  There is a happy hour half off certain dishes and cocktails in the late afternoon - everything but one item we ordered was on special pricing.  Dudes, we had two orders of wings, a crock of soup for four, chicken satay, two orders of lettuce wraps, chicken fried rice for like 40 bucks!!  Go, please go. Go now.

This is one of my old standbys.  Great for takeout or eating there.  Its never that crowded and the food is awesome.  My absolute favorite is the green curry chicken.  If I could be sure no one saw me, I would lick the bowl!  The japanese teppanyaki beef is also wonderful.  The meet is super tender and the noodles are delish.  The malaysian cashew beef and lettuce wraps are also great choices.  I like the varitey they offer, lots of different asian flavors.  I'm moving farther away soon and am bummed it won't be right down the street.  But I'll still make the trip!

Fantastic Happy Hour.. 3-7pm, 1/2 off ALL booze and ALL Apps.. For about 40 bones, you can come here with a partner, and you can do some pretty good damage through their menu.. Highlights are the Calamari, and the Dumplings.. It feels a touch drab and sparce inside, and it lacks an energy, but the food is really good..
Good location  Don't ask for spicy as they will make it very spicy Standard Asian food
Have been to Flo's for over 7 years, the food is fresh, the service fast and the prices fantastic, try their happy hour, Flo is an amazing women with the golden touch! love love love the food!

Met a friend here for happy hour, Great drink and food specials, We had lettuce wraps and dumplings and other goodies, Everything was cheap and good, Spent very little and had lunch the next day! The dirnks were really good, The place is nice, upscale, Has been packed both times we went.

I saw the reviews and had to try it. Was not disappointed. Really nice upscale restaurant, manager who cares about your experience...which is important. And then, GOOD food. Good flavors, not too greasy like you get sometimes. The hot and sour soup was exceptional, it has shrimp in it so ask if you don't eat seafood. The Kung Pao chicken was truly the best I have had in AZ, not piled with sauce like most places, just chicken and peppers, lots of flavor. Will try again for sure.

I live right across the street from this place and have been wanting to try it out. Today, my boyfriend and I finally had the chance to go.  Long story short,  food was pretty good but service was lacking so much so we would only go back if it was for takeout.  We were one of two tables in the restaurant and served by Stephanie.  The staff,  manager included, were more concerned eating their lunch in a group at the back of the restaurant to be focused on how ours (the guest) was.  Working in the restaurant industry I know what good attentive service looks like and this place needs some work.
Flos is amazing. The food is cheap, good, and quick. The service is great. See Stephanie in the bar.
Food was hot and good. Prices were reasonable and the service was excellent.  The lemon chicken and pepper chicken with a Hugh bowl of egg drop soup.

Wow - exceptional service...and I mean from everyone!!  Had to pull the owner aside just to share it with him.  The food was also pretty damn goood too.    I have to single out one gal, who I had asked the preverbal quintessential question to..." so what's good"?  And she didn't skip a beat - she actually qualified me first and then followed up with ale great suggestions.  I love it when a server has the willingness and confidence to do this - it simply shows thy care both about the establishment they work for and the customer.  She was a rock star.  I didn't catch her name but she was awesome!!     Thanks for great lunch experience - I'll be back soon!!!

Finally - a place to get decent real Asian food in Scottsdale!  So many Asian restaurants here are just bland and don't even attempt to balance the flavors.  There are many great items to choose from here.  The menu covers several different Asian cuisines.

Flos never fails! I've been going here ever since I was little. Even the salad they give you before your meal is delicious! Their dressing is amazing! I usually get the orange chicken (maybe it's sweet and sour chicken I can't remember) but recently I tried the coconut curry soup and OMG it's to die for! Perfect blend of sweet and spicy! I love Flos!

We've been here several times since it is right down the street from where the husband and I work. We've also brought the in-laws here, since they really like Pei Wei. I would have to say that this place is similar to Pei Wei, but with way more varieties and less of a "chain" feel.   When you dine here, you receive a salad with a tasty dressing and some wonton chips with sweet and sour sauce to start. Then you have many protein and vegetable options. When with the in-laws, we usually order way too much food, but it's all really tasty and makes good leftovers. The house fried rice is delicious - it comes with beef, chicken, and shrimp! The sweet and sour shrimp technically isn't on the menu, but they can bread anything and dunk it in sauce. S&S Shrimp is one of the father-in-law's favorite. The beef and broccoli is tasty - the broccoli tastes fresh and the beef is really tender. The sister-in-law and I really enjoy the beef teppanyaki - which is wide flour noodles with onions and beef. The sauce is delicious and again the beef is tender. The husband always orders a different dish, never deciding on just one favorite. On Saturdays, the lunch items are all $5, which is a great deal. If you are ever in the area, definitely give Flo's a try! You won't be disappointed.

In a word, this place is a success at providing american (quasi Chinese food.)  Not authentic, not so good at all.  I didn't base this review on a single visit.  I wasted (3) visits confirming the that the food is sub-par for anyone pursuing authentic great tasting, Chinese food.  You can't even determine what region of China that they are attempting to reproduce.  They really should try and at least keep up with PF Changs, or Panda Express.

Ahhhhh, good ol' Flo's Chinese Restaurant.  I love this place.  I was introduced to this place when I first moved to AZ  seven years ago by my friend Anushka.  This quickly became my favorite happy hour place when I lived in the area.  Just a quick drink with a friend always ended up to be a late night at Flo's.  It is an easy place to hang out at the bar.  Great drinks and food specials.  The service was great, decor is nice and the food is yummy!    I always enjoy coming back here.  Also, ya can't go wrong with the $5.00 lunch specials on Saturdays!    Check it out!
BAd service.  Bad food.  I have tried Flo's multiple times and it is an all around fail.  Too bad. This city needs good fried rice and such

If you're hungry for Asian, by all means go. It's a nice restaurant with a very pleasant staff.   The food is good and tasted fresh. The Coconut Curry Soup is good, the pad thai was not among the best I've had but it was satisfying... The Tom Yun Gun was way too salty.

I have enjoyed Flo's for many years. It is clean, food is fresh, prices are reasonable, and wait staff is friendly and efficient. Lunches come with a nice small salad. You can choose from white or brown rice without an up charge. They do a great job with their shrimp dishes. Saturday lunches or happy hour prices are great value. Love the Chinese lettuce cups (and they also offer Thai version which my neighbor prefers).  This is not super authentic Asian cooking, but is geared to American tastes, imo. If you really like spicy, be sure to let your server know.

I love happy hour!  They have half off appetizers that are delicious, hot and fresh.  One of my favorites are the buns filled with BBQ pork.  Their lettuce wraps are as good as PF Changs and their soups are delicious.

flos is probably one of my favorite places for takeout. Its also very nice restaurant. They have a mixture of Chinese and thai food. They're teriyaki chicken is delicious.. and i love their egg rolls, they're so light. I been to some pretty pricey Chinese restaurants in the valley and wasted money,  Flo's is definitely worth every penny. if you want delicious fine Chinese/Thai cuisine, flo's is the place to be!

Initially had some trouble getting through to call in an order, but Flo got us taken care of. Awesome experience as usual, food is always fantastic, and customer service exemplary! Highly recommend this place.

This time i ventured off my usual noodle dish and started off with Chinese Lettuce Wraps which were on the HH menu. It was large enough to be an entree. We ordered the Mongolian Beef and Scallops with mushrooms. The only issue I had with those entrees was there was a good amount of green onions and onions in both dishes. There were three types of mushrooms with the Scallops and both dishes had an okay flavor. The server was pleasant and was able to answer all of our  questions. Our water glasses were kept full.

Tried this place instead of our usual Flo's in the Promenade.  Arrived on a Thursday night at 6:30 PM and it was so noisy, I could hear the sounds bouncing off the walls. This venue has a large bar area.  The service was lacking and the food was so-so.  Won't be coming back here.

Took a while to finally get seated and the waitstaff acted as if it wasn't their job to seat us. When the waitstaff finally paid attention to us, we were seated, but the service was pathetic. The need for drink refills went unnoticed and it took 30 minutes to get the check. After leaving the restaurant, neither of us felt great from the food and decided the leftovers needed to be trashed. I had such high hopes for this restaurant, but I'll never be back.
Had the Malaysian coconut beef & it was amazing. Coconut curry soup was awesome as well as the spicy Kung pao chicken. Tasty meal, great service.

The girl on the phone taking my order was so disorganized I had to repeat my order several times and even explain some of the dishes to her so she knew what I was talking about. I was quoted 30 minutes and ended up waiting about 40 for my food. To top it off, I asked for no bell peppers in my dish because I am allergic, and what do I find in my food? Tons of bell peppers. Thanks. The other food I had was flavorless and disappointing. This location is absolutely terrible. The FLW location is so much better. Update: I found a hair in my food. I couldn't even make up how bad this experience was.

I've been eating Flo's for some time now but this was my first dine in experience. Server was friendly knowledgeable and attentive. Happy hour was a steal, I had a 22oz Tsing Tao for $3. I had the Seafood Sizzling Rice Guo Ba which was delightful. I would recommend doing your research before you go because the layout of the menu is rather sporadic. They have plenty of vegetarian and gluten free options that are clearly marked on the menu. My dish came with huge pieces of shrimp and scallops and I think was fairly priced based on what you get. Atmosphere was pleasant and I believe the owner even stopped by to say hello. Food and service time was great. Only complaints I have are the water could taste less "tappy" and the menu could be more organized. 5/5 a great experience every time.

I recently had lunch here with a friend who recommended it. The restaurant is modern, which to some may seem a bit sterile. I thought it was a pleasant atmosphere, very clean, with the tables spaced so that you were not on top of the diners next to you. I chose Teriyaki Chicken, and fortunately inquired whether it included any vegetables. The waiter said it did not, but offered to have fresh steamed vegetables added for a small fee. The waiter was very attentive, constantly refilling our water glasses, etc. Our entrees arrived fairly quickly and were delicious. The added vegetables were prepared perfectly. The portions were generous and I took home half of mine for dinner. I would definitely return to Flo's and would recommend it to friends.

Came here twice for Happy Hour where apps and drinks are all 50% off. And you get to sit in the restaurant so that makes it nice when the bar is full or you have more than two people. Potstickers are good-chicken better flavor than the pork. You get 4 chicken ones and 6 pork. The chicken are bigger than the pork so it balances out.  Shrimp skewers are good and good deal.  Shu mai-awful. Mushy. Stay away from these.  Salt and pepper wings-yummy. Good taste. Big and plump.  Spring rolls-not the rice paper wrapped Vietnamese ones. These are fried like lumpia or skinny egg rolls. Better than I thought in that there was lots of meat in the chicken ones.   Chicken skewers (both kinds)-had mixed reviews.  Some people liked them and some did.  Calamari-good amount.  Not the best I've ever had but for the price, pretty good.   I've also had the lunch version of the Dan Dan noodles and they were pretty good.   There's not many good Chinese places in the area so unless you want to drive to Mesa or Tempe, I think this is a good sub.

We had relatives in town over the weekend at a resort down the street from Flo's. First of all, they do not deliver. The night family got in, we got Chinese rather than go out, because they were tired from their road trip. My fianc√© had to go pick it up, and since we had no menu, I just ordered typical items over the phone, and was not given the total. Had we seen a menu with prices, no way we would've gone to Flo's. First of all, the prices are outrageous, and do not reflect the quality of the food. Got five dishes and the tab was $85! Where we get Chinese delivery in Phoenix, tab would've been under $50. The pork foo yong was just a big egg patty with bean sprouts, but NO pork, at $12.95, but the gravy was good. The vegetable pad Thai had no flavor and was made with big fat noodles instead of the thin rice noodles we were wanting, and not many vegetables, at $12.??  The most disappointing dish of all was the shrimp fried rice. Not only was it NOT fried and had no flavor, but it was plain dry white rice with peas, egg, a few vegetables, and about 7 tiny shrimp, at $14.95. It was nothing like the moist brown yummy shrimp fried rice I used to get, with lots of shrimp. The veg spring rolls were good, but $6 for two! The Mongolian beef ($15.75) was small, but very good. And The Kung Pow chicken ($13.50) was a nice surprise with red peppers along with the typical green, and extra vegetable - not too many peanuts though. All in all, most of the meal was disappointing, but the biggest shock was the $85 vs. $50 for the same but YUMMY items AND delivery to our door. Will not go there again when staying in Scottsdale.

I used to LOVE flo's... but I haven't been there in a few years, and this time it just wasn't as good as I remember it. The beef and broccoli was tasty, I definitely enjoyed that. The crispy noodles had a sauce that was way to salty for my taste. Service was good, it was way too loud and way too dark. I don't mean to sound like and old lady, but it was really dark. i usually like to be able to see what I'm eating... overall its fine but I wouldn't go out of my way to rush back.

Hands down the BEST casual Chinese restaurant in Scottsdale! The food is always fresh and the sauces are light and delicious! Great Happy Hour and Saturday lunch specials! If you go for Saturday lunch get there early because people line up for the restaurant to open. Well worth the wait!

Hands down the BEST casual Chinese restaurant in Scottsdale! The food is always fresh and the sauces are light and delicious! Great Happy Hour and Saturday lunch specials! If you go for Saturday lunch get there early because people line up for the restaurant to open. Well worth the wait! Flo even occasionally stops by your table to see how things are going.

I've always liked Flos for their multiple oriental offerings from chinese, Thai and Vietnamese, plus the freshness of the food. Today the food was good but service was really lacking. It took multiple requests just to get water and my food came out after many other tables were served that had come in after me.
I've read about this place a lot and it met the hype.  Food tasted fresh and great quality.  Will be beach definitely.

I can still remember being at ASU more than a decade ago, and laughing late at night every time I saw a commercial for Flo's.  No matter what I was watching, somewhere between midnight and 3:00am it would air at least once.  A cheap, but somehow overly produced ad featuring an asian woman with a heavy accent introducing herself, and explaining why I should eat at her restaurant.  Yes, it's quite immature, but it led to a friend of mine and I becoming obsessed with trying Flo's on general principal.  And when we finally did, we were surprised to become big fans.  All these years later, Flo's is still in the valley, still awesome, and still popular.  (for better or worse, the commercials are gone).  My girlfriend and I ordered takeout, and at 5:45 on a Friday, the place was slammed.  I'm not one to go by the adage that popular means good, but when a lot of valley residents are passing up the chains or a local spot, it's a positive sign.  We had the lettuce cup (think PF Chang's lettuce wraps with a fresher taste), Kung pow chicken (holy crap this was good), beef and snow peas (also awesome).  The meats were all sliced, cooked, and sauced perfectly.  I have nothing bad to say about any of those dishes.  Food is good.  Portions are good.  Prices are good.  The only negative is trying to park.  The strip mall this restaurant has very limited parking.  It can be a battle for a spot during peak lunch and dinner hours.  It's also very loud inside when it's busy, but that seems to be a trend nowadays, so I guess that makes Flo's a trendsetter.

Out favorite Asian restaurant in the west!! Love Flos restaurant! And love Flo!! She is a wonderful owner who is generally there toi greet us every time we frequent her restaurant! You can tell she takes pride in her restaurant and is genuine with her customers.  The hot and sour soup is delicious and the very best I have ever had! It's got loads of shrimp, chicken, mushrooms and tofu in it and the savory flavor is over the top!!  Another favorite is the green curry chicken, house lo mein, moo shu pork, Mongolian beef with broccoli just to name a few of our favorites!! Oh, and did I forget to mention her lettuce wraps!! Yummy! Flos is one of the first places we dine when we are in Scottsdale!!  We were there last night! 6 of us and ate to capacity for under 80.00 plus tip! That was with no alcohol and most of us were hydrating with just bottled water. Buy HAPPY HOUR DAILY with 50% off all drinks and appetizers!! What a great Value!!  The only reason I did not give Flos 5 stars was because of the service. Generally the service really good, although the last few times it took forever to order, then get our food. And the waiter kept forgetting to bring out extra sauces!  Hopefully the next visit i will update to a 5 star! Until next time..... I highly recommend you try this restaurant!!

We had lunch here together with friends. The place was packed and loud but it was understandable because it was after all, peak hour. The staff were friendly and serve the food as fast as they could. The food though, is nothing authentic. The Tom Yum soup is far from how it should taste though I should give credit for making it "look" like one. It's not that bad that you cant eat it, but if you're looking for a real Asian cuisine taste, it's not gonna be from this place.

Stephanie was our waitress and was extremely attentive introduced myself and my business partner to the lunch menu and guided us both to a delicious and customized items for both of our dietary needs and edible desires. I ate the beef/broccoli sweet and spicy with veggies and no rice. The veggies were cooked perfectly, and not over cooked nor undercooked and the meet was tender. Highly recommended for a nice lunch or dinner. Ask for Stephanie and share with her a story from "Alexa" to make for good conversation and a laugh.
Stopped here last night for happy hour - most all appetizers and drinks 50% off - what a deal! Then, we got carry out for home.  Food was excellent, fresh, tasty.  If I lived here I'd be a regular!

I was there for Christmas at 5pm. Jammed packed is an under statement. Apparently partially because very few restaurants are open then.  We ordered soup and after quite a wait I knew the soup would arrive at the same time as the entree and that's exactly what happened. Totally understandable because of how slammed they were.  The Thai Coconut Shrimp soup was awesome. The Yellow Curry Shrimp was good but lacked the level of flavor the soup had. The quantity of the shrimp was quite adequate. The staff was young and wholesome, very nice. Prices are reasonable. I look forward to returning when I'm in town again.

Ok...so who goes to happy hour at a Chinese restaurant? This guy does now!!! Wow! Great food...great specials and our server Stephanie was prompt...witty...and provided great service! Will you see me again....uh yes!!!!! Flo's does happy hour right. Only problem....I ordered so many apps I didn't try the entree's! Next time I will pace myself...as if! Lol....a must try!

This is the newest in the chain of restaurants owned by Flo. This is my preliminary review, as the restaurant has only been open for two days and like all new places it has a few things to work out.  I arrived at 6:30 and was seated immediately. I was offered a libation and ordered a Diet Coke, the only diet drink on the menu. I would have ordered Iced Tea except that the only sweetener available was what many restaurants have removed from their tables in favor of Splenda. Unfortunately, the carbonator on the soft drink line was not working properly and my Diet Coke was mostly syrup and water.  The restaurant was nice looking, but was all hard surfaces making for a somewhat noisy environment. The addition of some soft hangings or some carpet would ameliorate the amount of sound.  First ordered were Spicy Wontons and Chinese Lettuce Cups. The wontons had good texture and I loved the very light wrapper around it. The flavor was very light as was the spice but I would order it again. Unfortunately, I cannot say the same for the lettuce wraps. My plate contained a half head of lettuce which was not taken apart at all, so my first order of things to do was to tear apart a half head of lettuce. In doing this a number of the leaves broke apart, leaving me with broken leaves to place the contents on and later drip down my hands. The filling did not impress me as it seemed to lack flavor which the accompanying sauces could not make up for.  Next was the Hot and Sour soup. A lovely bowl of properly gelatinous soup swimming with all sorts of goodies including very fresh shrimp. I added some vinegar and chili oil and it tasted just like I remember from China. This soup was dynamite! I'd have loved a bit of Ogo in it but it was a great soup.  Next was Kung Pao Chicken. One of the ingredients in it was zucchini which was a nice surprise since so many places use celery. A second nice surprise happened when I was served both white and brown rice. While white rice is traditional in oriental cookery, the brown rice is a nice addition for those who prefer a healthier option or prefer the nutty taste of it. The chicken was cooked to perfection, but once again the dish seemed to lack in the flavor department. It seemed to be lacking the heat and flavor that should be part of the dish, as well as the peanuts that I could not find.  I was brought Ma Po Tofu to try. It was made with regular peppers, and while the ingredients were all there, none of the heat was. I wish it had been made with real Szechuan peppercorns which would have made it an authentic dish even if it had to cost more.  Last was the Chocolate Wontons. Half wontons cooked till hardened then covered in a dark chocolate sauce plated with a slice of orange and dusted with powdered sugar. I appreciated the interplay of the orange and chocolate, but there was no way to eat it without getting my fingers dipped in chocolate too. Not that that is necessarily bad for a chocolate lover, but getting cleaned up afterward without a wet nap is a problem.  Overall, as a new opening there are a few problems to be ironed out, especially in the flavor area. Most of the food seemed cooked beautifully but lacking all sorts of seasoning. While Flo is noted for healthy variations in her food, she is not known for lack of flavor and I am hoping that this will be worked out by my next visit in a few months. If I had to sum up the food in one word it would be fresh. The food was anything but tired and worn out and the use of nice fresh ingredients was apparent.  The restaurant seemed spotless. The waitstaff was a little confused but that is to be expected in a new opening. The cashier needs to know that sitting on the counter where the register is does not look nice and is unacceptable.  I'm giving 4 stars for quality of ingredients and for service in a new environment. Next time I hope to give 4 stars for flavor as well.   As my readers know, I do not accept free meals, and after paying for my dinner I found that the  charge on my card had been voided and the meal had been comped. In keeping with my precepts, I have donated the cost of the meal to a local charity.

Love Flo's! The food here is awesome, prices are great and people are great too. I was just a little bummed when I came here for lunch on a Saturday at 11:45 am to realize they didn't open until 12 pm! Thought that was a little funky for a place that is known for their awesome lunch specials. Now I know, and will plan more accordingly. No biggie.  The salad they brought out to start was so delicious. In the future I will ask for light dressing because in my opinion I thought there was a little too much on it. But the flavor was definitely there. For my entree, I ordered the Garlic Chicken with brown rice. It came with sauteed veggies as well! So yummy! Craving it as I write this a couple days later. Flo's has become one of my family's top choices due to the fact that they have a lot of vegan options for my brother!   Also have to shout out our waiter. He knew we were pressed for time (the main reason why waiting an extra 15 minutes for them to open was stressin' me out), so he did everything he could to get our food out as fast as possible. I'll be back time and time again! Love it here.

Tried the yellow curry. Very tasty with lots of fresh veggies (green beans, broccoli, carrots, onions). The service was attentive and the lunch portion was just right. The decor is attractive and service was attentive. Highly recommended.

2/28/14  Called out sick from work, and I was craving for egg noodles with either beef, or chicken with ginger, so we ordered the Mongolian Beef (an entree I've already tried before), Thai-style Green Curry chicken (new to me!), and Shrimp with snow peas for Mom for pick-up.  Enjoyed the Mongolian beef (beef with onions, jalape√±os, red pepper flakes, and something that looks like sweet potato leaves), but as always, I felt a little let-down when I bite into the pieces and did not find the satisfactory crunch of the caramelization of past Mongolian beef entrees I've had elsewhere.  I was looking forward to the ginger-hot spiciness of the green curry chicken, and while it was slightly underwhelming, which I'm sure is most likely from the fact that I'm suffering from a cold and could not taste all of the flavor notes, I was happy to be able to detect the ginger in the dish.  I loved the long beans in this entree, which also had basil, lemongrass, fresh chilies, shallots, galangal, garlic, and cilantro.  I had a taste of both dishes for lunch, and I would have to say that the beef was more flavorful- saltier, and definitely spicier!  The noodles were angel hair-thin and had not satisfied my dietary lust for stir-fried noodles I fancied while languishing in bed waiting for lunch time to roll around...  I offered to share my dishes with Mom, but she was too busy enjoying her Shrimp and snow peas!  Dinner time came, and I enjoyed the noodles and green curry even more-- it tasted even better, or perhaps I was feeling better from the OTC medication and rest...   Wished this dish contained a LOT of long beans, as I find myself rationing the remaining amount...    Btw, each entree came with a side salad and the signature house dressing.

Take-out sucked violently. Too much vinegar in the hot and sour soup, I felt like an old lady with yeast issues.  But what sucked the most was their new take-out containers; half the size of PF Changs and compartmentalized, like a tv dinner. In one compartment, the rice, entree in the other.  Think about it. What was once a white, four-fold container is now a cheesy two compartment container with half the food.  I'm out.

Takeout takes very long some times. I usually call to order the food so it would be ready for pickup. I went there when they told me it would be ready (about 30min from the call) and I ended up waiting another 30min there.  Awesome $5 lunch special on Saturdays!

I happend to find this place as I was itching for some sake and left very satisfied.   Grub a dub- I find it sometimes hard to eat asian food , unless sushi or sashimi is involved, because I always feel so full after, but this place is different , slightly smaller portions , with fitting prices. The hot and sour soup intantly became greatness to me.  Service- I guess i went at a weird time as I was the only one in the place , so every thing came out fast and hot.But you can tell the server was about to leave and kept rushing away to do her final things.:(  The Get up- kinda standard look to the place , blacks and red stark asain decor . nothing new or stand out. but not cheesy either.  All in all, ill go again but probably wont suggest it when headed out with friends.

This place always gets rave reviews from my co-workers, so finally we went. Its a nice spot and I am sure there are some meals better than others, but I wasn't blown away as my friends have been describing. It was good, it was standard...nothing our of the ordinary. I don't think I would go back here when I know there is better food elsewhere.   I had the sweet and sour chicken, crab puffs, and pot stickers. The apps were the best part for me, however they were still just your standard apps. Friends had the chicken lo mein and the orange chicken. Both were eh.

Pretty disappointing. I came with my daughter to enjoy birthday dinner and the farthest we got was being seated by the host and I got to watch the wait staff run around and small talk with customers and run behind the bar and make drinks for about 10 minutes and no one even acknowledged to offer a glass of water.

I love Asian Food.       That being said Fusion places can be very satisfying due to a range of unique choices. But those choices have to be good.      After shopping at Whole Foods we decided to dine here since it appeared to have a good crowd.      The menu has a wide variety of dishes and is very appealing.      We thought of soup and asked a couple next to us what they had and if they liked it. Their reply was that every soup here is great and theirs was the Hot and Sour soup. They were nice enough to lets us try a spoonful after saving their extra. You get a large bowl for a good price.       To be honest it was the best part of our meal along with the sliced BBQ pork. We didn't get any other soup since my friend wanted shrimp.      We started with the Crab Puffs and BBQ Sliced Pork. The puffs were OK though soggy in the center since they weren't fried long enough. The pork was delicious, tender and moist. And was in a nice sauce.      I ordered the Chicken Vindaloo (The worst I've ever had.) Fair taste but no spice with what looked like pre cooked chicken.      My friend had the Spicy Cinnamon Shrimp. A big waste of money. 5 shrimp in a Cinnamon sauce that had very little spice or heat and the 1 I tried, I would swear was cooked with it shell on. Either that or it had the toughest skin under the shell I've ever eaten. They were cooked with peas and came on this big bed of fried wonton strips. It was not worth the money.       If we do return it will be for the soup and to try the Sweet and Sour Chicken which looked good on the table next to us.
Flo's has been our go to place for Chinese, or just a great meal in general, for roughly 10 years. Upscale/trendy scene, great value(especially the daily happy hour), amazing food and service.

Have been told good things about the Scottsdale location. Went in for a late lunch with a friend. Menu selection was awesome and it was during happy hour so it made it even better.  Food was excellent, and the serving sizes were large enough the meal could have been split in two.  The only downside to this visit was the fact they only seemed to have one server on duty. It took her awhile to get our order in and to bring drinks. Could have simply been shift change, not sure.

THREE TIMES IN ONE WEEK! love this place! I went here last weekend after the Open and I went again Fri night because I couldn't get enough... then again yesterday for lunch since a friend had to try it per my raves. I've had a wide variety but here are my faves: Chinese lettuce cups-OMG, Spring rolls(chicken but they do offer a veggie option) these are more like egg rolls but still phenomenal.. and my last fave is the orange chicken. Price is reasonable because you can taste the quality ingredients and get decent service. Lunch portions are cheaper and come with a side salad. Every time I've visited I've gone home with left overs.. even lunch! ..so that says something about their portions(and I'm an eater). They have a decent beer selection and the amount of Sake you get with a bomber is surprisingly a lot.. I think the sale craft holds more ounces than a typical craft. The final item I'll comment is the passion fruit iced tea.. it's REALLY good. I'll definitely be coming back!

The place was busy on a Friday at noon so we sat outside under a nicely placed umbrella and when the waitress lowered the music the 4 of us enjoyed talking and eating! Shrimp Pad Thai was okay. Would have liked more Pad Thai and not the other half of the plate of brown rice. Others had the beef and snow peas, and others ate the soy and garlic eggplant meal...all with brown rice. Passionfruit ice tea and I liked the green iced tea.

First time at Flo's and was extremely impressed! Not as formal as PF Chang's but the food was just as good if not better.  Service was a little slow, but they were very busy.   Overall a definite plus! We will be back.

We eat quite regularly at Flo's & I know it's Valentine's night, but getting there at 6.55pm & waiting 40 minutes for an appetizer isn't acceptable. So, I stood up & asked for a manager. Tatum came over and I said 6.55 and 40 minutes later no appetizer. What pissed me off the most was not once during the conversation did she apologize, she said, "were busy". Then she disappeared never to return to our table. At least apologize. The chicken on the lettuce wraps was burned so that was edible. And when we left the 2 girls up front didn't even say goodbye. Really. I think we'll travel to Jade Palace as they have staff there that are mannerly. C'mon Flo!!!

Food was not that great, kind of greasy. Container only 3/4 full. Even the soup - I bought the large quart size and received just over half full. Cost was expensive, VERY expensive if you take into consideration none of the containers were full. Egg rolls and spring rolls more dough than filling and extremely greasy.

My brother & I have been coming here for years and Flo's is consistently good.  Whenever I'm in town we'll usually meet for a quick  and reasonably priced lunch at Flo's.    The food is always fresh, tasty and prepared with quality ingredients.  I'm especially fond of their Thai-inspired curry dishes, but I haven't been disappointed by any of their meals. The lunch special comes with a small salad and even though I'm not a big fan of iceberg lettuce, Flo's yummy salad dressing more than makes up for it.   This place is run like a well-oiled machine with prompt, capable and friendly service.  If you're on a time schedule for your lunch break you can depend on Flo's to get you fed with efficiency. All of this and only $8? Oh yeah, that's why Flo's is our go-to lunch break in North Scottsdale.

Flos is my absolute fav spot for lunch in Scottsdale! You can't beat the prices, the service is fast and the food is always fantastic. They have done an amazing job for so many years. You can't go wrong for lunch!
I have never had such fresh and great chinese food!  We had take out tonight and it was piping hot and tasty.  The staff is friendly too.  Just wish they delivered...

Great service.  The waitress and waiters, the whole staff was kind and so helpful.  They paid attention to us despite larger groups nearby ordering drinks.  I Really felt respected here.  The value is great here too, You get a lot of food for what you pay.  so why the 3 stars?  The food sucks.  Sorry, its the same quality and taste as when Safeway makes Chinese food.  Its was very mediocre.

It has been about 6 months since we were at Flo's last. We used to frequent Flo's on a regular basis and it was one of our favorites in town for Chinese food. There lunch prices have gone up to about $9. I understand the need to increase prices, but the half dinner portion that used to be half the price for lunch is now only a few dollars cheaper than dinner and still half the size. You do get a salad with lunch,but it is essentially iceberg lettuce with a little dressing. I would spend the few dollars more for a dinner portion if you like having leftovers. I ordered the Moo goo gai pan as usual. It came out without any chicken. I let our waiter know that there was no chicken and he took the dish away without apology. I waited for about 15 minutes while the rest of my party ate there lunch. Another gentleman brought out a new and improved Moo goo with chicken, but without a word of apology. I then realized that it was almost bone dry and did not have any more than a glisten of sauce. I asked the waiter who delivered my dish for some sauce because the dish didn't seem to have any. He said "oh , you would like some extra sauce" and I said no I would just like some sauce on the dish as it appears that it was left off. He returned with a small cup of sauce, again without a word. I felt badly wasting almost the entire cup as I only wanted a couple of spoonfuls not a drowning plate, but did appreciate some sauce finally about 25 minutes after my party received there food. I was incredibly disappointed by the mistakes and service. This used to be a favorite and I hope that they were just having an off day, but we will not be back.
Great food, ambiance and service. Thank you Flo for bringing your great food to the Tempe area! You are the best!
Have been coming to Flos for years - every time it is absolutely delicious. Really great Chinese food - this place is a must! Get the cream cheese wontons and orange chicken !!

It can be hard for me to find well cooked tofu so I was so excited to finally find a place for awesome tofu Asian dishes! Really good food, friendly and attentive service and the atmosphere was really cool.   **Update: They recently changed their menu and some of the food items that were favorites are now either gone or not as good. It's a bummer for us.

Flo's is still a go-to family favorite. We prefer this location over the other locations. The salad dressing they use on the house salad is so addictive. Their portions are very large, if ordering something like sweet and sour chicken we use an entree to feed two people. We always order sauce on the side, in case we need to take something home. The kids offerings are hearty portions, I often order them for my adult meal.
I love the atmosphere in the place. I really liked the katsu chicken. Only bad thing I have to say was that there was obvious food spilled on the ground that no one bothered to clean up.
That's not Chinese Food!  This is so watered down to match the vanilla patrons in Scottsdale.  I find it offensive to be frank.

That's not Chinese!  I eat here once and never again.  Not because the food is bad per se, it simply isn't Chinese food.  Flo has so watered down her menu by cutting the very thing that makes Chinese food Chinese Food, SPICY!    But that's not her fault, its the people in the Scottsdale area who somehow think that's how Chinese food is suppose to be - IT ISN'T!  But how can one argue with Flo's success?  ME!  She sold out to the N.E. crowd who thing an onion is spicy!  If Flo's was Chinese food I'd give her higher rating, the problem is, that's what she markets herself as.   Her husband or ex-husband stuck to his guns and made some excellent Chinese food, but the local palettes couldn't handle real Chinese food and he went under!  How unfortunate that we in Scottsdale have to give into those from the N.E. that have no sense of good food.  Too Bad!
Food is always great but the service was terrible.!!!  The hostess was very rude and we had to ask 3 people to get a waiter to take our order.

Flos is close to our house, yet we have never tried till now. The staff was young, but I was pleasantly surprised at a couple of "stand outs" that really shined.  I am in a wheel chair from a recent motorcycle accident and have found that helpfulness and courtesy comes from how you are raised, not training.  So thankful that a couple of the guys went out of their way to clear a path and hold the door for my wife who was pushing the wheel chair. Very much appreciated.   Now the food.  I had the king pao chicken and my wife had Kung paolini vegetables.  Excellent flavor and presentation.  My wife ordered a side salad for $6 and it was huge. Plenty for both of us.  Dinner came with a large pot of brown rice.  We took the rest home and had for dinner that night.  Great value.  The decor was clean and nicely done.  The only thing I would change is the background music.  It seemed to be a radio station and took away from the ambiance.  Other than that a great experience.  We will come back.  Give them a trt

My fianc√©e and I came here as a celebration, got chocolate wantons as a gift. Amazing atmosphere! Beautiful menus and easy  to read. The staff so so friendly! Stephanie was amazing and very personable. We will be here again soon.

3.5  I'd been to their other Scottsdale location, and a friend and I grabbed lunch here yesterday afternoon. It was a little afternoon and it was not packed, but no one was at the host stand so a group of about 6 of us waited for someone to greet and seat us. After 2-3 minutes someone came out and seated us. Our server came by not too long after and took our drink order and came back with the wonton chips and we ordered a side of pork gyozas. The gyozas are super small, but it was enough to split between the two of us with everything else that comes with the lunch specials. I liked the salad that came out, though the dressing was a bit runny.   I decided on the southeast asian peanut chicken with brown rice, which I really liked. The thing of rice they bring out is giant and could easily be split between two. My friend had the katsu chicken and said it was good, though he prefers their teriyaki chicken. We ended with the chocolate wontons which were good, but they sound better than they tasted.  The thing I noticed about this location and the other is that the wait once your done with your meal the wait is painstakingly long. Maybe it's because I'm watching the clock because I have to get back to work, but it took a long time to get out once we were done eating.  Food is good. I'll be back to either location again.

I have been going to Flo's for more than 10 years and have always loved the food and value. The last few visits have been disappointing. Last night we did our traditional New Year's Eve take out and were disappointed again when the sweet and sour sauce for our sweet and sour chicken was missing and the sauce for our dumplings was also missing.  I had checked the order when I picked up but forgot to check for the sauces. Needless to say, dinner was not very good. We have had problems before with take out and at this point, I can't see us doing this again. There is no quality control in Flo's take out and when I spend more than $60 for dinner, I expect to get what I pay for. Flo, if you read this, add a quality control step to your take out process.

FLO... Please open a central Phoenix location!   I have to agree with Gabi.. I love this location.. the service is always good, the food always yummy.. This location is focused on Thai flavors more so then Chinese.   Today I came in for their lunch special.. not bad for $13.00 !   Started with the Pot Stickers... 6 little pan fried dumplings, savory and piping hot! These are one of the best in the valley I think! ($5.00)   For the main entree, I ordered the Lemon Grass chicken ($7.50) which is a smaller portion then dinner, served with rice and a fresh mixed green salad, peanut dressing. This dish is my favorite here... tender chicken slices, teamed with lots of mixed veggies, all kissed with lemon grass infused light brown sauce..YUM! You really can't go wrong here..   From what I understand from the attentive bartender is that Flos offers a happy hour Mon-Friday with half priced drinks and appetizers... and on Saturdays, they offer a $5.00 lunch special! Awesome! Check it out... if you like Thai... you'll love this Flos Location!

In town for business, came out to eat solo. I adore hot and sour soup, and this is about the best ever! BUT. Tell a solo diner that it is served in family portion!!  Food was SLOW. Does this make the feeling of satiety last longer perhaps?  Kung Pao chicken had decent flavor, but sadly not as spicy or overall as good as PF Chang. Good veggie component, though.

Delicious food. We ordered the shrimp and green beans and it was piping hot and super tasty. Their lunch portion is generous and food is not greasy at all! Service was spotty our waitress pretty much ignored us and looked cranky. I know this is almost expected at Chinese restaurants but why should that be okay? If they were friendlier and service was better I would give them 5 stars

By far the best Asian cuisine we've had. The food was authentic, our sever knowledgeable and attentive. The restaurant has a great vibe, nice atmosphere. We walked in unaware of it being part of their 3 hour happy hour so that was a nice  little bonus!
I used to love Flos. Someone should write to them directly about their price increase. So sad. They have good food & reasonable prices. Funny, the food doesn't taste as good as it once did.

Opting out from the noise and hustle of Flo's we called in a take-out order recently.  Arrived for pick-up as instructed in about 35 minutes.    As usual, the place was hopping when I arrived.  Transaction was completed quickly and I was out the door with my order.  All happy - until I got home and realized that my order was incomplete.  Rec'd only the appetizer & rice, but neither of the 2 main dishes I'd ordered.  Now I'm NOT happy.   Called to inform Flo's of the problem, talked to a "manager".  She was snippy and basically told me it was my fault for walking out with only 1 bag when they had 2 for the order.  Yes, and how was I supposed to know that??  I requested credit back to my credit card, more discussion, finally she says "I'm not going to argue with you" and hung up.  Huh, what has this conversation been then?  Several days later I found my credit card had been credited back.  Hurray, I won't have to dispute the charge with my credit card company.  Flo's - you screwed up and blamed it on me.  Your food isn't that great anyway and your attitude is worse.  Think about adding some customer service to your menu.  In the meantime I'll find another restaurant that actually wants my business.

No wifi?!?!?!? Shame.   25 min wait for takeout or dine in -- at 1:15 on a Sat?! They need more staff.  Food has gone down-hill here.  Very inconsistent.  Used to be a consistent winner but now we've had several mediocre to inedible dishes on multiple visits.

Pretty awful.  We were here years ago and now I remember why we had never returned.   The place was packed so obviously my opinion is in the minority.  The hot and sour soup was OK, but it should be mostly broth, lemongrass and a few items.  It was sloggy, stew-like with an almost mucous like consistency.   The egg rolls left a major oil slick on the table.  The lettuce wraps were just AWFUL.  Instead of finely chopped tasty ingredients this was some flavorless mystery mush.  Just awful.  The beef and chicken dishes were swimming in soy sauce, hence total salt taste.  No taste but salt.  Good thing I do not have high blood pressure.    I am only giving it 2 stars (the food was 1), as the servers were quite nice and helpful.  Wow, the lack of good ethnic places in this valley floors me.  When this can pass for Chinese there is something seriously wrong with the taste in Scottsdale.  I guess if you never ventured from some Midwest suburb (or Mars) then moved here, this kind of flavorless salty greasy food would be on par.  But anyone who has eaten at a big city Chinese place would never return.  (And we won't).

Recommended, but not a fan. Maybe dining in gives a better "experience" but food not worth the trip or price. I appreciate flavorful food and am a huge fan of Asian and Thai cuisine. Very disappointed with burnt pot stickers, over cooked Mongolian beef, nothing special egg fried rice and no flavor chicken low mein. Only good choice was brown rice.

So let's start with the the good stuff.  We went in for lunch on a Tuesday, we got greeted and sat down right away.  We decided what we wanted and ordered.  When the food got there it was pretty good.  I would go back for the food.  Now to what was not good.  Our service was not good. The guy who brought out our food was rather rude.  Our rice order was wrong, it wasn't a huge deal.  We ordered brown rice and got white rice.  I let the waitress know and she asked the guy who brought our food to get the brown rice.  Once again, he was really not friendly.  He gave us the impression he was pissed to have to be helping us at all. Our waitress was ok.  Just ok.  So since this was our first visit I will go back because I liked the food.  If the service isn't better there will not be a third time.

I could take their green curry sauce and eat it with just the brown rice and be a very happy camper. I might even be able to just eat it with a spoon and be perfectly content. Have gotten it twice and can't imagine getting anything else there. I also really enjoy the tea they serve...its green tea with brown rice infused, or something like that. So its a little nutty tasting, and very good! I tried the lemon pepper chicken once and didn't like it; it was very dry. Don't know if there was supposed to be sauce or something, but either way it was very tasteless. The dan dan noodles are good, too.

I could probably eat the green curry chicken every day and not get tired of it. I order the same thing ever time and it never disappoints. I have very nice friends who share their food with me, and can say that the dan dan noodles, tom yum soup, and twice baked pork are also delicious. I wasn't a fan of the lemon pepper chicken because there was no sauce. I also love that they give you hot green tea for free if you ask.

Made a quick stop after golf with a friend who recommended it.  Very nice interior and is a great happy hour spot.  We went at 2pm so no one really there, to be expected at that time.  Selection of Chinese and Thai dishes is excellent.  Unfortunately, there was no descriptions of the items.  I eat out a lot so knew what to expect but it's nice to see what it comes with as one restaurant to another makes the same dish differently.  I had spicy and crispy chicken.  It was a smaller portion but very tasty.  It was not spicy but a side of Siracha fixed that quickly.  I would g

good satay and nice service...the happy hour rocks....you get all sorts of stuff half off...good stuff too, your bill ends up being so cheap, we always get the shrimp skewers appetizers...next time im going to order 2 of those and have that as my dinner

Always busy. Expect to wait for a table. The food is very good. We always enjoy the broccoli beef and teriyaki chicken, and the wonton soup is a great choice. Lots of variety on the menu. Staff is good, but always rushed. You can't beat the price for this kind of restaurant. A fave of ours when too busy/lazy to cook.

Came in for a quick late night bite and was so warmly greeted by a tall blonde hostess. She genuinely made us feel welcomed, unlike normal hostesses that just ask "how many?" in a dull voice. As soon as we sat down, a server assistant (or a different server) poured us waters. Our server Forest quickly greeted us and made himself readily available for menu questions. Forest was sooo kind, polite and professional. He checked back with us often and was on his game our whole visit. As we were wrapping up, being the last people in the restaurant, a couple walked in 15 minutes before close (so annoying) and Forest didn't show one bit of hesitation or let his demeanor drop. We were so incredibly impressed by the staff and excellent food, as per usual. Thanks Forest and Staff for a great experience! See you soon!

Was over at Flo's this evening for happy hour/dinner. Being a new arrival to Arizona, Flo's is becoming my neighborhood bar/restaurant! My girlfriend and I arrived and ordered drinks and several appetizers from the menu. One dish was not exactly what we were expecting. Flo came by our table and personally asked what the problem was...she not only fixed the order to something more to our liking, but discounted other items that we had ordered.  Thanks, Flo...we will be back soon!!
Super delicious Chinese takeout. The eggplant melted in my mouth and the Thai cucumber salad was so fresh and flavorful. Please open an NELA outpost stat!

Always great!  I've been coming to Flos since she opened.  The ingredients are fresh and combinations amazing!  Of course I always ordered all the normal items, pot stickers, crab wontons, lettuce wraps but I'm personally obsessed with the king pao chicken!  The fresh jalape√±os make it for me!  My kiddos always order the fried rice and orange chicken which never disappoints.  I'd always recommend Flo's

Flo's is a very good restaurant.  The food is yummy and service was outstanding.  The bus person asked us many times if everything was alright and kept our water glasses full.  I asked for chicken with vegetables (not on the menu) and asked for more veggies and less chicken.  They made my dish perfect with lots of nice tender crisp veggies.  Nice place to catch a game as they have 3 tv screens over the bar.  Much healthier than bar food.  Happy hour lasts until 7:00 every evening with half price drinks and appetizers.

Went with my wife who told me how great it was when she went with her girlfriends earlier in the week. The place is nice and clean. The waiter was nice but we asked for the appetizers to come first and then our food. Well the appetizers took at least 15 minutes to come and one of them was wrong. Then the main dishes came out like one minute later so no time to enjoy. The waiter apologized and also said sorry about the wrong dish but never took it off the bill. The food was pretty bland which is another reason for 3 stars.  The portions were good sized but a little pricey. The east valley has some really authentic Asian places that I would rather go to

Was looking for a place for Asian cuisine. My sister recommend Flo's as she raved about it!  I ordered the Cantonese Style Pork and was disappointed as the dish really had no flavor and was bland.  My sister ordered the eggplant with garlic sauce which was amazing!  As for a food rating I would give 3 stars.  As for overall experience and wait staff rating I would give a 2.  The staff was definitely attentive, however, when bringing a stack of 6  dishes to the table for our party to use, instead of using 2 hands which would have been a better choice, the waiter chose to use 1 hand and placed the stack of dishes on the table with his 1 hand wrapped around the plates and his thumb smack in the middle of the top plate.  First off, probably a health violation, not certain, but definitely would think twice about eating there again.  Second you would think someone who was waiting on tables for a living would know better.  The next thing was twice we were brought a dirty dish and utensils that were not entirely clean.   Really wish I had a better experience as I was looking forward to trying a new place.

This place has some pretty tasty lunch specials... pick a meal and get salad, cinnamony won-ton chips and rice for $7 (plus drink and tip).  The veggie stir-fyr is really yummy.  It can get pretty crowded around lunchtime so go early, but the service is fast, so once you are seated you won't need to wait long for your food.

I have eaten here before on several occasions, but its been a while since I dined in at Flos.  I like it here, though its typical chinese food.  Lovely menu, cool decor, service was okay.  I would come here again.  I split a dish with a friend was hanging out with.  Sweet and Sour chicken was good, and my friends lo mein noodles were exceptionally tasty!!!  yummy.  Great place for first dates, places to take parents while they are visiting here, or just a nicer dinner out then the usual. :-)

I love Asian food so I love this place! They have a big menu to chose from! I have been here 6 times and have gotten different dishes each time and it never disappoints! There has been a few times that I have visited during HH, they really have an awesome HH. Happy hour offers Half off all appetizers,  that are flavorful and just the right amount. I always leave with leftovers. Service is really great too  :)

I Will always rate flos 5 stars ....we are regulars and love the place,great food and great staff,but what's up with the country music?It is the most non sense thing ever, a restaurant play list should reflect the concept... since when country music fits in with a contemporary Asian restaurant ??? Weird....

We were recommended to go to this place because it was good we are in the area and we looked at yelp we were close. Would recommend what were the favorite and it was absolutely Wonderful. This past week for sure will be coming back soon. They also said happy hour from 3-7 everyday.
I think this place put MSG on their food. After dining in last Saturday I got severely dehydrated and was experiencing headache and shortness of breath.

Flo's is tired.  The same restaurant that was jammed with diners nightly five years or so ago is now only fairly busy.  The food is almost the same as it was then, but the world has changed, and diners now expect more innovative and tasty fare.  This is not to say that Flo's is bad, and judged against the universe of Chinese neighborhood restaurants, it probably would rate four stars, but I can't bring myself to judge Flo's that way - to me it aspires to be a top-of-the-line eatery and it just isn't.    Both the dishes we ordered were fine - pepper shrimp and sweet and sour chicken - but not great.  The portions were more than adequate and the ingredients were better than average (larger shrimp, good white meat chicken).  But the flavors were yesterday, the service was maybe a bit too casual, and the restaurant was far too loud, especially when the bar was full of people.  I enjoyed my meal, but only a little more than Panda Express.  Not good enough for that fourth star.  Flo's: down an energy drink and get some new life, or perhaps it's just time to retire.

I seriously love this place. I'm a fan of spicy and they are capable of making the food spicy and flavorful. The thai soup is amazing, the salads are great too. It can be a little pricey for some people but it is very worth it. Beautiful restaurant, beautiful food, great staff. I used to go to the Tempe one and now I moved and there's a flos close by and I couldn't be happier about that!

Flo's is a really authentic chinese resturant, they do have other cuisines such as vietnamese and thai, but stick to the Hong Kong Chinese Food.  I have not had anything I did not like here, as a chinese food veteran I am happy to have found this place! I constantly miss the LA 626 chinese food, the struggle is real.. trust me. Their prices for lunch are decent, my coworker and I tend to lean toward coming here every time we can't decide where to go.    What to eat:  Beef basil fried rice  Hainan Chicken, extra ginger sauce please!  Fried seafood noodle  Egg Foo Young (cooked soft)

Great happy hour with half price drinks. Interesting and unique drink menu. Awesome Bloody Mary. Nice little wonton chips for free at the bar. Salt and pepper chicken wings take a little while but are worth the wait. Will be back!

I've been to the other Flo's restaurants in Scottsdale and I have always had a great dining experience so I was happy to discover a Flo's on the south side of town. Since it was part of the other restaurants, I expected the same level of quality service and food at this location but was really surprised.  Oh gosh, the experience was way off...  REVIEW OF SERVICE:  The waiter must have been new because his explanation of some of the dishes wasn't really helpful.  Additionally, we were in mid-bite when he came over, said it looked like we were wrapping up, and asked if we wanted the check. what.the.fuck. The restaurant was only 15% full, you need to make room for imaginary customers?  Also, usually at Flo's the salad comes out really quick but for some reason today, the salad took quite a while and it was thrown onto the plate so half-assed, it was spilling onto the table when they served it.   Also when the food was delivered, the waitress practically whispered the name of the dish while trying to move it to the table. We had to ask her what dish it was so we could direct her on where to put it.   The restaurant had a lot of employees but the quality of the service was just lacking. Sad really because I brought two friends who hadn't ever been to a Flo's and I'm not sure if they'll try any of the other locations after having such a bad experience.   REVIEW OF THE FOOD:   The pot stickers were steamed and fried like they were supposed to be but they were pretty doughy and the sauce they gave us was really shallow so we had to move the dumpling around in the sauce dish to get some flavor on the dumpling...  Imagine trying to take a bath in 4 inches of water in your tub-  yeah, it was like that.   The eggplant dish was poorly cooked.  One bite into the eggplant and the whole veggie would explode with water. The water completely diluted the flavor which made it feel like we were eating a sponge.  The curry chicken was decent but didn't have much sauce which is funny because to cook that dish, one would need quite a bit of sauce because the chicken, green beans and basil leaves were all evenly coated with sauce but the presentation of it was like a semi-dry curry dish.  Hardly any sauce at all.  SUMMARY:  I can't come back to this location. The other locations are great but this one just seemed like a waste of money.
Good food and excellent service.  If you order the hot and sour soup there is enough and more to share with 4 people.

Very delicious food. 40 minute wait though.  Since it's only been open a short time hopefully the fad will fade away and have more reasonable wait times,  We ordered the spicy and crisp chicken.  Could certainly have been more spicy but it was tasty.  Prices are on the high end for Asian food.

Great Asian place, eclectic menu of Chinese, Vietnamese, Thai and Japanese. Fair pricing. Excellent service. Love the beef and onion dish.  Could be the best Asian place in town IMHO for the overall package..

Sept 2017 edited to add - Unfortunately Flo's menu has had a drastic change. They removed a lot of the options. I was so disappointed to see that the Singapore chicken satay is no longer available. Not sure we'll be back due to the menu change. It's basically Pei Wei now.   Oh wow!  I hope that tonight wasn't a fluke because our first dinner at Flo's was fantastic!  Be sure you take advantage of the happy hour specials, half off appetizers!  We thought about making our entire meal out of appetizers but decided to get one entree as well.   We ordered Chinese lettuce cups, Singapore chicken satay, shu Mai dumplings and black pepper chicken. Everything was delicious!  The portion sizes were generous. My favorites were the Singapore chicken satay and the lettuce cups.  The ingredients were really fresh, the veggies crisp and beautiful...... Couldn't have asked for a better meal.   Lately we've noticed that a lot of the Asian places we have been eating at have overly salty and sometimes goopy sauces. We were so happy to find a place that reminded us that Asian food shouldn't be so salty and sauce heavy. What a nice change!    We definitely could have ordered a couple more appetizers and not ordered the main entree. We will probably go that route next time if we are there for happy hour. I will also order one of the huge bowls of soup that I immediately regretted not ordering when I saw it brought out to a nearby table.  Service was great, restaurant clean and nice environment. We will definitely be going back sooner rather than later. This place is awesome. I might have to go back for the soup this week!

Will never go back. Food was not very good. They didn't get my order correct either. The shrimp wontons were so bad they were just thrown away. The beef.. Greasy and tasted disgusting. Gave it a two star cuz I had the tai seafood soup .. Was great .. But mostly broth. We will not be coming back

Not terrible, but many other better choices in the Valley for American Chinese food.  The soups did not have enough substance (i.e., mostly broth) and three of our four mains tasted the same.  The only standout was the twice cooked pork, which I asked to be extra spicy (and it was).
Where is the 10 star button.?  I love this ace,  great service,  clean and the food will blow your mind. It's a must visit. You will not regret it.

I have been told by many that Flo's is the PLACE to go for GREAT Chinese food...  Unless we went to the wrong Flo's, this place was not impressive at all.  After waiting ten minutes before a food server actually acknowledged us, we were almost ready to get up and leave. It was a young gal who had no clue about anything on the menu...was this the food server or a random customer wandering the restaurant, I wonder?   The soup was good, but not memorable enough for me to come back for more...  The portions? Um, what portions? They were so small...did we order from the kid's menu by mistake? Geez!  Small portions, poor service, ok food...we definitely WON'T be back!

Great Happy Hour! Half off drinks and almost all appetizers. Our waiter was attentive and even Flo came by to see how we were doing. The atmosphere was great- not super quiet but not very loud either, it definitely had a good happy hour vibe. The food came out relatively fast, except the wings which take about 20mins so order those first. We tried about half of the appetizers on the menu. The crispy springs rolls were great, not too oily and still hot and crisp when we got them. The lettuce cups are a good summer snack, since the lettuce is cool but you still get the warm and fullness from the filling. The chocolate wontons were amazing, just a light dessert to finish of a great meal. Got the Mandarin Orange cocktail which was really good too, I like the sugar rim which contrasted well with the slight tartness of the drink. Definitely going to come back and try some more of the menu as well as the happy hour.

Tried there shrimp kabobs with peanut sauce and was pleasantly surprised, they are juicy and tasty critters!!! The Chicken pot-stickers are homemade and are the bomb with the zesty dipping sauce!!!! Flo you rock the House !!!

Love this food, staff, and location!  Jeni always greets me with a beautiful smile and gives excellent service for all my to-go orders!  My favorite dish is the Kung Pao Shrimp but everything I've ordered is really good!
Not feeling Flo's at all, the staff was nice but the place is way too loud and the food isn't as good as the lunch time prices.

The lunch and dinner menu here is fabulous. The food is always so good and fresh! Service is professional and attentive. Been here several times and have always left feeling full and satisfied. I always enjoy the Katsu Chicken on the dinner menu. The only downside in my opinion is the dining area is a bit loud. It can be hard to have a conversation. If you sit at the bar it's nicer and easier to converse.

After going to Flo's loyally for so long they go and change the prices on their happy hour menu. The main reason for going to this spot was the great deals during Happy hour. Our bill doubled for the exact order and the staff didn't seem to care. I showed my bill for the exact same order a few weeks earlier and the amount was $2 shy of being doubled. On to better places now.

Well lets see. I live in the far SW valley and Flo's Asian Kitchen is in the far NE valley. Everytime we go it cost us at least an extra $40 just in gas to get here, however it is well worth it. Been here at least 4 times, the last time we were in, they did not have the wonderful spring rolls. I hope its just a seasonal thing. The lettuce wraps are the best in the valley. I have tried a few other Flo's restaurant, and this one is the best. Very un-Scottsdale atmosphere. Big open room. Tables are some what close to each other, however the few times we have been there it has never been packed. They have the menu layed out by region. Very easy to understand. Their beer/wine list is limited,but what they do have is pretty good. Last time we were in they were featuring Mondavi.
Great place but an even better happy hour! We love it here all there apps are 5% off and you can get amazing food for super cheap! Worth the money
Thai soup was good (although the chicken was weird and the shrimp looked a little funny).  Dan Dan noodles and mu shu chicken were just OK.  Usually Flo's is better.

This place gets 3 stars and that's a stretch.   I have heard nothing but raving reviews about this place. The food was good, but nothing to write home about.   The problem here was the service. Our server took forever to do anything for us. We were finished eating for at least 20 minutes before he offered to bring out check and 10 minutes to even get the check after he offered.   Service is a big part of dining. Food was good, but would not come back here simply for the bad service.

We stop at Flo's about every other week and have never been disappointed. Service is always prompt especially when we have Pablo as our server. The happy hour specials are a real bargain and there is a wide variety of appetizers to chose from.  I am amazed to see some negative reviews here as our experience at Flo's has always been great.

I've been here on multiple occasions and the service has been great. Our waiter was friendly. We were offered water which was nice.   The food is good and flavorful. The skewers are my favorite along with the lettuce wraps. If you are looking for something that is tasty and easy Flo's is the way to go.

This place used to be a nice option....now, not so much. It's kinda turned into a mix of geriatric retirees and man-bun sporting pretentious hipsters serving bland, overpriced quasi-Chinese. Whoever the bald guy is....maybe a manager or shift supervisor....whatever, has been unnecessarily rude to my girlfriend and myself on several occasions, even though we are polite and always tip well. The taste of the food seems to be in constant decline and they are starting to take their clientele for granted. People of Flo's please "get over yourselves," because we already have and will not be returning nor recommending.

One of the best Asian restaurants in Tempe!! Food is tasty, menu is limited for Veggies but who cares when you are pure Non-Vegitarian :P Loved the ambience and service was really good. Sure will come back and suggest my friends :)

ALWAYS enjoy this place even before it moved but... the noise is unbearable sometimes. can't even carry on a close conversation and it's definately NOT an intimate setting but.. the hot and sour soup... GREAT and the food has always been terrific. Pretty fast service and the prices pretty fair. Again, I'd give it 43 stars except for the noise. Better than their other locations too.

Too much inconsistency, standards have fallen hard and be very careful if you have a seafood allergy don't assume because you asked them to exclude the shrimp they do or or check it before leaving the kitchen.  Used to be regulars here for years, but we have literally given up on this branch and happily use their Thompson Peak / Frank Floyd Wright one which Flo herself runs really well.    This location at The Promenade sometimes gets it right and the next time messes the same dish up.  For example their base chicken soup / sizzling rice soup or won ton soup may or may not have any seasoning in it and who ever oversee s the kitchen obviously didn't bother tasting it to find out.  This has happen need at least 6 times to us.    Instead of using standard recipes and testing the finished product the same dish can taste totally different on the next visit, and that includes the consistency of the sauce which goes from watery with color to thick and able to coat as it should.  The ironic thing is the Thompson Peak one serves it the same way each time, surely the same owner (Flo) should be ensuring there are recipe cards for each dish and that someone is responsible for testing and tasting what they make.  What bothers me is having sent a dish back asking for some sauce to be provided instead of just using it to coat the food (I have eaten it there literally hundreds of times) I was told ''the expediter says that is how that dish is served' and he sent the dish back to me unchanged!  Interesting that the other restaurant serves it with plenty of sauce every time.    Do yourself a favor, drive the extra 3 miles to the other one and enjoy.....

This is one of our go to restaurants.  Their food is tasty, consistent and good value.  They make the best chicken wings we've ever had, plump, juicy and coated lightly in something that makes them extra tasty, they the. Add some salt (not too much despite the salt and pepper name) and some green onions, bell peppers and not too much chilies which don't blow your mouth away.  They can take 10 mins from ordering, but trust me, they are well worth the wait. We usually also order the spring rolls (2 to a portion) and if we are having only apps for our meal, we will order their potstickers too along side their sizzling rice soup which is also great.  I mentioned the apps because up to 7 pm from I think 5 pm they serve most of the apps are half price for their happy hour, which is great value and they will serve that at the table, not just the bar.  They do something I really appreciate, if you like a dish but would prefer it with chicken instead of shrimp, or with their wonderfully, how do they do it, tender beef pieces.  I also like that they assured me that they don't use MSG in their food (unfortunately I am really allergic), so it takes the stress of of having to study the extensive menu carefully.  If you do get to the entrees, we typically go for the chicken chow fun (wide noodles), honey beef, spicy beef and onions, Thai green curry, cashew chicken, Thai basil chicken and the lemon chicken.  However none of the dishes we've had have disappointed.  Enjoy......

While having a few valley locations, I have to admit that I always feel like this place is local eatery. I'm not a big fan of the chain places however this location has made the list of "family go to spots" as they have something that accommodates our family's wide variety of taste.  Flo's sits near the intersection of Rural & Baseline. Lot's of options in the area so it's busy with wandering drivers. We did a pickup previously during the eventing and parking was challenging, but realized they didn't have a designated Takeout Parks up front.   Comfortable atmosphere with a full bar along with multiple televisions just in case you want to check out a game. We ordered the seafood noodle soup, several potstickers which by the way I enjoy the fact that they make chicken potstickers and not just pork.  We also picked up some orange chicken and peking duck and quite a few cocktails to help with the edge of the holidays.  It wasn't a pack night but it was great to have our server and staff very attentive throughout the course of our meal.  All of the food was solidly good and honestly came out tasting as  expected.

Easily the worst service I've had. First and last time here. Bowls and spoons have food all over them as well. Server forgot to put our order in, food runner ran chips out and spilled them all over the table without saying a word about it or trying to clean it.  Update- Went there for lunch yesterday. Everything was clean, service was good and the food runner didn't spill chips all over. The cleanliness of the restaurant was great.
Been eating here since they've opened. Best hot & sour soup in town.IMO.

Love Flo's! This is a great casual restaurant. It's Asian Fusion - my favs been the appetizers, curry dishes and the pad Thai. They also have a ridiculous happy hour. Half off of all appetizers (except edamame) and half off anything from the bar.   My husband and I just went and we had 2 cocktails (a-flo-ha) and 2 beers, with 4 appetizers: wings (which were really good, crispy and not greasy), lettuce wraps (fresh crunchy lettuce), edamame and spring rolls. All of it was half off on happy hour and cost is only $29! Definitely our new happy hour spot!

I was so excited that there is a Flo's in Tempe!  The selection, service, and food are amazing.  I try and go once a week to get dinner or lunch.  This is the best Chinese I've had in the area.  My favorites were Garlic Chicken, Orange Chicken, and Mongolian Beef.
