I just wish you could order a cup of soup with dinner, but they are generous with portion sizes and offering to bring more rice free of charge.  On Friday and Saturday nights, I would recommend getting there either before 5:30, or after 8:00 if possible, it gets busy and wait times can be long.

I love this place. I dream about their beef. I have no idea what they do to their beef, but it is so soft and tender... Try their beef fried rice, beef egg fu yung, and beef moo shu! In non-beef related items, there is a great Katsu Chicken Salad. And speaking of salads, order a salad (or if you go at lunch, a side salad will come with your meal)!  Their salad dressing is so good you will want to drink it like a soda.  Me:  Can I have a refill? Server:  "Ma'am, there are no free refills on dressing... Dressing is not a beverage..." Me: "num num num...yes it is...."  One thing I have had there that I don't like too much is the Pad Thai.  I think there's too much fusion going on in that dish and it has lost the authentic taste that I expect from it.  Other than that I really love this place!

Not the most memorable experience. Service was not good at all and I noticed the female waitresses were mostly in tank tops. Not an issue at Hooters or Tilted Kilt, but not something we enjoyed in this place.  Our waitress was fairly absent, and when the bus staff refilled our water it felt as though we were scum of the earth for making them refill the glass.  Food was OK. Our appetizers were awful, the pork buns were extremely dry on the inside and my wife thought the crab puffs were salty.  The entrees, however made up for it. I got the Yu Xiang stir fry and it was quite delicious, and my wife's sweet and sour chicken was also good.  The prices were manageable, but some of the appetizers seemed expensive for the size.  All in all, not the best experience. We will probably try again, but we couldn't help but feel we would have been way better off just going up to PF Changs.

Made a reservation for 14 on a busy Friday night and our table was available when we arrived a few minutes early. Wonderful menu selection. The salt and pepper chicken wings may be the best fried chicken I've ever had. If I have the opportunity to come back, I may order it as my entree. Very, very good. Everyone in our party was happy with his or her entree choice. The only suggestion I have for improvement is service. It was a bit slow, but I realize a party of 14 is  never an easy assignment. I hear happy hour at Flo's is unbelievable. And if I could get those wings half price, I would eat dinner early every night when I'm visiting Scottsdale.

Excellent happy hour! Prices can't be beat.   The food is so fresh, hot and tasty! Service was timely and friendly. Asian Fusion isn't typically my go-to, but there are so many options we'll be back more frequently than I'd expect.

I'm downgrading my previous review (5 years ago) from 5 stars to 2 stars for 2 reasons:  1) They've discontinued their special Saturday lunchtime pricing as yesterday we were charged full menu price for a takeout order.  2) They got my order wrong Saturday and apparently it's not a high priority to respond.  I ordered the Indian Vindaloo Chicken (what I always order) and they gave me a spicy chicken dish with broccoli and carrots instead.  It was a takeout order that my wife picked up.  Not worth trying to return it to the restaurant, but trying to contact them turned out to be fruitless.  I likely won't return as a customer.
An excellent restaurant.  The food is very good and a good value.  The service is always excellent.   My wife and I eat here regularly, but prefer their restaurant at Scottsdale Road and FLW.

Flo's is our favorites. Great service....great management The management at Flo's Scottsdale Promenade is outstanding. The restaurant is always very clean, as are the restrooms. The staff do not let dirty plates accumulate  on the table. The water glasses are constantly being topped off, and they gladly bring lemon slices. We discovered Flo's about a year ago, and are "regulars" now. (We are Arizona residents, and never head north to escape the heat like so many do) We love it here, and Flo's is a real "find". One of our favorite dishes is Pho, either chicken or beef. The very best Pho we have ever had, bar none! The Egg Foo Young is awesome, as is the Salmon and Broccoli. They even will prepare your dish in Sesame oil if requested. Try Flo's, ask for Ryan or Donney. Great service!

I always start off with the words "Yelp brought me here" followed by what I've read and I always find I get great service and in this case the server added a complimentary desert. Either way this place has awesome food, a full bar and a very friendly staff. Oh and get this... They have HAPPY HOUR EVERYDAY between 3-7 yes you heard it here first including weekends which would make it "Happier Hour". I had a local IPA from the good people at San Tan brewery in chandler called the Hop Scotch IPA and I always order the pad Thai dish when trying a new place and it did not disappoint. If you're in the area stop in trust me!

Seriously, this is one of the best Asian restaurants in the entire valley. Amazing service, quality, and portions at a very reasonable price. I have heard their happy hour is unbeatable too. I just moved to the hood and plan to make Flo's a regular stop. I also heard the owner is PF Chang's (Paul Flemming's) ex???

This place turned to crap.  I remember when it first opened I loved this place.  I thought it was the best Chinese Food in town.  Flo took so much pride into her recipes.  I am not sure what went wrong.  I can't speak for all the servers there, but ours was terrible.  No personality just a freaking robot.  She came up to the table to greet us by saying "Are you ready to order"  How about some drinks lady?  I can get by with horrible service if the food is good, but the food was lousy.  We ordered chicken lettuce cups, 2 different types of soup and 2 entrees.  They tried to bring the soup out first but I asked them if we could get our app first.  The chicken that came with the lettuce cups was just the fatty pieces of the chicken they don't used with the entree, but all minced up.  The texture was gross and the flavor was bland.  The soups were the only reason this review got 2 stars.  Pretty good.  Wife had wonton soup and I had seafood shelfish soup.    The entrees sucked.  We shared Crispy Spicy Chicken which was more like Soggy Salty Chicken and the Orange Beef which was decent but soggy which made it not as good.  The server never came by again therefore I went the whole meal without anything to drink.  For sure we will not be coming back anytime soon.  I am not sure why this place stays busy, it's not worth my time.  If I wasn't so hungry, I would have returned the entrees and app.

i hate to do drop this down to 1 star, but i just have to. I took my parents and grandparents here for a special dinner, and everyone loved the food... until we saw a roach climbing the wall behind us while waiting for our bill. It completely overshadowed what would have been a great evening. We ended up waiting for our bill at the front of the restaurant, and i discreetly let the server know what the issue was was. They were super apologetic, but that only goes so far. Honestly, I won't be back. Luckily, there's another location near by that i've also been to that has just as good food. (note: menu's are not the same between locations. Which i find odd, but interesting.)
my go to Chinese food place!!! so fresh and good prices too! the staff are always friendly and professional! in my opinion its the best chinese food in tempe!!

I visit Flo's about 50 times a year with friends for the past several years.  Never ever has there been anything wrong with any of our dishes.  All super great and super fresh and tasty. Excellent happy hour and specials.  Great service and always 5 star.  I take my out of towners to Flo's and they rave about it and can't wait to come back.  Boy anybody that rates this place below a 5 Star is all wet in our dry state.  Thank you, Flo's!

I used to eat at the one in NoSco before having gluten issues. And having seen on the menu several gluten free items, was happy to give the Tempe location a try on a recent visit. I ordered the Lemon Chicken entree. I had water to drink as they didn't serve alcohol and I am not a huge tea or soda drinker. My friend got the wonton appetizers, he enjoyed them. I refrained (the gluten thing). The chicken dish was good but a bit bland, so I asked the server if they had gluten free soy sauce. He went in back and came back several minutes later with some soy sauce in a regular soy sauce container, and said "oh I just put it in a regular container because we don't have any GF containers". My instinct told me not to try it but my tastebuds won out. Within an hour, I was regretting my decision. I was bloated and all the rest of the fun stuff that comes with being "glutened." The next day I contacted the restaurant to give the manager on duty the scoop because I felt that he could use the opportunity to better educate the staff on food restrictions that people face. If a restaurant goes out of their way to state on their menu that certain dishes are gluten free, they need to take that seriously - because people with dietary restrictions have no choice but to take it seriously. Being glutened is no fun. It very well may have been a simple honest mistake or miscommunication between staff so I won't hold it against them. Anyway, I declined the manager's [Devon] very kind offer for a free meal upon a return because that was not the point of my call. Devon took my critique in stride, was very professional and stated he would definitely talk to the staff. I will definitely give them a second chance since the Manager was so understanding.

FLO'S IS THE S#*%!  I've only been here twice coming from Omaha, NE visiting family, but it's been amazing both times. Highly recommend happy hour 1/2 price drinks and App's 3-7 - the lettuce cups and salt and pepper (vegetable pepper) wings are amazing. Stephanie has been amazing both times!
The food here is pretty good and I go every once in a while when I am in Scottsdale and wanting Thai food. I liked the chicken pad Thai quite a bit.

I am sorry folks don't enjoy Flo's as much as I do.  I have been a regular patron for years.  Happy hour is absolutely the best deal in town, with half off all drinks and apps in both bar and restaurant, 7 days a week from 4 to 7 pm.  Meals are creative preparations of traditional Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, Korean and Szechuan dishes.  The lunch special for $6 on Saturdays including salad is a steal!  Red curry is non traditional in a thick sauce,  not a bowl of coconut milk. Hot and sour soup is best requested with pork instead of menu method chicken, for richer flavor.  Get the spicy Lao style lettuce cups with lemongrass and fish sauce, you will eat some jalapenos and not be disappointed!

Went here for lunch. Wasn't many patrons there. Service was attentive. Food came out fairly quick. I enjoyed the lunch specials and discount pricing. Food quality and taste was decent. I would say above average. Good experience overall

Not impressed with this restaurant at all. Their menu is small, their iced tea was disgusting, and their chicken fried rice was horribly bland. I didn't even order anything because nothing appealed to me on their menu. My husband did enjoy his meal, chicken lo mein, I think it was, so that's why I didn't give it only 1 star. For the amount we paid, we could've gone to a hole in the wall take out Chinese place and gotten 3 times the amount of food with a lot more flavor, and a lot more of a selection. The atmosphere is very nice.

The greatest unknown place in Tempe. Amazing happy hour specials - which helped contribute to me becoming a regular here. They have tasty takes on Chinese cuisine and the ambience inside or outside feels right. If I had a magic wand, I'd probably spice up the servers to be a little more proactive and perhaps even transition into a sophisticated lounge atmosphere for evenings.

I went here for the third time the other night and am finally getting around to reviewing it since it has been a while since I last went. (Flo's was the head to destination for food after landing at Sky Harbor when visiting my boyfriend before moving here back in August.)  My experience with the menu is not that adventurous I will admit. I've stuck with some staples and they have been consistent over the times I've visited. Dinner usually starts with the Garden Green Salad which is fresh tasting with a nice dressing. The menu states a miso dressing but I taste some peanut sauce in it? Regardless... GOOD. I vow to try and replicate it someday. Next staple? The Vietnamese Spring Rolls. Chicken and potato? I know... but they're delicious and one order is never enough it seems. This last time we tried the potstickers. Decent... not the best I've had. They are a little on the chewy side and not quite as crispy as I tend to like them. The flavor lacked a bit too. Dinner consists of the Peanut Chicken which isn't exactly as spicy as I would like it but still pretty good.  I wouldn't say Flo's is the best I've ever had but it's NOT bad in my book. The modern and clean decor makes the atmosphere a nice alternative to little Asian dives I've been to in the past. Service has always been good in my experience.

We came here for lunch one day when we had an appointment in the neighborhood. We hadn't been to a Flo's for quite some time. Unfortunately, we were a bit pressed for time, but we were able to mostly walk in and be seated -- that was a plus.   The decor in the main area is nothing special. To me, it feels like an old diner. I think the bar area has a little more modern feel.  We were given water quickly and someone arrived to take our order shortly thereafter.   The lunch menus don't have descriptions next to the dishes, so if you don't know whether a dish comes with veggies, or what a certain sauce is, you have to ask. I don't know if the dinner menu is the same, but, as someone who likes to read menus, that is a little odd to me. I decided on the spicy cinnamon shrimp, which I had to order because it sounded interesting (even if the only thing I knew about it were those three words). I didn't find it particularly "spicy," but the cinnamon sauce was nice and the shrimp were cooked well -- battered and fried in this case. The portion size was about right: I ate most of it and didn't feel stuffed when leaving the place.   Overall, the service and food were good and the waiter even got us our check quickly when we asked because we were running short on time.

Have heard about this place for years and finally went.  Made reservations, but still had to wait 30 minutes, but they did extend Happy Hour prices for us since we had to wait.  Food was good, service very friendly, but it was very noisy.  Once Happy Hour ended at 7pm, it quieted down.  They appear to be extremely busy during the happy hour.  Will definitely go again, but may just get take out.

We stopped in to Flo's weekly for many years...specifically for the Happy Hour Menu at the bar. The food selection was ALWAYS great, prices were great, and the girl working at the bar was fast/efficient/intelligent. OMG, were we in for a surprise after not being into Flo's for the past few months while we were out of state! The Happy Hour food menu has been reduced to only a few mediocre selections, with all the great selections NO LONGER AVAILABLE ie: Calamari. The Pot Stickers which are down to ONE selection now...are the same price as always, just HALF THE PORTION!!! The other "regulars" at the bar were also voicing their disapproval of the "downsizing" of selection and quantity as well. The poor bartender/server was most apologetic for the changes and shortcomings. These changes are not confined to the bar menu...they are specific to the regular menu as well. Lo and behold...the back story is that Flo's is in big financial trouble ie: August 2017, filed for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy.  We will not even consider returning to this little restaurant...There are too many other wonderful Asian Fusion/Thai restaurants that are financially stable and serve AWESOME food!

Customer service is subpar to the quality of the food here . I've ordered the lettuce wraps twice  for take out and twice they've forgotten my lettuce. If the food wasn't so good I wouldn't be so concerned but its delicious . After calling the manager about the second forgotten lettuce incident I then got a personal phone call from Flo . She was extremely personable and understanding and helped me out a lot . It really shows how much you care about your customers.

I've dined at Flo's many times and pick up food to bring home often.  Everything is spot-on delicious. Pictured here are the Crab Puffs which have just the right balance of cream cheese & crab filling to crispy crunch. Also pictured, is the Cashew Chicken which has vibrant al dente veggies, tender, large chicken slices, and fresh cashews.  One of my favorite dishes is the Broccoli Beef.  The Fried Rice is wonderful with tender and fresh meat, peas and carrots. All of their food is fine restaurant-quality, never that of "take out Chinese."  Dining in has always been pleasant, even when they are packed. The decor is modern chic, and the lighting is subdued for a relaxing dinner experience. The service is outstanding. The attractive and efficient wait staff refill beverages before they are empty, serve the delicious egg drop soup into your bowl, and are pros at their job.   They, and even the manager, are very attentive and gracious, checking to make sure that you are happy with everything.

I'm giving this five fat stars because I'd get fat if I still lived in Arizona and was subjected to the close proximity of this restaurant to my apartment.  And job.    I can't remember other things on the menu, other than the Pad Thai.  I'm not sure if Pad Thai is Thai (makes sense that it would be), but I see it at non-fusion Chinese restaurants, often.  Anyway, I don't care about authenticity when something is this spectacularly good.  I am very afraid of flying.  I had to fly back and forth from Phoenix to Burbank (Los Angeles area) once per month for work.  I needed comfort when I stepped off the plane, regardless of if it had only been a one hour and five minute flight.  I'd make a beeline here after getting back to Arizona.  Yummy Pad Thai.  I miss you so much.  You were my friend and comfort against the horrors and fears of the scorpion enemies.    Wide, flat (but short) noodles.. slightly curled..  chicken, egg, sprouts, and other good-tasting things.    I would usually get my order to-go, but the seating area seems cool, too.  Service was also great..  to-go order always ready to go..  price was right.  You know that feeling you get in the deepest parts of your gums and jaw..  that tingling thing that begins the process of salivation?  It's happening now.  They're heeeeeere!
Awesome food.  Are used to come here a lot seven or eight years ago and loved it back then.
Waitress wrote down wrong order. And was very rude when we asked for the correct item.

Once again we are at our favorite restaurant. Flo's at the Scottsdale Promonade. The crowd is large and everyone has a smile! Delicious choice of entrees for every taste! Today we are having Flo's Famous Pho with fresh chicken breast, and Teriyaki chicken. A nice salad comes with lunch too!! Jeannie is the manager, and everyone does a great job!! Mike and Jan Phoenix

We came here to try the half priced appetizers. The items seated were very good and the portions very adequate. We most likely will return for the full dinner selections. Service was excellent and features t very clean.

First off I'm a well Hung Chinese chef   Meh..  Are used to go to the original location in north Scottsdale about a decade ago and it was fantastic.  We tried a few different items here and they were all very bland and I can honestly say you're much better off just going to panda express. It is literally about that quality. Perhaps a bit lower now.  We ordered for items and two of them had to be sent back. The two we kept were average at best.  Definitely will not be back.

My first time to Flo's, I needed take out, I craved curry, but saw the Asian Peanut Chicken on the menu and knew I had to have it.  I called in,  first thing,  the guy taking my order didn't rush me.   Second,  their chicken isn't breaded,  yeah!  Third, I wanted extra veggies and he was kind enough to read me off the selections.   I got exactly what I wanted,  on time.  I ended up splitting it with my two kids. They were way more interested in my dinner then pizza.  I split the rice and dinner between 3 of us and we are stuffed.   The veggies were perfectly done,  still crisp, the sauce was full of flavor and the chicken was the right size and tender!   I will definitely be trying other amazing things!

We had a wonderful dinner-food was very good. But my review is centered around our server. His name is Forest and he was wonderful. He was courteous and respectful. What I mean by that is he allowed us time to drink our drinks and eat our appetizers and talk-he did not rush us to move on to placing our order for dinner. We don't always get that kind of service-people seem to want to rush you thru your dinner and turn over the table. Thanks to Forest we enjoyed our wonderful dinner at Flos and enjoyed the company we were with that night.

Although most of the food here is excellent, I come here for one reason and one reason alone... Hot and sour soup. I have been eating this soup for 10 years, literally the best soup I have ever had in my life. "hot" without being too spicy, the perfect amount of meat and tofu, the mushrooms in it are also amazing... the smell alone will clear your sinuses and cure you of your common cold. It's pure magic. Do yourself a favor, If you happen to visit Flo's GET THE SOUP. You're welcome.

I had heard good things about this place and had it on my list to try. After some shopping at Scottsdale quarter, we ventured up here to grab dinner. It was around 6:45pm during the week and we didn't have to wait for a table for 2. Score!  We were promptly given water, and then our waiter greeted us and said he would be right with us as the place was pretty busy. I don't mind a little slowness when it's crowded, as long as you give some acknowledgement, so I thank our waiter for being courteous!   We started with the crab puffs, which were very crisp and tasty. Probably would rank it as one of my favorites when it comes to crab rangoon/puffs. We ordered the crispy honey beef and Mongolian beef. The crispy honey beef is exactly how you would imagine.. crispy beef with some sort of honey sauce. A good mix of sweet and tangy that complimented the beef well! The Mongolian beef was some of the best my partner had ever had. We both chose white rice to accompany it and couldn't finish.. definitely got to take home lunch for the next day as the portions are very generous!  Our server was polite and attentive, getting us refills and offering to box our food for us. By the time we finished the meal the crowd had died down and the back of the restaurant was pretty empty.   I will definitely be returning to try some of the chicken and shrimp dishes!

The service here is always great, but every time I go here I am disappointed by the taste of the food. Prepare for the whitest version of every dish you've ever had. I can honestly say I enjoy Panda Express more. The food is just as greasy. I give it a meh outta 5.

The restaurant is clean and inviting. Two stars for that. The food, bland and greasy. I have been to Chinese buffets with better food. Three people serving a table of 7 and not one knew who got what. My order was left out almost entirely until I reminded them what I ordered. By that time I couldn't remember. No drink order was taken or asked.

Great HH specials! The 7 of us ordered delicious cocktails and Tiger/Tsingtao beer...  Everyone enjoyed the lettuce wraps (chicken and tofu), wings (takes ~20min), crab puffs, Mongolian beef and spring rolls. Everything was tasty! It is newer so a slight wait on our server as it got more busy for HH and dinner. It is a cute place and cannot wait to use the patio when it gets cooler. Expect us to go there again!
Very good. .. glad to see / eat  fresh hot food. Very polite and well kept. I will be back

Flo's is a role model for other restaurants and this one is sure no exception. The service and the food  are consistently excellent. You can tell that the staff has been extensively trained in customer service so you leave as a happy customer.   My favourite item on the menu is the shrimp pad thai.   I also like the fact that they have lunch and dinner portions.  Some other reviews mention that this location will close within twelve months.  I strongly doubt it!
Great happy hour daily from 3 til 7...Consistently excellent food and service...My favourites are: hot and sour soup, red curry chicken, chicken satay appetizer, mojito, shrimp pad thai...Enjoy!!!

Their service was really bad. We got our appetizer almost 40 minutes after we ordered!! Also Their cocktails tasted more like juice than an alcoholic beverage! Overall not a very satisfying experience

Like Christopher H., I think Flo's. Well, I think Flo's kinda blows actually. Great open, modern room. Quick and friendly service. Affordable prices But the food? Bland and predictable. Kinda like network television. Or a Will Smith movie. I gave the extra third star to Christopher's 2 because when I lived at DC Ranch, it was uber convenient. Cuz once I was holed up at home after a long day at work, dining choice were slim pickins. One huge reason I'm happier living in CenPho. The Mongolian Beef and spring rolls were my usual. And if they were fantastic, merely thinking of them should get my glands to salivate. But alas. No salivating. No Flo's. Adios and Dim Sum.

Visited on a Friday during lunch with some co workers. I ordered the orange chicken with brown rice. Few others entrees looked delish and would like to try some different dishes even tho orange chicken is my fave. One hiccup a few of us ordered brown rice but they gave us all white rice. Anyways I would like to go back and try some lunch specials or maybe happy hours appetizers.

Best lettuce wraps anywhere. Best tom ka gai soup anywhere. Pad Thai Satay is so completely inauthentic, I mean COMPLETELY different than real Pad Thai, but you know what, it's so damned good that I could really care less, and order it almost every time I go there. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Second only to her other restaurant, Flo's Asian Kitchen, five miles down the road. I really wish she'd open a location closer to ASU, where I lived. Three of her four locations are all a stone's throw from one another, all in Scottsdale. They're all excellent, and all half an hour from where I live(d). The exception is the airport location, and don't even get me started on that mess...

We had dinner with another couple at Flo's, based on the reviews we read here. Unfortunately, 2 stars is about all I can muster. The food was as lackluster as the service. Spring rolls were quite greasy (meaning they hadn't been drained adequately at best); and the four dishes we tried were distinctly uninspired. Flo's would certainly not be my first choice for Asian food in the Valley. And I doubt that anyone in our party will be returning. If you're searching for impressive Asian cuisine, skip this place.

I too have been a loyal fan of Flo's for more than a decade, eating here every week for awhile when I worked in the area. Sadly, I can't say I'll ever eat here again. It's true, prices have gone up and the quality and consistency has gone way down.  The boyfriend and I visited twice in the past couple weeks. The first time, the only thing we really liked was the white rice and General Tso's (spelling?) Chicken. It was sweet, savory & spicy. The other menu items were a fail. Spring rolls were tiny (like as long as my pinky finger!) and I believe $4 for just TWO. The brown rice was mushy and overcooked. The Orange Beef was bland. Their orange sauce is definitely not as good as I remember, which used to be my favorite.  The second visit, last night in fact, we ordered General Tso's Chicken and Mongolian Beef. Unfortunately, the brown rice was again overcooked. C'mon guys... if I can make good brown rice myself with a crappy $30 rice cooker, what is your excuse?! The General sauce lacked the spiciness of the previous visit and was just OK. The Mongolian sauce was good, but the beef was mushy. It seems like they might soak it in meat tenderizer for a LONG TIME. Very weird consistency.  Seriously pains me to say that I won't be back. Very sad.  :(
Food was bland service was good music was too loud. We hoped to find a new Chinese restaurant but this place won't make our list.

I like this location.  Flo is often here herself and does a good job of making the rounds though not to every table.  The sizzling rice soup was very flavorful - it "sizzled" unlike a recent experience I had elsewhere - and was chockablock full of veggies and chicken and shrimp. Yum!  The cinnamon shrimp was inspired! Really interesting flavor combinations. The chicken katsu was tasty.  Nice decor. Nice people. Clean. Fair pricing. Always happy here. A good alternative to the national chains.  Would have given up 5 stars if not for: a patron had a "service" dog. Now, I have no idea whether the person needed the animal or not. There was no indicator that the animal was "in training." I'm not judging because these animals play an important role in our society. My objection (and I'll admit I do not know all there is to know about service animals and how people are to interact with them - or not) is this: the animal had its harness on and Flo and some servers were lavishing the belly-up dog with attention including aggressively petting it and letting it lick them. My understanding is: harness on = dog is working and should be left completely alone by everyone other than the handler; harness off = "play time" only with the handler's consent. And, this is a restaurant! So, hands off the animals because your hands are on peoples' food!

Tonight was our first time trying Flo's. We arrived during happy hour so appetizers were half price and we ordered the crab puffs. I had the Kung "Pow" chicken and my husband had the orange chicken. We also had the chocolate won tons for dessert. I can't complain about the food. It was good. It was a large portion for the price and it was hot food. It was fine but unremakable. Didn't blow me away. What DID blow me away was the service. It was outstanding. Our bus boy was so great I gave him a tip. We were well taken care of and I would go back.

I came here for a girl's afternoon out with my boyfriend's cousin on a Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised to learn about the Saturday special. It was $6.00 at the time, but I've learned that the price has since risen to about $8.00.   This was my second time here and both times were good experiences.   Service: The service was solid. While there was nothing spectacular that happened, sometimes that's a good thing. The waitstaff are consistent with their smiles and politeness. They make you feel welcome even when the restaurant is very crowded. My water and iced tea were filled up constantly.   Food: Flo's is made out to be a fusion-type place, but we chose meals that were pretty standard: a red curry and a chicken stir-fry. I'd say that the quality and authenticity of the food was somewhere between a fast-food place and a home style restaurant. I would eat here again. The Saturday special started with a salad before the actual entr√©e was served.   Ambiance: It's fancier than most Chinese restaurants. You could come here for a business lunch, or just a lunchtime date in shorts and a t-shirt and you wouldn't feel out of place. It's clean too which I really appreciate.   I'd come back here.
Appetizers are 4 stars pretty good for Asian food. The entr√©e are blegh :( tried it twice and both times the noodles tasted oily and beef was gamey. In the end I will not return except happy hr.

Seriously--it is as good as it gets!  Even my 3 and 1 year old sons loved it! I couldn't believe how fresh everything was.  I'm usually not a fan of Asian cuisine because it usually tastes processed and too salty for my liking.  But we tried 7 different dishes at Flo's and every single one was cooked fresh and seasoned to perfection.  The staff was friendly and attentive as well.  Can't wait for our next experience there.

I met my buddy MT here for lunch. He suggested it and I'm glad he did. I like this place, a lot. First, it's beautiful. Well, if modern colors and lines with a contemporary feel is beautiful to you, this is the place. I liked it the minute we walked in the door. We were greeted immediately and taken to our table. Our server, Blaze, was soon at our table taking our drink orders. $2.50 for ice tea is spot on. Very good green tea I would like to say. MT ordered the Shu Mai ($6) to start. Lovely little steamed pork dumpling. Full of tasty puree'd pork with a ramekin of sweet & spicy dipping sauce. A tad salty but overall this was a great start to our lunch. MT ordered the House Pan Fried Noodles ($9). He said his lunch was good. I was impressed that our entree's came with a small house salad. Nothing special but for the price this little add on was perfect. I ordered the Lo Mein ($8.50) subbing in Thin Rice Noodles with a mix of Vegetables and Roasted Pork. The noodles were delish, the veggies were a combo of steamed broccoli, zuchinni, bean sprouts and napa cabbage. The pork was long strips, seasoned fine but a tad overcooked. In addition was a half baseball size pile of brown rice. All in all a very good dish. Lots of Gluten Free items on the menu as well as Spicy and/or Vegetarian choices. Happy days. Great Service, really good food, fair prices (lunch), beautiful space. 4 Stars

FINALLY - a sit-down place @ Promenade that knows how to handle a lunch-time business crowd.  We were in awe watching everyone move and dance and flutter around the dining room like a well-rehearsed balet.  It was amazing!  Within 40 seconds of sitting down, we had salad, wontons and water in front of us.  All in all, we were in and out of there in about 35 minutes.  Flo - PLEASE go to your neighbors at Pasta Primo and show them how it's done!  As far as the food is concerned, perfect lunch sized portions.  I had the pepper bacon shrimp (or something to that effect) and it was very tasty.  My co-worker thought it was spicy peppers, but it was coarsely ground black peppercorns.  A unique flavor and very well put together.  My co-worker had the garlic chicken and she was happy with the dish.    All in all, a positive lunch experience @ Promenade.  They know how to do lunch there at Flo's!

Flo's is my favorite Chinese restaurant in Scottsdale.  The best time to go is for Lunch at 2:50pm.  Lunch special reduces the cost buy a couple bucks and comes with crunchy chips and an asian salad.  Chicken is very well prices ($7.50) which includes the chips and salad. Lunch special ends at 3 so get there a little before, but happy hour begins at 3 (2 for 1 appetizers and drinks) so I try to time it so I get both.  They do take out and have great sized dinner proportions.  Everything is good.  My favorites are the kung pow (mandarin) chicken, teriyaki chicken, sweat and sour chicken, mongolian beef, broccoli and beaf, dan dan noodles, shrimp lo mein.  Everything is good.

Funny that I saw other comments that are the exact same reason I only give this location 1 stars. Our server was Katie. She was nowhere to be found most of the time. She didn't seem to care that we were one of her tables at all. I had to chase someone down to get water for our table as we were there for about 15 minutes before we were even acknowledged. When we finally met Katie, she took our orders and disappeared again. Our food took forever to get to us and came out a plate at a time instead of all together.   My friend ordered a glass of wine and she brought her the wrong (more expensive) one and my friend didn't catch it until she saw her bill. When we told her about the mistake, she talked to her manager and had it fixed but said "pay more attention next time". Great customer service, lady. We were there for two hours (because it took us way too long to get our food) and saw Katie probably 4 times. This is one of many negative reviews I saw for Katie and she still works there.. go figure.   Love the Tempe location, but I'll never go to the Scottsdale one again.

Best Asian food I've had in a long time. I love it that it is right around the corner. This place is always full when I go, even though I always get take out. I get the Mongolian beef, which is amazing. I definitely recommend this place to everyone I know if they are in the area.

Amazing! I'm not a typical Asian food lover. Its something I have to be in the mood for. I was in the area at a doctor's appointment and I asked the office where I could find some good healthy food and they said Flo's, right across the street.  I figured I would try it but never expected to find the best Asian food I've ever had! If you want fresh food, excellent service, a large menu, a well kept/ clean, good prices - place to eat - try Flo's. You will not be disappointed! Thank you Stephanie for taking such good care of us. You are wonderful. We will be back to experience more yummys!

I used to go to her Scottsdale location and it was always very good.  The Tempe location is equally good, excellent service as well.  So l am so glad Flo is also on this side of the valley!  I'd like to give it a also a 5 star  but the warmth is lacking at the Tempe location.  The bar had the most annoying speakers right above our heads. We asked to move to another table.  Now past this element, l highly recommend Flo!  They have Happy Hour every day (great choices from their starter plates) and fantastic cocktails or top shelf choices at 1/2 prices.  You can bet that dish you will order will be outstanding.

Pretty tasty food.  Service was great.  Shrimp Ph√∂ was tasty and had a ton of shrimp.   They don't have the ph√∂ soup spoons though so you just get a small soup spoon - can't make the perfect bite with it!  Hubby had the chicken Katsu and subbed plain white rice - he loved it.  So, yeah, we were happy!  Will definitely come again.

Katie is the best. We have been coming here since they were in DC Ranch. She always acknowledges how much my kids have grown over 10 years. We live near the Flos on FLW but always travel further to see Katie. The food is excellent the service is better. Happy Hours are the best!  Try the FloMo pineapple drinks. If your not sure what you want, Katie will recommend and you will never be disappointed. Can't wait to go back

Service was top shelf, but the kitchen let the hard working wait staff down.   We ordered the lettuce cups, which were solid. Had I known what was to come, I would have stopped right there.  Entrees were Fried Honey Beef and Sizzling Rice Soup, both bordered on inedible. The beef was fried to the point of being devoid of any moisture whatsoever. Effectively beef jerky when it reached the table. The soup should be retitled "wet chicken with stale rice crispies". No flavor at all. I should have known when the sizzling rice didn't sizzle when dropped in.  This place gets lots of good reviews, so maybe I caught them on a bad day, but this meal wasn't even in the ballpark of decent.  2 stars because the waiters really did try hard. The only way they could have provided better service would have been to warn me and the entrees to come and helped me bail out after the appetizer.

I have heard great things about Flo's restaurants, so imagine the excitement I felt when I saw Flo's Asian Kitchen across the shopping center at dinner time!    We decided to check it out and, to sum it all up, the service was fantastic, but the food was a bit of a let down.  Maybe my expectations were too high, but I didn't find any of the dishes to be anything more than average.  The sauce with the crispy & spicy chicken was salty and lacked any real heat.  The chicken itself was prepared fine, but it was not unlike any other chicken breast that has been pounded, breaded in panko and fried.  The green curry was good, but I there was not enough coconut milk in the recipe and the dish was very heavy on the onion.  I also wished there was more of the green curry sauce....lots more.  The service is what redeemed this visit.  We were greeted and then seated immediately after we entered the establishment.  Waters were brought to us with out having to ask, including a small cup with a lid for our daughter.  Our server was completely on the ball with taking orders, refilling drinks and checking back with us to make sure we were taken care of.  The service she provided was good enough that I might be willing to give Flo's Asian Kitchen another go....maybe.
Love, love this place for good Asian food. The atmosphere is a good place for a first date or nice evening out with your sweetie or girls day with your bffs.

its hidden away in a shopping area but once you enter the decor is very nice (totally did not expect it). we were seated immediately during happy hour and there werent too many people there. our waitress greeted us with a smile, informed us of the specials and took our drink orders. she returned promptly and took our food order (even the steamed carrots we specially ordered for the little one). the crab rangoons were small but very tasty. he ordered the yakisoba w/chicken and i went for the teppanyaki beef over flour noodes--both were very good and filling! the waitress came over and check on us a few times then brought us our check as soon as we asked for it. since we were using a Groupon we weren't able to take advantage of the happy hour specials (1/2 off apps & drinks)--we'll def be back to try those!

I have eaten at the Flo's in North Scottsdale since I was a kid, so when I saw their sign up in Tempe, I got pretty excited. I told my friend we had to come here for happy hour because they have fantastic deals - half off almost all apps and half off all drinks, yes ALL drinks... awesome! I had the mandarin oriental and my friend had the tytini. Her drink was... odd. It wasn't bad, but it didn't taste like anything I have tried before. My drink was very tasty, sweet, but not overly so, and easy to drink. For 4.50, you can't beat it. We also decided to get 3 apps, which have been very delicious at the other location including the pork potstickers, the spicy/limey Lao lettuce wraps, and the spring rolls. The Lao lettuce wraps were as tasty as I remembered... I like how the chicken has a lot of flavor from the chilies, lime, and spices and it's especially good with some potsticker sauce on top. The other two apps were horrible failures. The potstickers up north are typically fried, these were steamed, which isn't a problem except they tasted... off. Like something about them was bad. They were inedible and we left them behind (which is kind of a big deal if you know me because A. potstickers/dumplings are one of my favorite foods and B. I never leave food behind, either it's eaten or boxed). The spring rolls were greasy and flavorless. I hope the lack of deliciousness was due to the restaurant just opening. Regardless, I would return for happy hour drinks if nothing else.

What happened Flo's? I have been coming to Flo's for many years, even had my sister in law's baby shower there (which was great and affordable!). I was in the shopping center today and decided to pick up some of their delicious wonton soup for dinner, as I have a bit of a cold, and I always liked their pork wontons, the delicious julienned ginger and carrots, the spinach, the shaved garlic....perfection for wonton soup. I got home and opened the soup....what is this?!?!?! It was like the generic wonton soup you get at any take out place or from the frozen aisle. It had thick cut carrots and 3 peas, but no other veg, no scallions, no ginger, no garlic. The wontons were like shrimp balls....I don't like shrimp and was expecting pork. This soup was not even a shadow of what I have had here before and was not good. I am so disappointed. I don't know if this is due to it being take out (which would be ridiculous) or if they ran out of their normal soup (slightly better) or they changed their soup completely to this bland garbage (worst case scenario). I was thoroughly disappointed and won't come back soon.

I always love to dine at Flo's!  If you have several friends-even better-so you can dine family style and share such satisfying dishes as Mu Shu Pork, Orange Beef, Sweet and Sour Chicken.  It is speedy service-so great for a quick lunch.  HH is also 3-7 daily.  Works for me!

I came here for lunch one day since it's down the street from my work.   I ordered the chicken Katsu. Instead of white rice it actually comes with friend rice which I thought was a good twist. The Katsu was good. Remember this isn't Onos or L&L so you're not going to get the best Katsu ever. But it was good. For drinks I got the Mandarin Oriental. Omg! For $9 a drink, you definitely get your money's worth. I actually thought it was a bit too strong. Each sip was like taking a shot each time.   I thought their dishes were a bit pricey. We're talking around $12 a plate. It would be nice if they had lunch specials. They have a very big menu so there's definitely a lot of items to try.

Our dinner started out a bit rocky, but then got better.  My friend and I ordered some potstickers, and they were just ok, very small. They came with our dinner. I told the server I didn't like peppers, and she said I could order the vegetables I wanted, so I ordered the pork with eggplant, no peppers, but with broccoli instead. When everything came, my friend's tatsu chicken was good, but my dish came with green peppers. We asked the busboy to bring sweet and sour sauce and brown rice, but he never came back. When the server came to check on dinner, I told her about the peppers so she took it back. She asked if jalapenos were ok, and I said definitely NOT! It should say on the menu that there are jalapenos in the dish. When I finally got it, it was very good, and she brought me brown rice on the side.  Fairly good food, with some snafus in the beginning! Would I go back? Possibly

Food was average and I was rushed to leave because of the time, couldn't really relax and enjoy my food because staff wanted to go home.  I asked about the hot wings and she said they would take about 20 minutes and they were closing down and about 30 even though I had told her that I had come to try them. Ended up ordering something I didn't really want, and they kept coming to my table it was annoying. More than likely will not return to this restaurant.
Holy geesh this place is amazing. So many gluten free options! Healthy too! So good. Coming back for sure. Happy to have this place in the neighborhood.

Got the Panang curry, Thai basil chicken, and the chocolate won tons for dessert. So good! I'm a curry critic (love my green and panang) and I liked this one. Would go again and love that it close to my house. Nice ambiance as well.
11:53A... 20 people standing outside waiting for restaurant to open at noon and staff inside laughing and dancing.  POOR customer experience.

We have yet to be disappointed  in Flo's after at least 30 visits to this restaurant. My favorite starter is the calamari with peppers. The batter is so light on this dish and the spices have just the right amount of zip. I have never tasted calamari done better than Flo's. The service is always prompt and friendly. The dining room almost always seems to be full and everyone around us looks very happy. Flo's has to be doing something right to be so busy. Some of our other favorite dishes are the coconut chicken soup, a delicious classic Thai dish or the spring rolls. Any of the stir fry dishes are exceptional and I can honestly say we have never had an entree or appy we haven't thoroughly enjoyed. Flo's is one of the most consistent if not THE most consistent restaurant in the Valley. I do miss the yummy almond cookies they used to serve with your check but the fortune cookies are still a fun way to finish up a great meal and what a value. Two can dine for $20.00 easily and go home with leftovers. Compared to P.F. Chang's ( I am not a Chang's fan) Flo's is a winner.
Amazing service. Haply hour is excellent! The long islands.. NICE!! Everything i have had on the menu has been great. Really enjoy the staff.

Impressively, every single dish was excellent and our waiter Doni was really nice. My husband and I love the Spicy Chicken Basil , Kung Pao Chicken and the crispy vegetable & chicken egg rolls are fantastic. The food was fresh and has a lot of flavor. We enjoyed it. You should check it out... Highly recommend!!! Thanks Doni!!!

Went for lunch- haven't been for YEARS and remember it being good when it opened.  MEH.  Lunch salad was a handful of lettuce from a bag with some ok dressing on it.  I had the red curry- ok taste, but lacked sauce and the chicken was ICK.  Slimy almost and fatty- not even sure it was real chicken. No spring roll included- just some crispy won ton strips.  Totally disappointed.  Won't go back.

I really had high hopes for this place because it had good reviews but this food was completely bland and tasteless.  As an appetizer I had the spicy wontons which were not spicy at all but had more flavor than anything else I ate. Service was good.  It was a bit pricey and no flavor.  I won't be back.

I love this place! It's one of two Flo's within about five miles (the other is at the Scottsdale Promenade, and from what I understand the menu/focus is somewhat different).  This one is at McDowell Mountain Village (same strip mall as an AJ's)  kind of a corporate hangout for people who work in the area, like myself.   They've recently changed and expanded the menu a bit, and it includes more vegetarian options (yay!) I especially enjoy the Crispy Tofu and Vegetables. Each meals comes with a green salad with the world's most delicious dressing -- kind of spicy, kind of sweet. The wontons with dipping sauce are also delish.   Service is quick and friendly. Parking can be an issue, and the place fills up fast during weekday lunch hours.

This review is a tad jaded as we went there on Christmas Eve and the wait was long!  We waited well over 30 minutes and they do not provide device to summon one back once table was ready so we had to hang around the front door. While the food was good the noise level was horrid and made table talk almost impossible.

It's odd that this excellent restaurant is classified as Chinese, as it's really pan-southeast-Asian, with standard Chinese dishes being rounded out by Thai curries, pad Thai and Pho. Everything I've ever had here is outstanding. They are always busy but somehow manage to get you into a table without much waiting. Flo herself is often there and mingles with the customers. She obviously cares that you're enjoying your meal. There's a real pride of ownership.

Having been to the Scottsdale location about 6 months ago we gave this location a try. Straight-up, it was LOUD including screaming kids on a Saturday @6pm (PEAK). Our server was great and tended to recommend veggie dishes, which this body could use more of. I had the Yuxiang Pork with eggplant per our server's suggestion...great, with a delicious sauce! The menu is quite varied including Curry's & Thai options. Happy Hour will get you ridiculous prices for Apps & Drinks....think, 21.6oz TsingTao beers @ $3!!! plus crab puffs & pot stickers as well for half price!....our party easily over ate apps and were then presented with family sized entrees. I tend to judge chinese places by the Hot & Sour soup...in this case, Excellent!  I say plan on sharing or over eating, your choice.

I liked the layout, it was spacious. It was busy but that was to be expected for a Sat. lunch. Seems all the dishes were $6 for some reason that was good because they were not worth $8-$9 as printed on the menu. You get a salad starter which was tasty. You also get a big pile of rice, like half the plate. I ordered the Twice cooked pork. It was marked as Hot & Spicy but was not. It was decent but most of the veggies needed to be cut smaller. Oh, I'm not a fan of Green peppers and they sure do use A LOT of those.......simply 3 stars for me nothing outstanding.

I used to come here a long time ago when I worked up here on rain tree and the 101.  It's been atleast 5-6 years. Best thing about this place is that it has not changed a bit with the quality of food and service. I really enjoyed this place, atmosphere, friendly service, quick food. We got here when it opened so it was not busy yet, but people started rolling in right away. I ordered my all time favorite teriyaki chicken and some crab puffs. Both were exceptional. I will be coming back regularly since I work in the area again. I recommend trying it out, it might not be your kind of place. But see for yourself, you shouldn't be dissapointed.

One of the managers at my job decided to treat us to Flo's for lunch yesterday. I practically did cartwheels in my aisle because a) I was determined to eat out on my Friday and b) I love Flo's. I can't recall if anything I have eaten there was subpar. I ordered the Pepper Bacon Shrimp which is mixed with tomatos, cabbage, and bacon. With this you can choose between white or brown rice, and it comes with their house salad. The dressing is spicy and unique. They also bring out wontons with a sweet and sour sauce. Between those and my affinity for chips and salsa, I will never have a six pack. Anyhoo, service there is speedy without you feeling rushed. That place runs like a well-oiled machine. It is nice when you go during your lunch hour because you are in and out within the hour, usually. My husband says their Mongolian Beef is the best he has ever had and since he comes from the Seattle with plenty of Asian food, I believe him. There lunches are on average $7-9. Not bad considering the amount of food you get. I can usually make a second meal with my leftovers. I wish they would bring a Flo's down to Central Phoenix so I could have it more often.

We were promptly seated by the hostess.  The place is decorated with both modern and ancient Chinese caligraphies that dates back to to Chin dynasty.  We order pot stickers (very finely presented), seafood soup (superb), but their entrees were weak.  Ma po tofu is a Chinese signature dish that ultimately test the chef's ability to paint their flavour but it was way too salty for my taste.  The red curry didn't have the spice that I am looking for but if you like the Japanese/Korean style curry then it would be ok.  We were served by four different servers with more attention by the bus lady since she came by several times to fill the water but the waiters who presented dishes were not attentive and left me to fill my soups.   I will have to alter the food at home with chicken broth to soften the sodium content.  My friend said it was ok but I couldn't eat it.  They didn't offer to package the food for us either and the place wasn't busy..Hmmm.  Am I expecting too much?
Been here Numerous times we enjoy the food and service has always been great, I am a big fan of thier Chicken Katsu and their fried rice is one of the best in the Valley...Keep up the good work!

My first Flo's experience as I do not live in this area. Pretty good Chinese. Not your typical east coast cantonese stuff. Black bean shrimp, beef & broccoli. beef wide noodle and soups were good. Fried rice is the white style fried rice so not my favorite. Really wanted to like the BBQ pork buns but was disappointed. Not white puffy dough but more like a jewish egg roll. I could deal with that but just was not all that tasty.  Pricey bot not outside normal Scottsdale prices.
Ordered food2go got home was very low quality and wasn't happy about my meal for the price
Walking distance from my house. Great portions. Great HH prices. Full bar. Spacious environment. I dig this place.

Let me be clear...the service at Flo's is wonderful. I ordered the Edamame, Spring Rolls and Won Ton Soup.  The Edamame was cooked well, but was just salted and needed garlic or something. The Spring Rolls were just ground chicken with really no vegetables or too little to make out. The texture of just ground style meat was not appetizing. The Won Ton was a huge portion and had large won tons with a whole shrimp which was nice, but they were too big for your mouth and too hard to chase in the broth to cut. I tried to just bite one on the spoon, but it was difficult. The iced tea was excellent!  I REALLY wanted to love the food since the staff was so wonderful, but it just wasn't what I expected.

I have to admit at first I was pretty apprehensive but it turned out to be a pleasant experience food is pretty pricey but well worth it Large portions my overall experience was great I would recommend for some good Asian food

Yum Yum Yum!!! This is a newer place in Tempe, a sister property of the one in North Scottsdale.  Having been to the Scottsdale location I was hoping for good things when I saw the Tempe location opened in the Whole Foods complex.  They did not disappoint!  Food is extremely fresh, Asian flair, I had the Pad Thai with shrimp, calamari (not great) but overall a very good experience with good staff!  Would definitely return!

Tasty Chinese (Asian cuisine) at an affordable price!  Living here in the valley, I have always struggled to find Chinese food that isn't greasy, but also isn't over the top expensive. Flo's is it! Tried it out last night and everything we ordered was delicious. Sizzling rice soup was especially good, and I would highly recommend the beef chow fun.   Service was a bit slow, but it may have been because they were so busy.   I will go back!

As a  a long time Flo's customer the new layout of this location is horrible. The hostess stand has been moved to the side allowing waiting  customers to flow into the dining room and lean against your table while you're eating.     Absolutely refuse the first table behind the hostess stand it is a miserable experience. When I complained about it Flo said its because they were busy. Well on my job when I earn the money that I spend at flos I can't provide poor customer service just because we are busy. Bottom line with flos is they have gotten too big,  making money is more important that the client experience.   Find another establishment until they put clients first

Flo's is my favorite place to get Chinese in the valley. This location, especially. I am not a fan of the one in the promenade... The hot and sour soup here is AH-MAY-ZING. Oh my mouth is watering just thinking about it. The broth. The pork. The shrimp. The mushrooms. Sooooo good. I hate when I order hot and sour soup from a restaurant and it tastes like salty beef broth with peas and carrots and those canned bamboo shoot things. I also hate when it's the consistency of jello. But Flo's is always perfect. Just the amount of spice and vinegar, the perfect thickness, perfect amount of egg that's actually stirred in correctly and not just giant globs...  Their other dishes I've had are good too. The ingredients are fresh. Their noodle dishes are pretty basic tho, so if you like tons of ingredients, maybe don't get one. I however think they're delicious. My only real complaint about Flo's is the service. Everyone always seems extremely stressed out, from the hostesses to the servers. Maybe they need a few more employees? But it's not a big deal for me, I usually just get take out. Or lunch. And it's actually great for lunch, super fast, and fresh, and you totes get your money's worth!!

That was hilarious! The bartender's response wasn't what I expected. I post a lot of pics to social media that people enjoy. They say I have a great skill to "capture the shot." (Decide for yourself if my pics are good, IG: @jefferythomas)  When I first saw the lighting of the bar backdrop, I knew I had something I could work with. After dinner I ask the bartender if I could take a pic. Asking permission is really just a polite way of telling him that I need him to move out of the shot.  My idea of collecting raw shots that I could crop, manipulate and edit for the enjoyment of others was crushed with an abrupt and stern "No! We don't allow photography inside!"  I've never heard such a response to that question. I've never ask that question in a Chinese restaurant either.  Being so surprised, I had to pry into why. We've all heard the rumors of what constitutes Chinese restaurant food. He offered to go ask the owner if it was OK. Yeah, don't waste my time getting the confirmation "No!"  I'll pass. No pics posted supporting and promoting you guys.  Besides, I didn't like the dried out rice anyway.
Came here with my family for a Labor Day dinner. I've been to Flo's Promenade and I've gotta say that the flavors are much better at this restaurant. Authentic Chinese food and a great atmosphere!
Always solid choice. Had beef and broccoli pepper chicken and Kung Pow Chicken.  Spring rolls just so so

I would give Flo's 3.5 stars if I could.  Best brown rice I've had from a restaurant.  Consistently the hottest hostesses from lunch to dinner too.  Sometimes she has a really hot bartender girl too.    One of my favorite places for lunch - super fast service, and a lot of food for the money.  Also one of my regular places to bring home take-out from.  It's super-duper awesome Chinese take-out food.  That's not really saying a lot though.  None of the food here, besides the rice, is really all that great.  The only thing I've ever had from Flo's that was gross, though, was the Teriyaki Chicken.  It smelled totally disgusting.  Everything else though - pretty good but not great.  This particular Flo's is extremely ear-shatteringly loud when full.  Don't expect to carry on any sort of conversation in here at lunch.

I came here during HH so I could try a lot of different appetizers.  I ordered the shumai dumplings, Lao style lettuce cups, and calamari.  I thought everything was great!  The lettuce cups came with a LOT of chicken.  I think it was enough for about 4 people to share that appetizer.  My friend got the spicy wontons, shrimp skewers, and vegetable dumplings.  I tried those and they were also good!  But the spicy wontons weren't noticeably spicy at all.  I like that they take online reservations, even for Saturdays.  I'll definitely be back here again!

I frequent here because the location is very convenient. Some of the entrees are really good but some aren't. Their wonton soup, Thai chicken basil, lettuce cup, and Mongolian beef are good here. I didn't care for their curry dishes and chow mein.  The restaurant and the restroom is very clean and service is spot on. It gets busy here but never had to wait for a table.

This Flo's is located in the AJ's shopping center. It has larger dining room than the scottsdale road location. I love how clean and well decorated this restaurant is. The same goes for their other locations.   The garlic chicken lunch was absolute delicious and very satisfying. Had perfect amount of chicken to vegetables.  The Lao Style chicken lettuce cup, on the other hand, was very disappointing. It tasted like they just chopped  bunch of leftovers and threw some random sauce on it. It was salty and sour...just couldn't figure out what it was supposed to taste like. I've had their regular chicken lettuce cups in the past at this very location and remember it being quite good. Hence the 4 stars.  I'd recommend skipping on the Lao's style and go for the regular one.   The staff were friendly and efficient. We were out the door for lunch on a Tuesday in about 30 minutes. Will be back for sure!
Great food and a great happy hour. Half price appetizers from 3-7. Kimmy is a great bartender and always there with a smile and there to serve. Good Job!!

My family and I ate here just recently for the first time. The food was really good,  the service was OK. When food was being brought out the servers had table numbers messed up, we would have other peoples food be brought by our table asking if it was ours. I wasnt over joyed with the service but the food was awesome and we still enjoyed our selves none the less.

Wonderful service and an outstanding happy hour menu price list! Husband has picked up takeout for lunch from here a couple of times and said it was good. We stopped by tonight and ordered 4 apps and beers and our bill was incredibly reasonable due to happy hour. We had dumplings, calamari, shrimp skewers and pork slices. They were all yummy! We will definitely return when in the neighborhood. Thanks Flo's!
I just ate at Flo's and the service was amazing! The food was delicious and the ambiance was really nice.

Flo's offers good Chinese and Asian cuisine with friendly service at decent prices. Stand-out dishes: pine nut shrimp, red curry chicken (I get it with the yellow curry veggies + add water chestnuts - per the recommendation of a waiter), and orange beef. It can get very noisy when busy in the evenings. Happy hour pricing is good with mostly fried food options. It's fun to sit at the bar and grab a couple of drinks and dishes. I wish they offered vegetable fried rice as an option to accompany dishes for a reasonable upcharge instead of a whopping $8. Lunch is served with an included small iceberg lettuce salad (nothing to write home about) and I usually leave still hungry. Dinner portions are larger and more filling. Lots of gluten-free and dairy-free options on the menu.

My husband Todd and I were on a night on the town and decided to try out Flos. Boy was I surprised. Service was tremendous and I could not feel more welcome. Our bartender Cole was very friendly and made an excellent mai tai. We talked about professional scooter riding for a bit and were astonished that he was famous. Our food came at a very reasonably time and Collin was very cute and friendly. Our pot stickers were top notch. We will definitely be coming back to Flos!
The customer service here was beyond amazing. I never ordered food from here and the gentleman at the desk explained everything and was so kind!

The lunch portions are big and will give them that , but the service not so much! The only service we got from the waiter was taking our order and bring our check. I ordered orange chicken and a kids meal . Both good but nothing to wow about . I asked for a kids water with a straw and I never got it. The waiter asked me 20 minutes later if I still want that water. The food came at a reasonable amount of time , however they didn't bring the extra napkins that I asked for which is imperative when dining with children. It took another 10-15 minutes to get our check after the plates gone away . I put in $20 for a $15 bill and I was planning to tip 20%.  I waited another 10 minutes for my change to come back since the waiter was doing other things. He came back and asked if  wanted change and I said yes because there is no way I'm leaving a $5 tip for crappy service .  Then it took another 10-15 minutes to get my change. All i can say that will be my last time at Flo's.

I went to Flo's a few years back on a business meeting, and the taste of cuisine stuck in my head. I don't know why I waited 2 years to come back to this place, but I'm glad I did.  Oh it was one Friday night and I was having a bad hankerin for some Orange Chicken. Peaked on their menu online, and what-do-you-know? Chili Orange Chicken!  My boyfriend and I showed up at roughly 630pm, and was seated promptly. Ordered some sodas, beef/pork potstickers, and was not disappointed.   The potstickers were wrapped in a thick wrapper, and tasted almost of sausage. Nicely spiced, sided with a soy sauce and a garlic chili sauce. For my dinner I ordered my plate of Orange Chicken was around 11 dollars. It was enough to feed 2.  Came out with a bowl (side) of rice (choice of brown or white), hot and steamy. Let's just say I needed a to-go-box.  I'll be back to Flo's and make it my new Chinese food staple.  Half off appetizers from 3pm - 7pm 7 days a week. Our appetizer of 6 meaty delicious potstickers was $2.50. I mean, c'mon now! Flo's is the ish.
Worst spring rolls (thick rice paper and no veggies). Even though the service was great, the food was just expensive fast food Chinese.

I think Flo's deserves a 5 Star Rating! I have been frequenting this place for over 5 years now and they have maintained a consistentcy in both menu options, flavor of food and price! I cannot stand going back to a restaurant where they have changed their cook and the favorite dish is no longer on the menu, or it taste totally different (and usually in the 'not so good' category) than what I remembered, and on top of it, the prices have gone up $2 or $3 dollars!!!! Good Lawd!  . . .   Flo's Asian Kitchen has been good to me! One thing I would like to add also, is that in the 5 years that I have been going to the Promenade location, I have seen veteran staff members! Which means that Flo's must be a great working environment as well! The service has always been great!   I recommend the Chow Fun w/chicken & shrimp, or the spicy chow mein noodles. The lettuce wraps are a great choice if you are trying to cut down on the carbs! The menu is Asian diversity perfect!

So after being a patron for over 10+ years, I can definitely say  . . . Flo Girl? Ya'll losing it! The location on FLW & Thompson Peaks looks real nice and all but the food is not reflecting the flavor, presentation or taste you used to serve! I decided to try one of the winter specials and ordered the Spicy Beef & Basil Fried Rice! Where's the basil??? General folks would be saying, where's the beef? But there wasn't a lack of beef just basil! No basil or basil flavor present in that rice no where!  If I wanted beef fried rice, I would have just gotten that! Okay??!!!  . . .Then, I ordered Shrimp with Lobster Sauce and got Egg Drop soup with some added shrimp! I kid you not!!!! That chef ain't fooling me! I knows what you did!  Not that cost is an issue cause you gonna spend $30+ when you eat at Flo's! At least I do and generally gadly so! But I paid $15 dollars for some soup that cost $5. It's principal ya'll!  Yes! I got credited for that order honey! Hahahahaha . . .Trying to play me! Huh! . . .Over the years prices have gone up as it does everywhere else, but I always felt the food was complimentary to price! Maybe a little under priced!  But Flo, ya'll got me scratching my head and wondering what the hell is going on over there!  Get it together!  I see some major decline in business in your future honey!!!! I am telling you the truth cause I love ya!

Really poor service at the bar. Girl was obviously new but nobody offered her any support. Waited 30min to get another drink, at a 15 seat bar.  Food is good, but service and teamwork there is extremely poor.

Always a great experience, we do take outs a lot and these guys are always amaze me with how fast and attentive they are. Food is always so tasty and steaming hot! All sorts of delicious meat with fresh crispy veggies and the juiciest sauces! And I'm a huge fan of their chicken wings, so yummy!
Delicious Asian food. Randomly came in for a quick dinner. Everything tastes very fresh and portions were large. Highly recommend this place.

I had the Thai style catfish and it was so delicious. It has a sauce that resembles curry although it's not exactly like it. The fried rice it's absolutely delicious... I will definitely be coming back for more! Lindsay is excellent! Kevin, the store Manager made sure our meals were timely and our experience a great one! Thanks!!

This place is awesome! I had the Red Chicken Curry. The flavors were amazing! Never had curry that good. Everything seemed really fresh and cooked perfectly. There are plenty great dishes that you can chose from and the service was great. Ill defiantly be going back soon!

Flo's is a nice little spot with friendly service. As for the food- It depends on what you order. We got our last order to go and the girl at the front was very pleasant. We had crab puffs which are decadently delicious, and pork pot stickers which also were very good. We ordered a ginger dish that  originally was supposed to have beef but we substituted chicken. It was pretty tasty with nice slim pieces of chicken.  The orange chicken had a lot of breading on it and was served separately from the orange sauce, which I didn't really care for. The spicy shrimp dish we had was really tasty but came with absolutely raw broccoli.  Four dishes and two appys for just over $70 did seem a little pricey.

Ordered takeout on twice-cooked pork, chicken katsu, and pork pot-stickers.  Wife and I were most impressed by the good flavor profiles on the 2X pork and chicken katsu. (We liked that they used fusion flavors, not just the standard bland Chinese take-out seasonings we've experienced with other locals). Pot-stickers were small but OK. I would order take-out from Flo's again, for sure. I award this restaurant 5 * on flavor! Look forward to trying other dishes.  Also, I arrived at 5:00 pm on a Tuesday afternoon in mid-May, the bar seats were full for happy-hour and the restaurant had about seven 4-tops in play. That's a good sign, I think, especially as seasonal tourists are mostly absent.

I crave Flos sizzling rice soup! I have not had a dish here that I didn't like. The ambiance is nice, very clean. It can get a little loud and crowded, but they have take out if you are wanting to avoid any crowds.

Great food, huge restaurant and clean atmosphere. Server was basically there just to take our order so I'm hoping they tip out their bussers well. Never had to worry about being thirsty because the guy was always there to refill our glasses. The portions were huge, we were able to split the curry dish along with the lettuce wrap and the fried calamari. We even took it home for leftovers. Food came out fast and everything was absolutely delicious, I'd come back definitely.

Third time I've been here and second time they've messed up! Went here for lunch today with a coworker and ended up asking for our food to go because it took them the entire hour to make two chicken dishes. Get back to the office to find my order isn't even right! I ordered lemon sauce chicken but instead got katsu chicken. One of the worst dining experiences of my life!!

I had heard about this place for years but didn't try it until my wife said she wanted to try it. This review applies to all three locations -- Thompson Peak, Scottsdale Promenade and Tempe. I've been to the Thompson Peak location the most.  I had eaten here many times and tried various dishes and wasn't all that impressed. Then on one visit I discovered one of the best dishes I've ever eaten -- the Spicy Ginger and Onion Beef on white rice. This is the most flavorful thing I've ever eaten and sometimes the peppers (not sure if they're Thai peppers or small Jalape√±os) are really intense but I like it that way.  Years ago they used to have $5 lunch specials and you could have pretty much any dish on the menu, including salad and a bowl of wonton chips. This place was always packed and had lines of people waiting for them to open. Sounds good for business but I always wondered how they could make any money. That deal changed to a $6 lunch special and they still give you a salad but only a few wonton chips on the side with your entree. I don't even know if they have the lunch special anymore since the last several times I've been there hasn't been during Saturday lunch. Dinner portions are larger and more expensive but you don't get a salad for some reason.  There used to be a Flo's in Terminal 4 at Sky Harbor International Airport a few years ago; it was right before you went through security. I kinda wish it was still there for the times I've had to sit at the airport waiting for my flight.  I would give this place 5 stars but occasionally my favorite dish has been a little overcooked (including crab wontons on one occasion) or a bit off, lacking the flavor it usually has. On one occasion we had a really rude waitress at the Promenade location. She brought us our food and before my wife could even taste the Lemon Chicken she had ordered asked us how everything was. That particular dish seemed a bit off as she had ordered it before but our waitress never came back to the table until about 30 minutes later and when we told her about the food she said "why didn't you say something before now?" It's because you disappeared for 30 minutes you twit. My wife refuses to go to that location anymore although we went back once after getting no service at the Cantina Laredo across the street (see my other review).  However, more often than not we've had a great experience here.  I do wish they'd open a location on the west side of town as it's about a 30+ minute drive to all three locations. Takeout with that kind of commute doesn't work because my favorite dish doesn't reheat well. It needs to be eaten fresh.

Just ordered takeout and this is my new fav Asian spot. Cinnamon shrimp was uniquely flavored and delicious. Lettuce wraps were awesome. And chicken with fried rice hit the spot. Can't wait to return and try some other dishes!

Love the food here, happy choices were very good and they will make it as spicy or mild as you ask for. The service was very nice and attentive and the price was right and included a glass of wine, which was very good.. I will come back.

When my sweetheart's mother suggested an Asian restaurant called Flo's, he just about hung up on her.  Luckily for us, she stuck to her guns.  We absolutely loved Flo's!  In fact, we went there twice in December!  We tried several dishes, but our favorites so far have been the fried calamari (which has delicious peppers mixed in), the lettuce cups (which have a great kick to them), the egg fried rice with chicken (I rarely like fried rice at restaurant's - this was fabulous) and the pho was pretty good, too!  The pad Thai was really good at a level 5 once I added a ton more red chili paste. I just like it better elsewhere.   They have an amazing happy hour from 3 to 7 daily, which gets you 50% off appetizers and drinks!  I love a good deal. This one will have me coming back time and again.   It is really a cute restaurant, too!  Now you know what to get me as a gift... A Flo's giftcard!

Found this place courtesy of the yelp folks- thank you.  Started with lettuce wraps. I think the portion was easily sized for two - but I destroyed the platter. Really tasty and very hot! (Temp not spicy)The sauces were very good. There was a hot sauce with a texture of salsa but the taste of Thai hot sauces. Excellent sauces.  Then I thought I would try the tom yum soup. The bowl was large enough for 3 and filled to the brim.  The fresh mushrooms were very good, the shrimp a bit boiled.   Would have liked to try an entree but too full. Ordered chicken fried rice - to go!! Great, attentive service. The server was a bit snooty with an air of wanting to be elsewhere. But the rest of the staff was excellent.  Putting it on my places to try again

This is not good Asian food.  The veggie stir fry was terrible.  The rice was deplorable.  The hot and sour soup was very good - a bright spot on the menu.  If I was ever forced to come here again, I would order that.  Otherwise, this is genericized Asia food that is no better than the take out you could get at any mall in any state in the U.S.  And, the service was slow.  Not terrible.  Just kind of absent.

People really love this place.  Stylish?  Yes.  Good prices?  Sort of, more expensive than I thought it would be.  It is good, but I wasn't blown away.  I thought it was rather average.  Maybe I just don't like Chinese food that much.  I actually think I prefer PF Changs.

Flo's was highly recommended to me by a friend and it fell so, so flat. All of the wait staff seem to be in high school, and ours was no exception. They all had empty-hearted "how are you?" and didn't look at us when speaking. It was really uncomfortable.  It would have been fine if not for the food.  We ordered the crispy spring rolls, some pork dumplings, Spicy Thai coconut soup (Tom Kha Gai), and some beef fried rice.  The spring rolls were ok, however they were egg rolls. Why would you advertise as spring rolls?  The pork dumplings were just a ball of pork sausage and the dumpling casings were all falling off. I could only eat one.  The soup was really sweet, and not spicy at all. For spice level, it was 0/10. I even had my boyfriend test it, who hates spicy food, and he couldn't taste any either. I've had this soup many places before, and it didn't even match the description that Flo's listed. It was extremely disappointing.  The beef fried rice was really mushy and salty. I was hoping that they couldn't mess that up. I was wrong.  Our waiter did not check on us for a long time, and politely expressed that I was not satisfied with the soup and to take it away. My boyfriend was really hungry, so he kept the rice and asked for a box so we could leave. The waiter argued with me about the soup before taking it away.  Meanwhile, Flo was going around the restaurant talking to customers during our entire meal. She passed our table more than once. I was surprised she was not notified that we were unsatisfied.  When we left, we were not greeted. I have no fond memories of this place and all never return. The only reason I am leaving a two star review is because it was a clean place, and the food, while edible, was falsely advertised and honestly gross.
